Las esponjas que lleva para acolchar, dan bastante calorEl sonido sale de dos altavoces muy pequeñitos que salen de la diadema, para mi no es realmente bueno, ya que no quedan a la altura de las orejas, no se siente real, aunque le podemos añadir cualquier auricular externo conectándolo al jack de las gafas sin ningún problemaEl tracking es bastante sólido, lleva 5 cámaras que se rigen por inside out (no necesita de sensores externos para trackear el movimiento)podemos usar dos manos para agarrar cosas y no se pierde el tracking incluso subir las manos por encima de nuestra cabeza y funciona estupendamenteLa herramienta del pass through viene bien para según que ocasiones, en las que queremos ver lo que ocurre en el mundo real, por si nos salimos del área del guardián o cosas así, aunque lo podrían mejorar másEs totalmente recomendable para gente que no tiene ningún visor y se quiere iniciar en la realidad virtual. Totalmente compatible con la mayoría de juegos de la actualidad, Oculus Store, SteamVR, etc
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 9 February 2020

one_reviews_text: Over the course of multiple months, I've been dragged through the same troubleshooting steps multiple times by multiple clueless support staff who don't seem to even have access to earlier emails in the same email chain, as to know that their suggestions I've tried over and over again. I've spent more money trying to rule out any possibility that the issue is on my end.I had to manually reinstall an older version of the Oculus Software to restore functionality to my headset, but with SteamVR believing (rightfully so) that my Oculus Software is out of date, they won't function together. This means I can't play most of my VR games, including some of the big single player experiences I was looking forward to (this will become more pertinent in a moment).I logged into Oculus at first with my Facebook account, as linking the two is the direction Oculus want to (have been told to?) take things. The older version of Oculus requires an Oculus password be set, a process they have disabled because it shouldn't be in use anymore - they have a newer version that doesn't require it. The problem therefore comes from that any internet connection Oculus can find locks the headset up, meaning internet access has to be limited when I'm in VR.Which makes the problem of having the largest single player games (Alyx, Skyrim) clogged up behind SteamVR all the more painful.Whatever development issues they're having, big or small, there is a clear and easy temporary remedy - roll back to an older (for: older see: not broken) update THEN abandon support for the Rift S in favour of the Quest 2.If you've decided to abandon support of a product, don't break it first.Edit on 23rd April:They sent a replacement which is less functional then the prior one. In the four months I've been struggling with this thing, I have had to go through the same steps to fix it, provide the same information over and over again. I could not be less impressed with the tech capabilities of one of the largest tech companies around.If I could drop the rating down to 0 stars, I would.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 February 2021

one_reviews_text: A whole new worldA new fantastic point of viewNo one to tell us, "No"Or where to goOr say we're only dreamingA whole new worldA dazzling place I never knewBut when I'm way up hereIt's crystal clearThat now I'm in a whole new world with you(Now I'm in a whole new world with you)Unbelievable sightsIndescribable feelingSoaring, tumbling, freewheelingThrough an endless diamond sky
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 March 2021
review_title: It gave me a whole new world.

one_reviews_text: I very nearly gave up on this but so glad I stuck with it.Initially I thought I either had a faulty unit or my PC wasn't compatible.Failed to detect both cables on set up, but after waiting what seemed like an eternity for the software and hardware to update and then fiddling around in Windows device manager USB section I finally got them to connect.Then I had more issues with the cameras not tracking, more USB fiddling and uninstalling in device manager and I finally got that "wow" moment.I've been gaming since the Commodore 64 days and this is hands down one of the most amazing experiences I've ever had.It was so realistic I went to put the controller on a table and had to remind myself I was in the "rift" and that the table wasn't actually there !I'm giving it 4 stars purely for the difficulty in set-up.I build my own gaming rigs and am more than IT savvy, but I can see a lot of people returning these as faulty as the steps I had to take to get the Rift S working were not straightforward.My advice to anyone experiencing set up problems is to stick with it and use the internet to assist you, once you're in you wont regret it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 December 2019
review_title: Incredible, once you get it working

one_reviews_text: I’m not sure why, but I seem to have trouble with connecting the USB 3.0 cord to my PC. I even bought the oculus recommended USB 3.0 PCIE adapter to no avail.I ended up giving up and resorted to using the “incompatible” usb 3.0 port on my motherboard, and it works so far (have yet to experience any of the issues they warned me of).Perhaps this is just a me problem, so I’ll refrain from giving this anything less than 5 stars. I had a lot of fun with this baby. My OCD wants to figure out a way of connecting to my PCIE USB port because the constant warning messages resulting from me using an incompatible port bothers me too much.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 June 2019
review_title: If you can get it to work, you’ll thank your stars that you bought this.

one_reviews_text: Game and application availablity is great and the play is so smooth never any problems with controller pairing or lag.Using a 1080ti, intel 9900K, 32gb of Corsair vengeance ram and WD black 1tb nvme on windows 10 pro.The only issue I have is the 5m cable has been twisted through use to the point the conductors inside are damaged, a replacement is currently only available through oculus store for £79.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 January 2021

one_reviews_text: Dopo﻿ una settimana col Rift S devo dire di essere rimasto stupito non poco.L'immagine è CRISTALLINA, roba come Superhot si vede 10 volte meglio del mio schermo 2K, i sensori, a parte qualche piccolo momento di perdita di tracking, (giusto 2 volte in una settimana) si comportano benissimo! La zona di sicurezza impostata dal visore funziona perfettamente ed il movimento in essa avviene senza minimo problema od errore di tracking.Il visore è comodissimo e le "cuffie" incluse, incredibilmente, riescono nell'intento di sembrare vere cuffie.450€ ben spesi per adesso, devo anco﻿ra prova﻿re tantissima roba però. ﻿
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 2 June 2019

one_reviews_text: And it didn't feel like I ended up with an Ocu-loss.Yeah sorry. I like to pretend I'm funny. But lets get down to brass tacs, it's good. More noticeable visual and graphical improvements, plus less pixely than the CV2 edition I tried before this.The motion cameras work great too, it's nice to not need an individual sensor, and I had no issues with it not registering an intended movement. - I recommend getting a rechargeable wall plug-in battery pack to swap between two sets of batteries (4 total, each control uses 1), as the controls last about 6-8 hours max per battery.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 October 2021
review_title: Buying it did not cause a rift in my wallet.

one_reviews_text: I have an Oculus approved desktop.  There is a KNOWN ERROR causing the USB to drop connection with the headset.  I have tried so many things and Oculus support don't want to talk to me any more because they can't see why this is happening.  They will tell you to buy an alternative £20 USB card.  This made no difference.  They will blame the USB manufacturers for not patching their product.  They won't refund the money I've spent trying to get their device to work and have told me to "reinstall windows".  I am not going to reinstall windows on a stable machine.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 September 2019
review_title: Not Stable. Don't waste your money.

one_reviews_text: Coming from the CV1 my expectations were somewhat high due to forking out this price for an upgrade. I immediately noticed the difference of clarity and resolution was excellent. I had no issues with the IPD mines about 64.5mm. it's a very comfortable headset however I have ordered a cover for the headband. The interior camera tracking system is a massive welcome upgrade from the IR lighthouses it's predecessor had. The self contained tracking system is amazing and I have played through most of half life alyx, and played more movement demanding games such as best saber, Superhot and pistol whip. Not once, well that I have noticed anyway, has there been any issues with tracking. It's a tidy well self contained headset with a super simple and fast setup. An all round brilliant VR experience.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 April 2020

one_reviews_text: But besides the fact that it did not worked on my pc... ryzen 3600 rx5700xt 32gb 3200mhz ram...Amazon staff was awesome and they issued a refund for both the price I paid for the product + shipping fee and the price I paid for the shipping back to them. amazing support!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 November 2020
review_title: Did not worked on my pc

one_reviews_text: This is a good headset. It's not ground-breaking, but it's certainly not bad.The tracking is accurate enough that I personally couldn't fault it, it's light and comfortable and the set-up was quick and painless.I would recommend this for anyone that isn't too fussed about their overall experience. This headset will do most things faultlessly, and is fantastic for a quick VR experience.I've personally had a bit of a mixed relationship with this headset, however; I purchased it for specific game titles that it simply didn't agree with. I returned it in favour of an HTC Vive Cosmos [big mistake, never do this], but soon came back to the Rift S.This headset's platform does its best to constrain you to Facebook's proprietary sales platform. It does not officially support the obvious platforms, namely Steam, and so it is not uncommon for issues to be found there. Consequently, I have had plenty of problems that Oculus either could not or would not fix.Chances are I will be returning this headset as well.This simply isn't the one for me, and I probably will keep looking. But this really is a good headset, just not for me.If you are looking to buy, consider it. Consider it heavily.It's priced well, and it performs well.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 October 2020

one_reviews_text: I have found the oculus rift s to be very unreliable – once it’s up and running it’s pretty good, but before it starts to work I usually have to mess about restarting the oculus software, restarting the Oculus Runtime Service in “windows services app”, and switching the headset’s usb port on and off –sometimes doing these things several times in different orders before it finally decides to work. Seems to me there’s a software problem here as my hardware has remained unchanged, and is reliable with every other bit of hardware I have. Judging from online searches lots of other users have the same problems and the oculus people offer little in the way of help (or hope of improvements).Verdict: Quite a few people online report having no such problems, so you might be lucky and have no problems – but if you do - prepare for quite a bit of frustration.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 January 2021

one_reviews_text: This is a fantastic bit of kit. It opens up a whole world of new possibilities, not just gaming but also some other applications. I predominantly bought it for gaming and can honestly say I have been really impressed. Games like Half life Alyx, Boneworks and The room are great examples of what VR should be.My only gripe is that oculus are no longer manufacturing the Rift S and are instead continuing with the Quest. There are alot of games coming out now that are exclusive to the Quest only. A shame really.I highly recommend this product, but due to it being discontinued soon, I would recommend others buy the the Quest at nearly the same price.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 February 2021
review_title: Great, but soon to be forgotten by Oculus :(

one_reviews_text: I have only managed to use the Rift S once since I got it due to the "oculus software restart required" bug in oculus home, everytime i restart OH it askes me to do it again over and over again, having spent hours on the net trying different solutions, even resorting to a fresh install of windows, still the same issue.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 October 2019

one_reviews_text: Buying Used - GoodThe box was resealed with similar stickers from oculus and came with all the paperwork and accessories. Came with batteries already in the controller. had to replaced since the controllers had uneven charge. plugged into my pc and loaded up oculus's software and it worked a treat after wiping the moisture off the lenses. Then tried SteamVR to find it had a weird double vision issue but after many hours of fiddling and researching, I fixed it with some software.Other BitsI have played on 90hz HTC Vive so I thought it might be not as good with 80hz but I was so wrong. 80hz was butter smooth and the controllers tracked perfectly. so smooth i could not tell it was tracked by a camera and not by the lighthouse method.OverallGood value and performance would highly recommend
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 February 2020
review_title: Bought Used - Good and I saved alot and was impressed by the pristine condition

one_reviews_text: Very good vr headset but wait for a sale, as it isn’t worth £400. I would say the quest is worth £400 but you can pick up a standard rift for around £250 these days so another £150 to not need sensors and use one screen for the eyes rather than two isn’t really worth it.I’ve also experienced a few problems with the headset crashing or overheating. These can be fixed by changing some settings and making some adjustments, but I don’t need the headset killing my pc. Overall though, one of the better headsets on the market and as a user of both the HTC Vive and Oculus, I would say go for Oculus.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 October 2019
review_title: Very good headset but not as an entry point

one_reviews_text: VR headsets are still a bit heavy and clunky. But it's well worth getting just to play Beat Saber. Just make sure you have a decent enough PC to handle this. Also you will need an area 1m x 1m clear to game in. Larger area is better but that really is the minimum and you should be ok. Construction of headset and controllers are very good. With the box it came in so useful that I'm actually keeping it (which is a first).
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 November 2020

one_reviews_text: !!DO NOT BUY!!!Oculus has announced that the Quest will now have Tethering capabilities. Essentially making it a Rift as well as a stand alone headset. I have the Quest currently running SteamVR games and Oculus Rift games. Get the quest. It’s a no brainier...
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 October 2019

one_reviews_text: The Oculus Rift S has come in for some criticism since it was launched but for its price, and for what you get this is an excellent general use VR headset. I've found the tracking to be spot on and while the software took a little while to set up, once it's working, it works really well.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 October 2019
review_title: For it's price this is an amazing VR Headset

one_reviews_text: Ändere von 4 auf 3 Sterne:Da das neuste Problem ist, dass plötzlich das Microfon nicht funktioniert ändere ich von 4 auf 3 Sterne.Lösung: USB entfernen und neu einstecken. Lautsprecher funktionieren und Mikrofon funktioniert plötzlich nicht mehr. Support von Oculus nutzlus. USB funktioniert mit anderem Audioheadset, Festplatte, Drucker ohne Probleme--> Ich habe einen aktuellen Post auf Reddit gefunden, wo angemerkt wird, das alte USB Chips wie Z97 Probleme machen, da man damals die Treiber schrottig implementierte, weil USB 3.0 neu spezifiziert war.Achtet also auf gutes Mainboard mit funktionierenden und up to date USB 3.0.Ich für meinen Teil habe mir eine USB Karte für PCIe bestellt und hoffe das damit das Problem erledigt ist.Positiv: Oculus Rift S ist besser als die alte Oculus, weil die Orientierung im Raum nicht mehr durch aufgestellte Sensoren mit zwei zusätzlichen USB Anschlüssen erfolgt sondern über IR-Kameras direkt am Headset. Anschluss ist jetzt über 1xUSB 3.0 und 1xDisplayPort.Fliegengittereffekt im Vergleich zur alten Oculus deutlich reduziert.Headtracking und Kontroller super.Firmwareupdate bei Erstinstallation dauerte lange aber funktionierte.Negativ: Man nimmt immer noch viel in Kauf an Problemen. Alleine die Installation dauerte mit Lösungen über 4 Stunden! VR ist nur für Menschen die sich mit Windows, Technik und Google Fehlersuche auskennen.1. Geht etwas beim Setup schief werden immer wieder 7GB runtergeladen! Es half auch nichts den Downloadordner auf C: zu kopieren und wieder zu ersetzen. Ich hatte 10 Ansätze, was 70GB download bedeutet bei 6 MB/s.2. Am besten Virensoftware KOMPLETT deinstallieren und nach Setup wieder installieren. Auch Windows Bitdefender AUSSCHALTEN. ZoneAlarm auf einem sowie ESET auf einem zweiten Rechner führten dazu, dass Oculus nicht installiert werden konnte. Ich habe leider das Logfile nicht mehr aber bei Zonealarm lag es an der eigenen E..exe oder F...exe die das Abschließen der Installation verhindert (auch wenn ZoneAlarm disabled ist). Auch ESET verhinderte das Abschließen der Installation obwohl deaktiviert.Was es bei Bitdefender von Windows war, weiß ich nicht mehr, jedoch funktionierte die Installation nur nach Deaktivierung von Bitdefender. Findet ihr auch foreneinträge zu.3. Oculus Rift USB 3.0 Anschluß wird nicht erkannt. Kann viele Ursachen haben, bei mir wurden 2 von 4 bzw. 3 Anschlüssen nicht erkannt obwohl die mit Handy, Externer Festplatte, Maus funktionieren. Frontanschlüsse funktionierten auf beiden Rechnern gar nicht.4. Windows Sicherheit Kamera:  Unter Einstellungen von Windows "Zulassen, das Apps auf Ihre Kamera zugreifen" muss AKTIVIERT sein! Ich hatte das aus Sicherheitsgründen ausgestellt und die Rift funktioniert dann natürlich nicht. Eine Fehlermeldung oder ähnliches erhält man natürlich nicht, sondern die Rift bleibt einfach Schwarz.Im übrigen funktioniert die Rift S nicht im dunkeln Zimmer, die Kameras sind zwar IR doch im Dunkeln funktioniert das Tracking überhaupt nicht (ich stürtzte in der App in einen Void in Spiralen)5. Support: Oculus Support könnt ihr euch sparen. Die haben KEINEN Plan. Nutzt Reddit oder andere Foren wo euch Nutzer antworten bzw. die dort existierenden Threads6. Trotz Maximaler Powereinstellungen ist das Headsset oft Schwarz, keine Anzeige. Es hilft nur den Dienst "Oculus VR Runtime Service"  oder gar Rechner neu zu starten.Also "kurz mal Zocken" wird zu 5 - 15 Minuten einrichten durch Dienst neu Starten, Rechner neu Starten etc. versaut.7. Die Oculus Sofware erzählt ständig etwas von "Oculus Software Update" unter dem Tab Updates und Anwendungen können nicht gestartet werden. Der Update wird aber nie runtergeladen und ich muss die Anwendungen "Updaten", dann passiert 3 Sekunden nichts und ich kann die Anwendung nutzen. Nervig aber auch bekanntes Problem.Trotz der vielen Probleme ist die Rift S Ok, weil es eben keine einfachren Alternative zu geben scheint und HTC oder Steam/Valve ihre neue/bessere Hardware erstmal auf den Markt und under Beweis stellen müssen.Update 6. Jul 2019 nach 2 Wochen:Negativ:- Man sollte sich gut mit Windows und Forensuchen auskennen, denn die technischen Probleme in vielfältig und den Oculus Support könnt ihr vergessen.- Beispiele: Muss den Service zwei bis dreimal neu starten, ebenso Oculus Home, bis das Display angeschaltet ist.sowieso mein  Tipp: Den Sensor mit Doppelklebband blockieren damit das Headset bei auf und absetzen nicht abstürzt. Es gibt dafür auch eine Option bei einem der C:\Program Files\Oculus\Support\oculus-diagnostics Tools aber abkleben klappt besser- Ich habe pro Tag 3-4 Stunden gezockt , manchmal auch ausgesetzt. Motion Sickness immer noch großes Problem bei allen VR dingen, man gewöhnt sich drann und einfach öfter ne pause machen. Bei manchen rotationen oder wenn ich falle, schließe ich die augen oder wackel mit dem kopf- Batterien werden nach ca. 4 Stunden als Leer angezeigt und sind nach 5 Stunden fertig.- Manchmal stürzt SteamVR ab (alle 2 Tage bei 4h am Tag Spielzeit)- Bei einem Spiel funktionierte Tagelang nichts, Oculus Treiber aktualisiert auf Beta Program, wieder zurück, öfter mal neu gestartet. Nach 3 Tagen klappte es dann. Wie gesagt: Ihr braucht ne hohe Frustgrenze aber wer sich sowas kauft nimmt das mit in kauf denke ichPositiv:+ Tracking on Kopf und Controllern einwandfrei+ Tragekomfort gut, ich schwitze aber kein drücken oder Nackenschmerzen+ Support durch CommunityBesten Spiele für mich Stand Juli 2019 weil der Wiederspielwert durch Mods und Level-Editoren bzw. Gameplay super ist:* Onward* Climbey* Cloudlands Minigolf* Beat SaberSkyrim VR, Fallout VR, konnten mich nicht überzeugenArizona Sunshine ist mir zu krass... was mich zu dem Punkt bringt:Unbegingt controler anschnallen und GROßE Spielarena. 4x4 Meter empfehhle ich (das Kabel des Headsets ist 5m lange) - Bei solchen Spielen ist echt verletzungefahr wenn du schisshase wie ich bist...Deshalb ist auch "Five Nights Freddy" und "Doom" in den Steam Refund... da bekomme ich alpträumeLone Echo nicht gekauftSprint Vector: Gut aber tue mich mit Steuerung schwerPavlov VR stürzte immer wieder ab, Steam Refund ist ja ca. 2h, das Spiel ist sicher ok.Superhot damals für die HTC gekauft - sehr kurz aber super.Gorn: Headset in Wand versenkt, controller gegen schrank gedotzt. War mir zu Buggy vom Spiel an sichSpielbereich kann nicht groß genug sein."The climb" sieht super aus aber "Climbey" macht mehr Spaß.Sorry für die lange Spieleliste aber vielleicht hilft es jmd. Ich musste mich da erstmal durch kämpfen, was es so gibt.Oh: "I Expect You To Die" habe ich gekauft aber nur kurz angespielt kenne es von der HTC, ganz lustig aber kaum wiederspielwert.Fazit immer noch: VR ist nicht nur in den Kindersuchen sondern in der Kindergrippe und kann eben noch nicht alles was man sich wünscht und die Windeln muss man selber wechseln und mit dem Geruch klar kommen der manchmal aus technischen Problemen aufsteigt. Doch es ist das schönste und spaßigste VR was es zur Zeit gibt, die anderen Hersteller haben mehr oder weniger die selben Probleme (bekommt man viel mit wenn man Online zockt)--Aus der Rubik "Hätte ich das vorher gewusst":- Installiert euch Advanced Settings 3.x, SteamVR Input and overhauled motion bzw. OpenVR Advanced Settings , damit lässt sich SteamVR anpassen z.B. die Bodenhöhe im Spiel ändern, was z.B. nützlich ist, wenn Onward auf einmal die falsche Bödenhöhe hat und der Kopf in einer Warnung verschwindet
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 23 June 2019

one_reviews_text: Second unit brought same issues, Brought a pcie express usb 3.0 card still dont work, This pile of waste of 400 pounds is going back to amazon with no help from oculus on the issie of stuttering after 3 mins
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 May 2019

one_reviews_text: As some tech nerd, I enjoy collecting gadgets because I don't have a life. Even when they are not as good as advertised, as long as a product can fulfill its main purpose, I will endorse the product and love it like my own child.Unfortunately, the Rift S is not going to be one of them. I have owned the Rift S for 2 months now, and I can't say that I haven't enjoyed my time spent on the gear - but there are way too many small nuisances for me to recommend the Rift S to anyone.General design flaws:1. The Headset wakes your PC on the slightest movements.If you are the type of person that puts your PC to sleep, then the Rift S will do its best to guarantee that that will not happen. The cameras on the headset seem to be hypersensitive, and will constantly send interrupts to stop your PC from sleeping. (Yes there is a workaround, but why would you be expected to be using a workaround on a finished product?)2. The controllers drain your AA batteries when not in use.Controllers can not be turned off (or something like that). You'll probably need to stock up on your AA batteries (yes, the controllers use AA batteries).3. The battery lid will eject from the controller during intense gameplayMore reason to stock up your AA batteries; I always play Beat Saber in fear that one of the batteries will shoot out from its socket, find a comfy spot under my bed and decide to stay there forever.Personal negative experiences:The trigger button on one of my controllers started squeaking on the second day of owning the Rift. Instead of a rifle in my right hand to defend yourself from zombies or whatever, I now have a loud squeaking button to remind me to do my laundry before Monday, so personally, it has somewhat affected my immersion.I don't think this issue is very common, so it should be unlikely that every trigger button will have this issue.So overall, it is an OK headset, but it feels that FB just doesn't have VR figured out yet.If you have £300-400 to spare / you want to be one of the first ppl to experience commercial VR, then it's a nice niche to own. (Which is why I'm keeping my Headset, though it is very seldom used)However, if you want a more polished VR experience, I would suggest waiting for the next gen of headsets.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 February 2020
review_title: Technology is just not there yet

one_reviews_text: The hardware is beautiful and extremely well designed and engineered, but the software is sorely lacking. The drivers alone were a 12GB download and didn't run terribly well even on my PC which is well above the minimum recommended spec. If you're happy to only use the very few (and expensive) apps and games blessed by the Occulus store then they work fine. If you want to stray beyond that even slightly the experience is dire: for example, playing steam Occulus compatible games that I already purchased required two extra bits of software that I had to launch in the right order and were unstable once running. I'm going to come back to VR in a few years once the software has caught up.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 April 2021

one_reviews_text: The description is misleading as it states compatible with HDMI, but in reality it's only compatible with a Display Port (only available on high end graphics cards and high end gaming laptops). I'm giving the product 5 start because I've used one before and they're great, if you have the right specs. This review is hopefully to help someone not make the same mistake as me ;)On a personal note, I don't see why the Rift S can't have regular HDMI support .. But then I'm not a hardware developer, so what do I know!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 August 2020
review_title: Please state Display Port not HDMI

one_reviews_text: Fantastic VR headset, with a very stable image and no external sensors.The image is beautiful, and very clear, with no moron sickness.The controllers don't have the best grip for something you're swinging around, but that can be fixed with 3rd party covers.It uses inside out tracking so has no need for external sensors like the Vive or PSVR.Highly recommended, and a great price.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 March 2020
review_title: Fantastic VR headset, with a very stable image and no external sensors.

one_reviews_text: A lot better now with updates the tracking is very good and you don't need light houses the whole thing feels cheaply made but the exspace for under 350 pounds is amazing well with it just to see what vr is all aboutUpdate the right controller stop working and would not concent I got in touch with oclues and with in 8 working days had a new controller they ever cover cost to send fulty one back amazing customer service that I did not expect. Just for that I will stick with them
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 January 2020

one_reviews_text: This was a very fun product to use. I really wanted to test and try out VR and I think that this headset is a really good option for users to get into VR, however there are just some things about the product which really bugs me. Firstly, the headset is made from some cheap plastic that I recon would easy fracture with an accidental drop on the carpet, I didn't expect this low of quality material to be used on something so expensive. Secondly, you will need to tie the cable to the very back of the headset as the cable just falls down onto your shoulder else. Now onto the performance, overall it performed well however because of the inside out tracking the headset cannot detect very well when your hands are behind you, also during long periods of play time something weird started happening and the screen started warping and I had to restart the headset and clean off the cameras, I honestly don't know what happens however  I think that maybe the cameras stop detecting your position and glitch out your body, lastly and this one is probably just a general VR issue however I didn't realise how expensive all the games on VR really are, there are some good ones but be ready to splash out another £100.00 or more on games that aren't included with the head set.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 February 2020
review_title: I had this for a while, then returned it.

one_reviews_text: This piece of kit works relatively well if you just want to play games, but be prepared to idly swipe through messages each time you go to use it as you would wipe away the bloatware from a newly booted mobile phone. Pray to your God/s that you haven't ever used the 'change name' function on your Facebook for *any* reason whatsoever, because you'll be hit with an automatic ban, rendering the oculus account, the headset and any games you've purchased on Oculus unaccessable. The best you'll be able to do at that point is play SteamVR games, but Oculus' software'll be runnig in the background, asking you to log in - tied to one of the primary buttons as well, so expect that login request every time you accidentally hit it.One day I'll find out why my account was disabled, but neither company (Oculus or Facebook) deigns me important enough to know such heavenly, restricted information, leaving me to all but assume I did absolutely nothing and that an AI has just hit me with it's shotgun accurate policy violation detection software.If this hadn't happened to me literally the *day* after my return window has ran out? You better believe I would have slapped this £300 hat and it's pair of AA-battery powered maracas back into it's suitcase and gotten my money back. You also better believe that I'm still going to try - as a customer I've never felt this mistreated.Save up your money - Get the Vive - Screw Oculus
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 March 2021

one_reviews_text: Everything is OK, but the installation is takes many times (high speed internet connection needed) and it may be some hardware issues with some USB Root hubs. The Oculus did not provide usb compatibility list for Rift S...My experience:First of all, the VIA usb chips cannot work with this VR glasses. If only this vendor's chips available otherwise buy USB 3.0 or 3.1 expansion card with non-VIA usb chip and the USB-A connector is mandatory.The Microsoft driver (win10) for ASmedia USB chip is problematic and the Oculus software see as good, but cannot work with it . The newest factory driver needed to install to work.The VR glasses runs flawlessly on Renesas USB 3.0 chip.After the initial setup the VR glasses very good, safe (guardian system and pass trough feature) and easy to handle.I tested without problem with AMD Radeon RX 570 and R9 380 GPUs (4 GB). The R9 380 is not listed at the minimum specs, but works well.Overall I recommend this Oculus Rift S device.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 October 2019

one_reviews_text: Bought this as an upgrade from CV1. Was mainly interested in the better resolution and less usb connections as 3 USB3 ports is a lot. Worked ok for a few days although the new ergonomics are a step back and as others have said the blacks are less crisp than CV1. Screen dooring is reduced as advertised and godrays too.Thats the end of the good. The sound is tinny and leaks all over the room so you have to wedge some third party earphones over the headset to get any bass. New controller design gets in the way of shooting games (slide on most pistols is above the hand, right where the sensor ring is) also drawing bows loses tracking under the chin, RIP Skyrim archer build. Halo adjustment is never where you left it as any pressure makes it tighten.Now the biggy, the USB connection drops out all the time and asks you to connect to another USB 3.0. After 2 days of switching of power saving settings  and surfing reddit for answers all I can see is that It mainly happens when Discord is running. SO if you have no friends then this is the low cost VR solution for you. Seriously though as an early adopter of anything VR this caused me to not want to continue using this particular headset. Have re homed it with a friend instead of returning because maybe their experiance will be different and Oculus can improve over time, but for now me and my trusty CV1 can wait for the Steam Index in September.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 June 2019
review_title: Constant USB disconnect issues, marginal changes across the board otherwise

one_reviews_text: Leider ist meine alte Rift wegen einem Sturzschaden nicht mehr.Hier der kurze Vergleich:FoV ist kleiner, USB Stromversorgung macht Probleme(Meldung: DP nicht angeschlossen), Audio ist zu leise und Kopfhörer passen nicht über den großen Haltering. Außerdem habe ich leider einige Pixelfehler im Display.Außerdem habe ich Trackingprobleme, egal bei welcher Beleuchtung. Warum kein mechanischer IPD Regler vorhanden ist und die Kopfhörer der alten Rift nun fehlen ist mir völlig unverständlich.Beim Simracing stört mich, das ich mich nun mehr umsehen muss, und das die Fahrgeräusche schlechter wahrzunehmen sind, da weiter vom Ohr entfernt.Positiv: besseres Bild als alte Rift, Lift-Off-Knopf für Brillenträger, Surroundklang funktioniert, wenn auch leise. Headstrap: ich hatte mit dem alten dünnen keine Probleme und sehe da nicht soviel bequemen Vorteil am neuen Design.Insgesamt eher eine Verschlimmbesserung. Somit geht die Rift S leider zurück, und ich setze auf die Mitbewerber am Jahresende. In der Zwischenzeit kann ich mir mit der Oculus Quest die Zeit vertreiben, wenn auch nicht in allen Bereichen. Dafür funktioniert diese aber in allen Belangen einwandfrei.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 3 June 2019

one_reviews_text: I bought the Oculus Rift S PC-Powered VR Gaming Headset and I spent hours and hours to try and play on it. the cables or something are not working as the headset sensors are not working and cannot pass the configuration of the headset. I want a replacement not to return it. but now it is a lot more than I spent originally on it.SO I returned it and they won't replace it for the same price.It is with £180 more expensive now.It is not worth £480 if you ask me.

It might have already been specified but I thought for this much of money of a new product they would make it sustainable and less waste consuming.

I chose this headset because it was cheaper and the black headset goes with the colour scheme of my gaming room. The rift s is a perfect introduction to pc vr gaming and I would 100 percent recommend it if your pc/laptop can handle it. I have a big nose and it stops the light getting into the headset so if you’re like me I would totally recommend this headset

My second problem was after about 30 minutes of playing the screen would black out and wouldn't turn back on until i reset my pc which works fine with the quest 2 link if you are wondering if thats the problem. review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 November 2020
review_title: Game breaking problems but refunded fine

one_reviews_text: Bought it for my lads as an Xmas present.Plugged it in, set it up and started to get to grips with a few games. It suddenly disconnected and it never came back on.Tried updates, updated graphics card, checked every Youtube tutorial on how to try to fix what I now know is a very common fault. USB shows connection but displayport just will not connect no matter what you try.Some people report success but when you delve deeper into Oculus Forums it becomes apparent this is a pretty huge problem for Oculus Rift S. It currently seems to point to the firmware. There is a 12.1 which I downloaded to try and solve issue but it did nothing on my system.Untill this is solved properly, do not buy!!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 December 2019
review_title: Very impressive for about 4 hours then died. Oculus Rift S has a BIG problem!!

one_reviews_text: I'm generally really pleased with the Rift S and it's a solid step up from the CV1. The only really issue I have right now is with its conectivity It can be a real pain to get to work when plugging it in. I usually have to restart the oculus services a few times and plug and unplug until it behaves itself. When it's running it's amazing and I'm very pleased with it, but the initial connection each time I want to use it is a real song and dance! Hence 4 out of 5 stars.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 December 2019
review_title: Much improved image over the CV1

one_reviews_text: We bought this for our 13yr old daughter. She loves it! Easy to set up, she was soon playing beat saber and other games. The only problem is getting her off it to spend time with us! We have kept it hidden from the younger two, as if they get a chance to try it, I am sure they will be begging for one too!! Highly recommend, well worth the price tag. You definitely get what you are paying for!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 April 2021

one_reviews_text: I have been an avid gamer since the late 80s and nothing has ever blown me away like the Rift S.  The jump in immersion and experience from the current PS4 Pro/High end, flat panel monitor, PC gaming that I've been doing, to the Rift S, feels like going from PS1 straight to PS4.  It's truly the next level of gaming at a price not much more than a console.  The set up takes minutes, requires no annoying wires or sensors and the visual fidelity delivered via the HMD and control offered by the excellent touch controllers is like nothing I have ever experienced prior to this.  If you have a decent gaming PC and have been curious about getting into VR, I highly recommend picking up a Rift S.  I got mine at launch and there have been some teething problems while they worked out a few global launch bugs, but as of yesterday's latest firmware update, all launch issues are now fixed and the equipment all works flawlessly.  Can't get enough of it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 July 2019

one_reviews_text: Decent bit of kit, but given they insist on a facebook account to use it they need to have proper customer service. I had various issues creating a FB account and oculus (owned by FB) support were terrible. If you are going to charge this much money and link it to FB, then you have to have some channel to resolve FB issues. 4th day from opening the box and still no useful assistance - am having to use one of my sons accounts to try the hardware.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 March 2021

one_reviews_text: When first set up it works great... but soon as your PC goes into sleep mode or turn off the Oculus doesn’t reconnect to the pc. You have to unplug the usb and display port. Many times trying trouble shooting and contacting Oculus still no fix. And if you look into it this has been ongoing since launch. Im now going to get a valve index.

one_reviews_text: I sent this back after finding out you need to have a Facebook account to use it, I'm not happy that you must have an account to use it. & it arrived very very late which gave me the time to look into it a lot more on problems people were having with it.

one_reviews_text: I bought this having been a user of the Cv1 with touch for 2 years and a launch day buyer of the Quest. I hoped the Rift S would provide the sharper image I experienced with the Quest and I’m pleased to say it is a step up from the original rift if a bit indulgent. If you love PC VR and are and Oculus user go for it. You won’t be disappointed.  First time buyers - it’s a no brainier. So easy to setup. The experience is hard to describe, big 3D environments and a level of immersion you simply can’t get from normal console/pc gaming.  There are loads of great games and experiences to be had here and the new releases coming up such Asgard’s Wrath, Stormland, Espire and Pistol Whip will ensure a solid VR Christmas. Go on...take the plunge.

review_title: Worthwhile Upgrade from the original Rift

Your display might not support the requested resolutions or there may be an issue with the cable connecting the display to your computer."The oculus app says the device is "fully connected and active" but there's still no display. one_reviews_text: Was very good in the short time I had it, VRChat is fun, Superhot VR is Amazing! - the Oculus Software is simple and easy to use I especially love the pass through feature. I will probably get one again In the future!Cons:It made me feel a little bit sick every time I used it - gave me headaches, I was on it for about 3 hours when I got it and I went to bed  and I woke up and I felt like I had the headset still on my eyes were stuck in 80fps for a few hours grabbing for a remote that wasn’t there 😂.Overall, a brilliant setup for first vr users, easy to set up and fun to use.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 February 2021

one_reviews_text: This is a great headset for PCVR if you can't afford the high-end ones. The rift s is the first VR kit I've owned, so playing games in a 3D virtual space was enough to completely floor me, and I think it would be hard to nitpick this headset unless you've also experienced the £1k ones. You will likely need a pair of decent headphones for immersion purposes as the built-in speakers are not that great. You also need to log into Facebook to use it, which is a shame. Otherwise, for the pricepoint this is a great piece of hardware, and I think the Facebook datamining has allowed this headset to be cheaper than it otherwise would be. Can't fault the picture quality or tracking, which to be honest are the most important things for me.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 February 2021

one_reviews_text: A great upgrade on the original Rift, Now you dont have the need for sensors and it does a great job without.  It does get a little hot when playing for more than 30 mins to an Hour, but that is the same on all VR Helmets.  Work great with both Steam and the Occulus store (my Preference)Need a fairly decent PC to run it, if you don't have this look into the quest which is a portable version of this unit with no need for a PC
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 August 2019

one_reviews_text: This headset may be well and good, but laptop users might turn to face a bitter truth: even if your hardware is good enough to operate the Oculus Rift S, you might be unable to connect it due to an interface problem. That's right.Oculus choose to switch from HDMI to DP for this product, justifying the interface change with a need for higher bandwidth. For laptops, Oculus just provides an in-package mini DP adapter. This means that if your laptop doesn't have a mini DP or at least an USB-C with Thunderbolt 3 support (in this case you'll need to buy an additional adapter) wired to your discrete GPU you won't be able to connect the Rift S. Which is just the stupidest thing I've ever seen.I spent the most frustrating two weeks of my life trying to make this work but I couldn't, and for sure I'm not the only one outside there. Besides, Oculus has been just awful on this aspect: i) they are the opposite of clarity in detailing the interface requirements of their product to the wider audience; ii) when people complain while they cannot operate the Rift S, Oculus customer service just suggests to upgrade a perfectly valid hardware to a compatible one. Which is the second stupidest thing I've ever seen.In summary: this headset might turn in a total fail for laptop users for the reasons above. So, beware the stuff you're buying, or you will spend some frustrating time before turning to the Amazon return policy!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 July 2019

one_reviews_text: I toyed with idea of getting a VR headset as I have the new Microsoft Flight Sim 2020. When I saw the Rift S was discounted I  had to get it and I was not disappointed. It has opened up a whole new experience for me. VR is so incredibly immersive and I would recommend it to anyone.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 January 2021

one_reviews_text: Yes, 30% (or more) of population can't use this VR headset, the reason is because this is the only VR WITHOUT IPD adjustment (the distance between eyes is not the same for everyone, so usually VRs let u adjust lens in order to have a clear image). I have an IPD of 70 and one eye is never on focus, during my early experiences I noticed it but I figured out I could just get used to it, the problem is that this issue is slowly causing me sickness during VR sessions and now I can play more or less 20 minutes before taking it off. I don't know why Oculus did this, some say because of the single monitor, but QUEST has a single monitor too but it can adjust lens distances. I would really work on my vr to change lens distance about 1-2 mm but Im worried about ruining and damaging it. Remember that this review is not meant to be an opposite of 5 stars reviews, because the most of people really love a VR headset that can be used and oriented anywhere, with its excellent tracking system that doesn't need the boxes as refer point during head movements. I put 1 star because I feel like I wasted all my money by buying something that I cannot use.I feel betrayed because there is no warning on the box, on the website or anywhere (well there is a 56-72 range that is clearly WRONG). You find this issue only by searching it on the web, but if u search for it means you already have the problem.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 February 2020
review_title: This VR is good.. but more than 30% of you will have motion sickness with RIFT S

one_reviews_text: The improvements, as stated in the other reviews, are excellent. And they are strikingly obvious from the moment that you put the headset on. Lenovo did an excellent job.I upgraded from the original Rift to this and I can honestly say that it was a way bigger upgrade than I expected.This is absolutely the best headset that I have ever used (and I have used them all) in terms of overall software navigation, game compatibility and general ease of use.I can’t actually believe it’s being sold for so little (£400) considering what one gets.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 December 2019

Amazon returns policy was superb so try it with confidence and hope you have better luck, gone for the Oculus Quest 2 as it is stand alone.

Avoid this £300 pile of scrap.Here we are, less then a year after buying.Headset will not work with anti virus turned on.The headset has now stopped working, amazon not offering a refund/replacement, giving me the link to Oculus support, who still haven't replied to a ticket I had made with them 5 months ago.

one_reviews_text: A step up from the original Rift which I had tried before.  I principally use this to play Elite Dangerous, for which it is superb. one_reviews_text: Pour l'instant je n'ais rien à dire pour ma première expérience VR, vraiment très beau graphiquement, le son est vraiment immersif pas besoin de casque d'écoute , le fil est assez long pour n'avoir pas acheter d’extenseur et aussi le micro semble bien fonctionner.Config : i7-9700k, 2080 RTX msi x trioNiveau confort c'est bien, il tient bien sur la tête et tu peux te pencher sans avoir peur qu'il tombe, il faut juste bien apprendre à le mettre comme on aime et ensuite ca va bien !Je recommande très bon produit pour l'instant aucun défaut ! mis à part le fil que je me demande si jamais il brise, est-ce que je peux changer seulement le fil ou je dois changer le casque .. il semble pas pouvoir se défaire du casque un peut embêtant.

one_reviews_text: This is a fantastic headset and my son loves it already, however upon receiving we were disappointed to find that this wouldn’t work on my sons laptop.The connection required by the headset wasn’t on my sons laptop, however we purchased an adapter which works.If you’re using a laptop and don’t have a DisplayPort, you’ll need a “BENFEI HDMI to DisplayPort” adapter, this has been recommended by other Oculus Rift S owners.Hoping this helps others, as I was none the wiser upon purchasing.

one_reviews_text: A small upgrade over the original , released with bugs that spoil the experience, not sure if these have been fixed but if not be warned you might be disappointed when these bugs come out to play , in the end I returned the unit for a refund and will wait and see where the next edition is

one_reviews_text: This is absolutely amazing.Crystal clear display, the touch controllers are simply fantastic, and the audio is actually alright, even though connecting a pair of earbuds can be better when going for more immersion.Its software is well designed too. Had it for few months now, it seriously exceeded my expectations.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 March 2020

one_reviews_text: I've owned and extensively used the Oculus S for about 4/5 month's now and so far, I can say that it is alot of fun, and reliable. The depth perception is perfect, the graphic's are great, but has some considerable blur at greater in game distances (I hear this is a thing will all VR sets). The only two issues I've had with this product are 1) The batteries. The hand controllers require 1 AA battery per controller and it eats through the power fairly quickly. 2) The tracking. It isn't too bad most of the time, but I have times where a controller will completely lose tracking for a few seconds. Its not something that happens so often that it becomes an actual issue, but it can be very frustrating, depending on the context of the situation.In conclusion, I by no means regret buying this product and would highly recommend to people wanting to get into VR and are looking for a first headset, or just a cheaper but equally reliable alternative to the Vive.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 September 2019

one_reviews_text: When it came I thought "Oh this is going to be fun!" Oh boy was I wrong. It took 3 hours for the oculus software to install and when I got into a game it was perfect till it crashed (the headset). I tried re-joining and it crashed again, and it wasn't just that 1 game I tried many more but every single one of them crashed. If anything I recommend getting the Quest or Quest 2. which are both the same price unless you want the 256GB which is £399 instead of £299. I also asked around and some of my friends had the exact same issue. Please do not waste any money on this. Get the Quest or Quest 2 instead.

one_reviews_text: Really good product. VR is definitely an experience not to be missed. The new tracking system make setup and getting into game really quick and doesn't seem to have many issues. I've not had any issues. But my brother who also has an s. Has experienced some incompatibility with other software on his PC preventing the mic from working properly. As play sessions can get quite sweaty. And I can see that becoming an issue over time.

one_reviews_text: The visual upgrade from cv1 is clearly noticeble. The only backwards steps are losing physical IPD adjustment and deeper blacks due to the lenses. Personally, none of these are huge issues for me. I've read that it's one of the more comfortable headsets to wear for long sessions but I find it to be far less comfortable than the cv1 due to the halo design and the inability to tilt the headset away from my face like the cv1. This is likely just a problem for me as I also had to buy comfort covers for cv1 to stop it resting on my nose

one_reviews_text: I was a bit cautious when buying this. Seeing people talking about the audio quality being bad etc. But in all honesty, it really doesn’t mind me. Yes it’s not perfect but it is loud enough and clear enough that you can hear what’s happening around you with the addition of a built in mic. The VR experience is great, looks very clear and immersive if you’ve got a good system. I like this over the other VR options because I don’t have much room to use and this is a perfect solution to that. No sensors need to be set up you can draw out your playable area on the oculus app but some games require a bigger playable area but it’s prompts you before you buy anything. So far so good.

one_reviews_text: The Rift S is a remarkable piece of kit, well built, good quality screen and excellent inside out tracking. If you are looking to get into VR then you can't go wrong with this, provided you have a decent enough gaming machine to cope.My only complaint would be the built in speakers, they are not as bad as some might suggest but they are inadequate for an all round solid performance.

one_reviews_text: The need for a Display Port connected to the GPU is critical.  Type C ports and Cable connectors have issues with connectivity.  Few cables meet the transfer specifications.  Good build and packaging but, a brand new laptop only provided the Type C connector, the Display Port was available but not on the GPU channel.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 December 2019
review_title: Always check the ports requirements for your Application & PC

one_reviews_text: En primer lugar cabe destacar que este nuevo modelo utiliza un material a mí parecer, más resistente, aunque ligero. En lo que respecta a las pantallas, ha cambiado bastante su diseño. Al principio pensaba que los 80Hz y la pantalla LCD serían un paso hacia atrás, pero una vez más, me han sorprendido. ¿La razón? Las pantallas se ven de manera maravillosa y esos 80Hz ayudan a qué puedas hacer todavía más supersampling, aumentando la resolución. Es una ventaja.Respecto al sonido, a mí personalmente me gusta como lo han implementado, y como suena. He leído gente que le funcionaba mal, pero en mí caso no he tenido ningún problema. Quizá la única pega que le veo es que es un auricular abierto... y prácticamente escucho todo lo que sucede a mí alrededor, y no me gusta. Pero tampoco se le puede pedir mucho más, al menos es sonido es bueno. Espero que saquen un adaptador para poner auriculares cerrados y tener esas "orejeras"En general, es un producto que recomiendo muchísimo. Estoy contentísimo con él y ya llevo varios días usándolos. Como todo, tiene sus pros y sus contras, pero sus contras en este caso, son menos que en anteriores cascos, por lo que merece mucho la pena.P.D Si alguien se pregunta si merece la pena cambiar su Rift por esto... no sabría deciros, es todo cuestión de opinión, pero el evitar tener 3 cámaras instaladas dan la vida. Eso sí, tened en cuenta que aunque esto lleve sus propias cámaras tiene algún que otro punto muerto, que supongo que podrían arreglar de alguna manera, por ejemplo permitiendo reutilizar 1 de esas cámaras externas del antiguo casco.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 1 June 2019
review_title: Mejora notable respecto a los anteriores

one_reviews_text: Started off great, then for no reason the sensors said they couldn’t track. After troubleshooting for hours, changing inputs and continuously trying everything I could. I gave up and returned it. I’m assuming it was just a faulty model.

one_reviews_text: Mein Erster Eindruck:Im Vergleich zur Oculus Rift ist die Rift S deutlich handlicher und im Detail merklich besser beworden. Gute Verarbeitung. Aus meiner Sicht ein würdiges Upgrade.Zu den Details:Tragekomfort: ++++Das neue Halo-Design mit den diversen Einstellungen ist spürbar angenehmer zu tragen. Die Schnellverstellung ist eine echte Verbesserung.Bildeindruck und Linsen:  +++Die Auflösung ist durchaus ausseichend um auch scharfes Bild darzustellen. Auf eine manuelle Einstellung des Augenabstandes verzichtet die Oculus Rift S, ist für mich auch kein Problem.Tracking: ++++Das Tracking ist gegenüber dem Vorgänger merklich besser geworden, es funktioniert überraschend besser als angenommen. Zudem stören keine zusätzlichen Sensoren und Kabel in der direkten Umbegung. Das Ausrichten, Nachjustieren der Sensoren entfällt. Gefällt mir!Eingabegeräte: ++++Die neuen Touch Controller sind angenehm zu tragen, bieten alle Funktionen wie das Vorgängermodell. Daumen und Zeigefinger werden einzeln erkannt. Der Magnetverschluss für das Batteriefach sollte überarbeitet werden, da die Abdeckung gelegentlich sich ungewollt öffnet.Software: ++++Einrichtung und Software sind sehr einfach zu handhaben.  Inzwischen gibt es ein reichhaltiges Angebot  unterschiedlichster Software und Rubriken. Wer im Oculus Store nicht fündig wird, schaut einfach bei Steam.Summa Summarum:Ist die Oculus Rift S ein Kauf? - Ja ist sie!Ist die Rift S ein würdiges Upgrade vom Vorgänger Modell? - Für mich Ja!Fazit:Ein gutes Stück Technologie zum fairen Preis.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 21 May 2019
review_title: Oculus Rift S - besser als Oculus Rift ?!

one_reviews_text: Vr is the future of gaming and PC interfaces. what we are seeing now is but the tip of the ice burg. Its not for everyone though, so if you can, try and find somewhere where you can give it a go. I was hooked from the moment i first tried it.

one_reviews_text: Wooooooow, jamás había probado el VR y estaba un poco inseguro de hacer un gasto tan grande, pero woooow, tengo apenas dos semanas con ellos y tal vez pues cambiar mi opinión, pero después de investigar y leer mucho sobre el tema y por fin comprarlos wooooooow, obviamente el primer momento que los usas es impactante, jamás te imaginas que pueda ser tan imersivo y te haga sentir increíble, luego comienzas ver cosas que vas acostumbrandote, la posición de el "halo strap"  la posición, el ipd y demás factores que hacen tu experiencia algo agradable o algo insufrible, aun así la mayoría de los juegos ya qué todo está listo son increíbles, he probado la mayoría de las experiencias gratis así como comprado varios juegos y de verdad es otro mundo jugar en vr, pero lo mejor de todo extrañamente fue ayer cuando usando "big screen" entre a un cuarto donde estaban viendo una película, todos comentado la película y divirtiendo, todo al mismo tiempo que veíamos la película al igual que en el cine.... De verdad si ya leíste al respecto y te interesa, de verdad no te vas arrepentir!!! Otra vez wooooooow.

one_reviews_text: I previously had a Rift (CV1), and the upgrade in image clarity is immense!The change in the head strap to halo with the way it rests on my face is so much more comfortable. I did not end up with the dreaded Oculus face lol.The responsiveness of the controllers really surprised me as I was expecting maybe a little bit of jitter or something, but they instead work really well. I tested the tracking radius moving my arms in awkward angles etc to try and see if it would loose the controller location or hand angle, I used the mirror in VR inside VRChat to watch my avatar and see if there was any flaw in the tracking, It only lost my hands a little when they were behind my back. But did a good job of estimating their locations.The audio is nice and clear and able to be plenty loud enough. However I do agree with the reviewers regarding the audio's lack of bass, which was most noticeable in games such as Beat Saber.Overall though value for money wise the Rift S is brilliant.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 21 May 2019
review_title: Very happy with the Rift S

one_reviews_text: I'll just jump right into the pros and cons with this new headset.Pros- resolution is noticeably better. Apps like virtual desktop are finally usable as a monitor without struggling to read text- God rays are 90% gone.-setup is a breeze, having no sensors and only 1 USB needed is amazing- head strap is an upgrade as far as sharing the device with others, it's way easier to get the rift s switched to anyone's elses head size.- I have an ipd of 71mm and I haven't had any complaints from thatCons- The built in audio is totally unacceptable in my opinion. For me It's a must to wear an external headset or ear buds to enjoy it- Less comfortable to me than cv1, especially because I have to wear external headphones.- The sweet spot isn't as good, the edges of field of vision are blurry especially when you move your head. I resolve this by putting the headset in a good position and tightening the head band fairly tight, making it a bit more uncomfortable.Review and questions:Would I use the rift s over the cv1? Yes.Do I suggest upgrading from cv1 to rift s? Depends if you want the screen quality boost over the cons of the headset.Overall I think it's a small upgrade to cv1, because of the cons. If the audio was the same as cv1, I think it would be a whole lot better, and I believe there is a way to do that, but it costs 80-100$.But if you don't have a cv1 rift, and you want vr, Go for it!!!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 12 August 2019

one_reviews_text: Headset been working fine for 2 months until the screen started turning off after 1-2 minute. Support blames drivers while my friend has no issues. Any other VR headset on market would be better honestly, I wish I knew that before I wasted money on this one.

one_reviews_text: So I was really excited to get the new Rift S. It arrived and I set it up. Very quick and easy. 5 minutes, 2 plugs. Graphics resolution is great, brighter screens. Loved that part over the Rift. But... the controllers... they now have the sensor ring over your knuckles, not under your pinky. This makes it IMPOSSIBLE to bring close to your face to aim in a shooting type scenario. You hit the headset, and it's so close to the sensors in the headset that the weapon twists and is unsteady. I can't play any shooter games without holding my arms almost fully extended and I can't aim steady like that. As well, the headset no longer has the built in earphones. While the directional sound is nice, theres NO BASS of any kind. Sound no longer sounds real, explosions and gunfire sound like they are coming from a cell phone on speaker phone. Like a tin can. There's now a large foam cover over your forehead. While its very comfortable, its hot and makes your forehead sweat a lot, which is then no longer comfortable.With the inability to bring the controller close to my face, and the sound being out of a tin can, I can't play the games I love, and the "realism" of sound you need in VR is gone making it un- fun to play. Not suitable for me, my Rift is much better, so returned my Rift S set. Too bad they had to change some things for the worse.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 21 June 2019
review_title: Not recommended overall, especially if you have the Rift

one_reviews_text: He probado HTC VIVE, Medion erazer y Gear VR. El cambio de calidad de imagen se nota. Todo lo noto más nitido, las letras se leen sin problemas.El efecto rejilla apenas se nota, dependerá del juego y los colores (sobre todo te das cuentas de que apenas tiene cuando te vuelves a poner las otras).Cuando hay mucha claridad en el juego/video se nota el glare. Se ven los redondeles de las lentes fresnel.Sonido bien si estás en un sitio sin ruidos. Yo prefiero con cascos. Uso unos in ear y muy bien.El tracking va muy bien, pero hay que tener cuidado con la luz que tengas en casa para que te lo pille bien. La primera vez que las enchufe me asuste porque no encendían y era porque parecía que no tenía la suficiente luz. Digamos que ni mucha ni poca.Se colocan rápido y bien. De vez en cuando algún que otro tirón de pelos, pero bien vamos.Respecto al punto dulce no he tenido problemas. Tengo IPD 65. Se puede regular en las opciones de la aplicación de oculus.Llevo gafas de ver aunque al final me pase a usarla con lentillas.  Las gafas no me llegaban a tocar las lentes algo que si que me pasa con las HTC Vive. Con la Erazer y las GEAR no. Lo que si está claro que en todas ellas con el calor, hablando de las gafas de ver, se empañan. Por eso definitivamente me he pasado a usarlas con lentillas.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 14 June 2019

one_reviews_text: Headset was not what it though would bePositive-headset fits nice on your head-oculus home-games run smoothNegative-oculus rift S still has many bugs withing-new high end computers have issues with 3.0 usb port.Had big issue for reason i had to return to the shop.Track motion work with usb 3.0. High end computers (ive alienware) system has automatic sleep mode on usb to safe energy if headset is not used. But track motion doesn't reactive manual when you use the headset. By remove the port bugs out the headset and may take up to an hour plug in plug out until you can play again..When you are gaming 2 hours with headset on your microphone goes random in sleep mode puts everything on mute while the rest still works.-oculus still updates the system more or less the product is not finished but it was tested on mid end computer not on high ends to be competible.-thats why i disliked this headset.Unfinished product which was waste of time+for smart people yes i deactived sleep mode on usb system but it has an automatic thing connected with your systemThis doesn't mean it is for all peopleYes drivers are updated-black screen on the headset is caused from the track system not working and usb 3.0port blocks you in sleep mode.-oculus wanted. But report list, i refused cause i aint gonna waste a week research over a fully refund.I recommand you to either go to old oculus headset or vive/psvr dnno how the quest is dealing with this issue but other headsets are working fine.

one_reviews_text: Beware the black screen of death with the new Rift S. I'd read that there were some issues with the headset failing to move beyond its black loading screen with elipses, but didn't have any trouble myself for the first few weeks. I've now joined the legion others who had previously enjoyed a working product, only to encounter the same issue. Google it and see for yourself - 'Rift S black screen'.My ticket with Oculus is only 1.5 days old (without response), but I've read others on threads who have received no support after 3 days. It's sad because the Rift S was a blast to play with. But I've spent almost 10hrs attempting to implement the myriad 'fixes' out there (from uninstalling / reinstalling all USB drivers to repairing the installation and even buying a new PCI-e 4x port USB 3.0 card) and nothing has worked.The most frustrating thing is that it seems like tens / hundreds / thousands of others have the same issue, but no direction or help from Oculus. Issue first surfaced in the days following launch (23-24 May) but no firmware or Oculus software fix. Very average.5 stars when in works (in dreamland)1 star right now (reality)
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 22 June 2019

one_reviews_text: Diese VR Brille IST ein Upgrade zum Vorgänger Oculus Rift.Das Einrichten der Brille ist sehr einfach und das Tracking der Bewegungen von Kopf und Hände ist sehr präzise. Der Tragekomfort ist bei diesem Gewicht gut und durch das gewählte Material noch etwas angenehmer als bei der Playstation VR. Der Schweiß hält sich in Grenzen; )Ein Fliegengittereffekt ist kaum wahrzunehmen,  jedoch sind die sogenannten GodRays nicht ganz verschwunden. Im Spiel stören sie mich aber nicht und lenken auch nicht  vom Geschehen ab.Das Bild ist scharf, die Farben satt und die Schwarzwerte, nach dem Test von 'Beat Saber', sind völlig in Ordnung.Die Audiolösung mit den Lautsprechern im HALO-Ring ist einerseits ein Rückschritt bei der Basswiedergabe und dem direkteren Klang, für meinen Gebrauch jedoch die alltagstauglichere Lösung durch den Wegfall großer Kopfhörer und der Wahlfreiheit, falls man sich für zusätzliche Bluetooth-Kopfhörer entscheidet um gänzlich in die VR-Welt abzutauchen und die Außenwelt von sich abschirmen zu können.Der Gesamteindruck aus Preis, Leistung, Zugänglichkeit und Spieleangebot ist nach ein paar Stunden spielen sehr sehr positiv.Nachdem selbst VR Brillen in höheren oder ähnlichen Preislagen nicht in Allem perfekt sind (Tracking/Textschärfe) und manche Puristen für besseren Schwarzwert, höhere Auflösung oder mehr Blickwinkel auch das zwei- bis dreifache bezahlen müssen (+die passende teurere Grafikkarte) , ist dieses Produkt ein faires Angebot und in meinen Augen nicht zu teuer, welches auch auf Mittelklasse PCs noch Laune macht.NACHTRAG:Kauft euch diese Brille NICHT !Die Oculus Quest mit dem besseren Display bekommt PC Unterstützung und Frühjahr 2020 Handtracking per UPDATE.Zum anderen gibt es optional bald die selbe Kopfhalterung wie bei der RIFT S.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 21 May 2019

one_reviews_text: È la mia primissima esperienza in VR con questo Oculus Rift S. L’ho acquistato perché me lo avevano fatto provare su un portatile da gaming, con il simulatore di volo DCS-World. Appassionato anche io di simulazione di volo ho deciso di fare il grande salto (ho sempre voltato con il TrackIR).Collegato al mio desktop equipaggiato con RTX-2080ti...ed avviato DCS, bhè....sono rimasto nuovamente senza parole, letteralmente!!!! La cosa che più mi ha entusiasmato di questo Oculs è il rapporto prospettico che di ha, cioè, le grandezze sono 1:1, un aereo visto dall’esterno è grande come fosse davvero di fronte a voi, tutto è rappresentato in grandezza reale, difficile da spiegare ma è così!Tecnicamente la grafica è ottimamente riprodotta, ovviamente non è quella del monitor/TV di casa ma vi assicuro che ogni dettaglio è presente, c’ Un leggero effetto aliasing ma non disturba più di tanto, per farla breve, colori e immagini più che soddisfacenti.Consiglio; disabilitate il Vsync dei giochi per avere le migliori prestazioni in VR. I contro sono, se fa caldo tende ad appannarvi gli occhiali, se li avete, Oculus S calza benissimo anche su occhiali, io ho ovviato con climatizzatore ed un piccolo ventilatore portatile di fronte a me e ad una certa distanza, così non sudo più e non mi si appanna nulla.Poi, se si fa simulazione di volo consiglio di vincolare i controller ad una cintura messa in vita, perché se si usa cloche e manetta, questi non potranno sempre stare in mano e possono cadere per terra, altro problema superato.In definitiva la VR è una tecnologia ancora acerba ma dalle grandissime potenzialità, questo Oculus S me lo ha mostrato senza ombra di dubbio.Attenzione per chi soffre di motion sickness, iniziare senza esagerare e per tempi relativamente brevi, si necessita di un periodo di adattamento per forza di cose.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 5 August 2019

one_reviews_text: First I want to point out the specs of my desktop, which is a GTX 1080, 8600k, and 16gb of ram.I was a little suspicious at first if the Rift S was actually worth the upgrade coming from the first Rift. This is oculus' first big attempt at Inside-Out tracking, but I have to admit, they nailed it. It isn't as perfect if you had a 3 or 4 sensor setup with the previous Rift, but as long as you aren't shoving your controllers into your face or flinging your arms behind your back, the sensing is almost seamless.Out of the box, which if I can add is a very pleasant unboxing experience, you get the headset itself, two of their newer controllers, batteries and a displayport to minidisplay port adapter, plus some manual and instructions stuff. One of the advantages this has over the rift is how simple it is to get setup. No more time being wasted trying to find the perfect spot and angle for each sensor, and hoping you have enough usb 3.0 ports. All the Rift S requires is displayport and one usb 3.0 port. Once Oculus' software is installed it configures the Rift S very quickly, and the process to setup your guardian boundaries is so much easier.After all the setup is done and got back into the Home, I realized how much better the visuals are. The screen-door effect is practically not visible at all, and text is so much clearer to read. (I'm actually using the virtual desktop screen with the Rift S on while typing this review). I'm pretty sure I cant go back to the original rift without getting sick with the SDE and lower resolution. While the compromise to the higher resolution was going from a 90hz refresh rate to an 80hz refresh rate, the drop is not very noticeable, only if you are really looking for it. As long as you have the hardware to put out those frame rates, I will gladly take the much clearer visuals.I tested out a couple of games, Beatsaber, Echo VR and Superhot. All played excellently and didn't notice any flaws in the tracking or get disoriented with the 80hz.In addition, this headset is waaaaaaaaay more comfortable than the original rift. The knob to tighten/loosen the strap is much easier to use, and I'm even able to fit my glasses without them scratching the lenses, which I didnt have the room to do so in my old rift. It is a little heavier in the front, but it isnt that much noticable.The only negative I have is the audio. I'm not sure why Oculus decided to remove the speakers from the first rift. Those were fantastic and had great quality. The new speakers are hidden on each sides of the strap, so while you are able to hear your surroundings around you, I found it harder at times to be immersed in whatever I was doing, and there is practically very little bass at all, which is a bummer in games like beatsaber. They did include a headphone jack so that you can use your own headphones, but be warned! I get the feeling that most over-ear headphones wont fit properly. I have Hyperx Cloud II's, and they just barely fit. I dont have any earbuds, but i would assume those would work without a problem.All in all the Rift S, in my opinion, is worth it if you are new to VR or even if you had the original consumer rift like I did. Oculus keeps making steps in the right direction and hopefully will get VR to become even more mainstream someday.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 23 May 2019
review_title: Worth it if you are new to VR and if you have the previous Rift.
