review_date: Reviewed in Mexico on 26 July 2019

one_reviews_text: No recomiendo comprar estas gafas,me gasté un dineral y al poco empezaron a fallar,se veía negro,me puse en contacto con Oculus y no tienen una casa donde llevar y reparar las gafas aquí en España,ni servicio tecnico,todo por emails que tardaban en contestar...para un cable estuve un mes detrás de ellos,que luego al final no és el cable,pero como solo te atienden por email no hay manera de que te resuelvan nada,en  onclusión ...he tirado un dineral a la basura,tal cual
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 20 June 2021

one_reviews_text: I've been a gamer for just about 5 decades now and have been watching the VR side of things with the occasional glance at it but never really taking an interest in it as I figured it wouldn't be up to standard. Being a diehard PC fan it only added to the "Walk on by" attitude. I was looking at purchasing this unit for my Son for a Christmas present but once I tried it out it literally changed my mind, I was amazed at how far this has come. If you're looking for that next step in any PC environment this just might be it.Well worth the wait. I did end up buying two...Cheers
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 23 December 2019
review_title: What the heck was I waiting for

one_reviews_text: Al prodotto si è staccata la gomma piuma protettiva dalla maschera, niente di drammatico  alla fine, però ho avuto modo di constatare che, dopo averlo contattato il servizio assistenza diretto non risponde. Ai controller se lasciate la batteria inserita essa durerà da Natale a Santo Stefano. Relativamente al software una marea di problemi, di incompatibilità spesso nuovi di volta in volta. In definitiva se dovessi ripassarci forse valuterei qualche altro marchio.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 19 May 2021

one_reviews_text: L'ho ordinato non facendo attenzione al fatto che richiedeva una DisplayPort per il collegamento, cosa di cui il mio notebook non dispone. Tentai la cancellazione dell'ordine ma era già stato spedito. Una volta arrivato l'ho provato col PC di casa , non eccelso, ricavandone una esperienza incredibile che mi ha indotto, non solo a tenerlo, ma anche a dotarmi di un computer idoneo a gestire le funzioni VR.Questo dispositivo offre la possibilità di immergersi in ambienti  simulati con un realismo incredibile. La risoluzione è inferiore a quella del monitor ma comunque sufficiente. Inoltre il prezzo attuale di 349€ lo rende sicuramente appetibile rispetto all'esperienza completamente nuova che farà provare.Da appassionato di simulazione (unico "gioco" che ho sempre adoperato) sto apprezzando con quale realismo ci si sente seduti al posto del pilota, e utilizzare tutti i comandi interruttori e pulsanti dell'aereo con i motion controller, senza necessità di altro hardware esterno. SOLO XPLANE 11 PERMETTE QUESTO. Flight Simulator 2020 consente solo la visione ma non la gestione del cockpit con i motion controller.Un'esperienza da provare assolutamente ma non per tutti. Infatti l'uso di questi dispositivi VR scombussola il cervello esattamente come quando si indossano per la prima volta occhiali da vista. Ma come con questi ultimi col tempo ci si abitua.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 21 January 2021

one_reviews_text: Had this thing for ALMOST a year. It started off great actually. Fun, VR, exactly as advertised. Make sure you have a lot of space, a decent PC, and you'll have lots of fun. Downsides are...oh boy. The cord/cable loves to tangle. No matter what I did, it always found a way to tangle up. Same with the wrist cords on the controllers. Always twisting up.The headset was comfortable but after a few months I had to buy a new face guard for it. The old one just peeled off. The plastic component holding the cable to the side of the headset itself snapped after two months. Had to jury rig something to keep it from yanking on my head.Sadly though the headset broke after my arm got caught on the cable mid swing. Despite having the cable away from myself, even bought an accessory to keep the cord away, it still got caught. As a result the HDMI component snapped. At the time when I bought the Oculus RIFT, it did not come with a warranty. So careful with this purchase. Otherwise it was a fun ride when I had it.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 25 June 2020
review_title: Fun Experience but not without its faults.

one_reviews_text: Las gafas no están mal, pero por el precio que tienen me esperaba que se vieran mejor y que tuvieran mejores colores. El no tener ajuste de IPD me hacía ver borrosos los bordes, ya que mi IPD es de 67 y el FOV tampoco me gustó, probé alguna gafa de VR hace 3 o 4 años y creo recordar que se veían más, éstas tienen un efecto buzo importante. La colocación de las gafas tampoco me gustó, era muy incómodo tener que moverlas todo el rato para no verlas borrosas y las esponjas daban mucha calor. Los mandos son muy buenos, es de lo que más me gustaron de estas gafas. El audio es muy malo, se escucha un poco de lejos, la calidad regular y para nada inmersivos, nada que ver con las Rift normales. El Tracking bastante bueno, no tuve ningún problema para usarlas y es de lo que más me gustó.En general no cumplió mis expectativas, me esperaba algo con una calidad de imagen más parecida a una pantalla normal y además por lo del IPD las veía un poco borrosas. Creo que es un producto decente para iniciarte en la realidad virtual pero si quieres usarlas en serio con juegos de buenos gráficos como simuladores de coches y demás se quedan cortas. Creo que todavía le falta madurez a esta tecnología y que hay mejores opciones en el mercado por un precio parecido.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 28 August 2020
review_title: Bien pero no cumplió mis expectativas

one_reviews_text: Habe die Rift S jetzt knapp 5 Monate und bin ehrlich gesagt ziemlich enttäuscht. Ich hatte durchaus meinen Spaß mit dem Ding, aber ich habe fast einen Monat gebraucht um das Teil überhaupt zum laufen zu kriegen und der Support ist nicht gerade hilfreich gewesen, die bieten zwar immer schnell Hilfe an, können im Endeffekt aber fast nie etwas machen außer Standardantworten geben die mal schon 1000 Mal in Foren gelesen hat oder ein Ersatzgerät anbieten. Ein recht großer Anteil von Geräten die ausgeliefert werden sind defekt und es gibt ne Menge Sachen die Probleme machen können. Viele Fehler sind seit Jahren bekannt und werden nicht behoben und Lösungsansätze die Oculus bereits bekannt sind muss man ihnen trotzdem aus der Nase ziehen, schätze ein FAQ würde zu sehr verdeutlichen wie viele Probleme das Gerät eigentlich hat.Das Tracking ist gut, die Auflösung in Ordnung und sie ist nicht unbequem. Der Schaumstoffschutz ging aber ab noch bevor die Brille lief, passenden Ersatz der nicht unverschämt teuer war musste ich aus Amerika bestellen was einen Monat dauerte. Ersatzteile wie neue Controller(mein Linker controller hat bereits jetzt trigger der probleme macht) oder ein neues Kabel sind sündhaft teuerIm Vergleich zum Vorgänger ist der Sound schlechter, der IPD ist nicht mehr physisch einstellbar, aber alte Designfehler und Bugs wurden mit hohem Aufwand auf das neue Produkt übertragen. Vieles wirkt hingerotzt und unüberlegt und in der Preisklasse finde ich die Menge an Problemen unangemessen, gibt WMR Brillen die die gleiche auflösung bieten und nur in tracking und FOV minimal hinten liegen, wer kein Geld für ne VIVE hat sollte sich vielleicht lieber in der Richtung umschauen, weil ich die Rift S im jetzigen Zustand der Soft- und Hardware echt nicht empfehlen kann.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 9 March 2020
review_title: Super wenn sie mal richtig funktioniert, tut sie nur leider fast nie.

one_reviews_text: Después de una laaaaaarga odisea de frustaciones, actualizaciones, tutoriales, dudas e incluso miedo a que no iba a ser posible, logré instalar las Oculus y su software en mi sobremesa (I-7 a 4Gh, nvidia gtx 1070, 32 Gb de Ram) y solamente por la experiencia de jugar al Marvel Powers United Vr, me mereció la pena sabiendo que todavía hay joyas mayores que descubrir; recomendable producto, aunque requerido paciencia y algo de suerte para instalarlo perfecto.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 9 July 2019
review_title: Tras la tempestad, la calma y el disfrute

one_reviews_text: Como puntos positivos, la claridad de su panel, no esperaba un salto de calidad con respecto al CV1 tan grande, pero los textos son claramente legibles y los colores brillantes, el screendoor prácticamente desaparece a no ser que lo busques bajo condiciones muy específicas. Es un buen salto respecto al CV1Puntos negativos serán los mandos que al tacto se notan de menor calidad, pero sobre todo el sonido. Después de venir de los auriculares del CV1 no entiendo tamaña cagada de poner unos altavoces en la diadema. El sonido es bajísimo y pierdes graves por todos lados. Está bien a lo mejor para chatear con un amiguete, pero para inmersión total necesitas comprar auriculares externos, con lo que la comodidad de este visor baja enteros.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 1 December 2019

one_reviews_text: The image is nice and sharp and it's pretty much plug and play. I had already downloaded the drivers off Oculus's website, so I pretty much plugged the unit into the PC and did a quick setup. It was working perfectly within 2 minutes. I really like that you don't have to set up the sensors all over the room. To me that's more important than slightly less coverage of the controllers. If you don't want to deal with a ton of cables and setup time, this is for you... just make sure you're PC can run it.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 6 June 2019

one_reviews_text: El visor tiene buena calidad y es bastante cómodo, sin embrago sufre de algunos problemas con el reconocimiento de los sensores.Me refiero a que no solo requiere de un espacio vació alrededor de el usuario para configurar los sensores si no que también requiere de una iluminación no muy brillante y no muy tenue. De no cumplir con esos requerimientos experimentaras problemas como que los sensores detecten el piso de tu espacio mas arriba o mas abajo de lo que realmente es, causando que la "cámara" en juegos este desplazada y la iluminación puede causar que los sensores de tus controles se desconecten arbitrariamente de el headset lo cual causa que en el juego tus "manos" dejen de moverse, lo cual es bastante problemático en juegos de estilo shooter.Es probable que el headset que recibí yo estuviera defectuoso ya que presentaba estos problemas muy seguido, pero en mi busqueda de una solucion antes de regresarlo encontre que muchas otras personas tenían estos problemas por estas razones, recomiendo conseguirlo si de verdad lo quieres pero mas que nada, asegúrate que tu entorno cumpla con estos requerimientos.
review_date: Reviewed in Mexico on 11 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Overall the quality is great. Simple setup in my opinion. You will definitely want to get some retractable cable holders to run the cable across the ceiling to keep it out of your way while gaming.Overall it performs better than I expected having gone from a gear VR to this is quite a step up. I was blown away with the accuracy of the controllers. It seems to work well with Steam VR with only some minor issues that required software to be restarted to get the games to play in VR.There were some issues when I first got it where once you closed the Oculus VR app you would need to unplug and plug in the headset again to get the computer to recognize it. The issues have only gotten worse with each update. For awhile I could keep it working if I never shut off my computer but then a forced update saw the return of the software must restart loop. Pretty much a brick for now and the return window is past for me : (UPDATE: I would buy any other VR headset but this if I had to do it over again the issues all software/firmware related as far as I can tell are just terrible. 80% of the time if I want to use this headset I need to spend 20-40 minutes restarting it and unplugging and plugging it in again. Even leaving the computer on doesn't stop it from randomly needing reboots.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 30 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Ho provato questa tecnologia in diverse fiere e ne sono rimasto stupito perciò decisi al bf di acquistarne 1,li comincio la mia odissea. Lo schermo non si è mai acceso e presentava diversi problemi di incompatibilità usb, così l'ho sostituito ma anche questo non andava. Ho pensato fosse il mio PC ma il problema era che non partiva proprio quindi anche fosse avrebbe dovuto solo funzionare male, ma comunque funzionare. Ho tentato anche con la pcie che consiglia il supporto oculus ma nulla da fare. Indagando in rete, sul supporto e nei gruppi ho scoperto che diversi utenti avevano avuto il mio problema e che si fosse risolto da solo una volta sostituito (alcuni più di 2 sostituzioni). Tutto ciò mi fa pensare a una partita di dispositivi difettosi immessi comunque sul mercato per l'eccessiva richiesta. Peccato, ero molto contento di poter usare quella tecnologia in casa ma sono molto frustrato del tempo perso. Dato anche il prezzo del dispositivo non bassissimo mi aspettavo di più a livello costruttivo e da parte dell'azienda stessa.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 22 December 2019

one_reviews_text: The controllers disconnect the screen goes fuzzy overall functionality is garbage says my display port is broken says my usb3.0 doesn't work, I got a 8gb rx570 that can handle vr games fine this headset says I have zero video memory I've also had to re do my guardian boundary 9 times, the only this this headset can to is watch movies... a $632 blueray playerUpdate: oculus crashes everytime and I lose tracking in the controllers every 2 minutes my monitors connected to the gpu go black 9 times out of 10 when I attempt to run games,  steamVr won't work anymore with any game so I have to get ones from SteamUnlocked to even do anythingThis headset has shut off my pc 3 times crashed 5 times, please dont buy this. Just get a vive
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 11 September 2020

one_reviews_text: L' oculus rift S e' un ottimo prodotto. Ma  chi arriva dal CV1 ( la versione precendente dell' oculus S ) non si aspetti l' effetto WOW. Si percepisce subito che l' impatto grafico e' migliorato e finalmente i God Rays sono spariti. Non ci sono in giro per la stanza sensori e prolunghe. La configurazione e' piu' semplice e immediata. Se non avete mai provato la VR andate sul sicuro. Ci sono dei visori che offrono piu' risoluzione , ma costano molto di piu' e hanno bisogno di computer molto piu' costosi ( con entrambi - con dei compromessi chiaramente  - basta un i3 6100 , una 1050 ti e 4 giga di ram ..e non ho pautra di smentita perche' ci ho giocato 6 mesi ) . Ho preferito tenermi la vecchia versione , facendo i conti della serva l' investimento tra vendita vecchio CV1 e acquisto nuovo Rift Sera sui 200e. Ho preferito tenermeli in tasca. Ringrazio Amazon che mi ha dato la possibilita' di valutare questo acquisto 30 giorni. Ah.... si suda ragazzi....compratevi un bel ventilatore da piazzarvi davanti nelle sezioni di gaming :-)
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 5 July 2019
review_title: oculus rift vs oculus rift s

one_reviews_text: El visor se ve muy bien, pero estan teniendo muchos fallos que no consiguen solucionar. Despues de 2 semanas con problemas de tracking y en la pantalla, y horas dedicadas a seguir los pasos del soporte de oculus, los problemas siguen. Al final cansado de dedicar horas para su funcionamiento y no conseguirlo, las he devuelto.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 16 June 2019
review_title: Se ven muy bien, pero tienen problemas de funcionamiento

one_reviews_text: I BOUGHT THIS 2020 it came with a broken controller i contacted within the first month about it (under warranty). it took so long to get a reply and help about 1 year into talking to them they finally started to help but then said it was past warranty (they made an exception for me :/  ) . finally 1.5 years i get to sent my controller in to receive my refurbished controller i was weary to do this but they assured me everything would be fine untill this day after 5 months of sending it in they still havnt sent me a controller . and say they are out of stock and have been without a vr for basically 1.8ys got to use it for maybe 1 or 2 months .. just sad ... cant tell if im getting scammed but it for sure feels like it ..
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 27 March 2022

one_reviews_text: premessa:sono molto felice di questo dono ricevuto.Confezione: all'interno ci sono anche 2 pile AA che servono per i touch,il cavo del caschetto è sufficientemente lungo perpotersi muovere in discreta libertà,c'è anche un minuscolo libretto istruzioni che descrive principalmente norme di sicurezzaper l'uso e niente o poco su come installare il tutto,per un neofita di pc la vedo un po dura anche se non impossibile.Bisogna avere: a bordo pc due prese display port una per il monitor che è quello normalmente in usoe l'altra per il caschetto più una presa usb3 e connessione ad internetper registrazione e installazione drivers.ok veniamo al sodo: attualmente non esiste ancora un oggetto con una definizione da urlo ad un prezzo umano e questoOculus ha un rapporto prezzo prestazioni a mio avviso di tutto rispetto, il mio uso è quasi in esclusiva suisimulatori di guida e devo dire che l'immersione è veramente fantastica , da il meglio di se in software/giochiche sono nativi VR i dettagli interno abitacolo sono molto precisi e la visione dei cordoli nelle curve è nettaed anche la vettura che ti precede o sta al fianco è ben definita c'è un po di perdita nel dettaglio sologuardando molto avanti o lo sfondo ma questo nella guida non da molti problemi,effetto screendoor o quadrettatura pixel si c'è ma bisogna cercarlo e si nota di più solo nelle zone tendenti al bianco(i bordi pixel sono neri e si vedono maggiormente), nella concitazione di una gara io non ho mai avuto sensazione o disturbodi questo effetto, non si vede, i pixel sono veramente piccoli.Queste caratteristiche credo aiutino molto ad evitare il senso di nausea che non ho mai avuto,devo dire che guido da parecchio tempo con i simulatori e probabilmente la mia vista è abituata al monitor questoprobabilmente aiuta ma ha provato anche mia moglie un gioco/documentario scalata all'Everest e tolto il primissimomomento dove mi ha detto di avere un po di fastidio la principale preoccupazione era il senso di vertigine dato dal gioco,sali su cime a 8000m e la sensazione di vuoto dietro o sotto di te è notevole, ora non mi molla più vuol sempre rifarel'esperienza e lei e il pc sono agli antipodi, questo era solo per descrivere che la visione è decisamente buona,certo latecnologia andrà avanti ma sarà necessario a quel punto cambiare/aggiornare il pcattualmente è I5 4690K, 16Giga ram, GTX 1070TI.audio: le cuffie integrate sono di ottimo ascolto e danno buone sensazioni di profondità noti il suono se arriva da davanti o dietro  ma non essendo a padiglione chiuso anche chi è nelle vicinanze sente,ho figlie che studiano e il rombo dei motori  si sentiva così sono tornato alle mie cuffie classiche collegando il jack da 3,5 sul lato sx del caschetto ottima soluzione  questa presa aggiuntiva per cuffietip: 1)ogni touch ha una pila stilo tipo AA l'uso è continuo per selezionare pagine o addobbare la stanza virtuale  che vi troverete ad avere tenetevi una scorta consumano un po.  2) deve esserci una luce dove vi muovete con gli Oculus anche minima altrimenti le telecamere  poste sul visore non localizzano la posizione e il sistema vi chiede di ridefinire i confini  di movimento.  Buona visione/immersione a tutti
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 27 December 2019

one_reviews_text: L'esperienza del Rift S è meravigliosa, completamente immersiva e piacevole. Assolutamente da migliorare il cavo. Impossibile non farlo arricciare e contorcere all'inverosimile. Probabilmente avrebbero dovuto optare per un cavo con un diverso tipo di guaina. E' davvero ingestibile e temo si romperà abbastanza presto.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 3 November 2020
review_title: Bella esperienza, ma cavo davvero ingestibile

one_reviews_text: Un leggero passa avanti rispetto a Oculus rift questo modello s implemente traciamento grazie alle 5 fotocamere ed e preciso, in più se uscite dal area vedrete sul visore immagine delle fotocamere frontali.Anche la risoluzione e aumentata si passa da 1080*1200 a 1280*1440 per occhio. I pixel sono visibili ancora  per esperienza e migliorata, poi anche se si passa da un 90hz oled a un 80hz LCD  non si nota la diffenreza.Il fatto di non avere sensori per le stanza quindi meno cavi  e anche meno porte occupate sul PC e una cosa ottima .Esperienza e comunque migliorata.consiglio l'acquisto
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 28 June 2019
review_title: Un leggero passa avanti rispetto Oculus rift

one_reviews_text: Ich werd hier einfach mal meine "Macht" als Konsument nutzen und meine Meinung zum bevorstehenden Facebook Zwang kundtun. NÖ einfach NÖ!(Uhrsprüngliche Rezension)Genial einfach nur genial. Habe mich wie mein 10 Jähriges Ich gefühlt als ich meine Wii Bekam.Ja man bewegt sich viel beim spielen aber das macht den Spaß gerade aus. Und wenn das Bild zukünftig noch etwas schärfer und das Headset etwas bequemer wird würde ich sogar meinen Monitor aus dem Zimmer schmeißen.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 25 January 2020

one_reviews_text: Nachdem ich bereits von der Playstation VR sehr positiv überrascht war und ich mir vor kurzem einen High End PC gekauft habe, habe ich mir jetzt auch die Rift S angeschafft.Ich habe mich für die Rift S und gegen die Quest plus Link entschieden, da ich nur über PC spiele und die Rift S  nach meiner Ansicht dafuer die bessere Lösung ist.Anschliessen und Einrichtung der Rift S lief bei mir komplett reibungslos und war sehr einfach.Bild Qualität, Tracking und die Controller sind wie erwartet eine deutliche Steigerung gegenüber der PSVR.Über die Soundqualitaet hatte ich im Vorfeld so viel negatives gelesen, dass meine Erwartungen sehr weit unten waren, aber so miserabel ist der jetzt auch nicht.Zum Thema Augenabstand (IPD) ich habe mit knapp 64mm da keine Probleme, aber die Tatsache, dass dieser an der Rift S nicht einstellbar ist, ist natürlich echt ein negativer Punkt. Die Software Loesung kann das nur bis zu einem gewissen Grad ausgleichen.Ansonsten bin ich komplett zufrieden mit der Rift S.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 19 February 2020
review_title: Sehr gute VR Brille für den Preis

one_reviews_text: rispetto al rift precedente sono migliorati l'ergonomia, la praticità, le lenti e la risoluzione anche se di poco e a caro prezzo. già perché passare da schermi oled ad uno lcd solo per ridurre di poco il famoso effetto zanzariera è un compromesso difficile da capire, e la cosa si fa subito notare nelle situazioni di buio ovviamente. anche la scelta di non utilizzare cuffie, forse per limitarne il costo è discutibile
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 13 January 2020

one_reviews_text: Bin schwer beeindruckt! Brille ist ausgezeichnet! Bild Top, Preis noch Okay! Sound ist absolut ausreichend für mich! Installation und Einrichtung ging flott! Im Steam war die Einrichtung eventuell etwas langwierriger.Spielen macht wieder richtig Spaß!Einziger Kritikpunkt für mich, der Markt an Spielen ist noch sehr übersichtlich. Hoffe da kommt noch mehr!Einige nette Shooter wie "Contractors VR" und Pavlov , oder auch das Kletterspiel "The Climb" sowie Flugsimulatoren wie DCS World und F/A-18 Carrier Landing machen richtig viel Spaß! Schon toll wenn man si richtig im Cockpit sitzen kann! Ob sich die VR Technik durchsetzen wird, zeigt sich noch, weil es doch einiges an Bewegung verlangt :-) !
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 1 September 2019

one_reviews_text: Pros: solid hardware, comfortable even for long periods of time, doesn't require infrared captors for tracking.Cons: software is atrocious and is no longer updated by Oculus, which means you have to unplug, replug, restart the Oculus client and sometimes your computer, for about 10 minutes every time you want to use it. It now also requires you to sign in with a Facebook account in order to use it. Also batteries in the Touch controller drain way too fast.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 31 October 2020

one_reviews_text: Figo è figo, bellissimo i primi 30 minuti durante la configurazione, poi all'atto pratico a me dopo 20 minuti di gioco (paranormal activity) mi è venuta nausea e giramenti di testa, ho riprovato la sera e lo stesso, ho dovuto renderlo, ma per chi non soffre magari va bene. Per sfruttarlo al meglio serve un computer bello potente
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 23 January 2021
review_title: Bello ma crea giramenti di testa

one_reviews_text: Great piece of kit at a great price. The lack of external sensors means less USB ports so I'm able to run this off my laptop with USB3 and a USB-C to DP converter.One massive flaw that has yet to be fixed:- On older machines, the USB 3 triggers reboot loops on the device where the device isn't being detected properly after reboot of machine. After a complete re-setup it works fine again however is super annoying. This is a wide spread issue that a lot of people are having.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 22 June 2020
review_title: Great upgrade from Rift CV1, especially if USB ports are limited. Major bugs is annoying though

one_reviews_text: Decisamente un passo avanti rispetto al suo predecessore, l’oculus Rift, sotto molti punti di vista.Tuttavia mi sento di criticare un po’ di trascuratezza nel progetto in quanto il reparto ottico presenta una FOV ancora limitante.È complicato trovato la posizione ideale e soprattutto la visione marginale è insoddisfacente.Ottimo per il gioco casuale, ma ancora con ampi margini di miglioramento per applicazioni più complesse come i simulatori.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 2 February 2020

one_reviews_text: J'ai décidé de me prendre ce casque pour avoir essayer celui de la génération précédente et qui était un peu compliqué à mettre en place correctement. Avec l'Oculus Rift S pas de capteurs comme sur l’Oculus Rift, 2 manettes et un câble sur le pc et hop c'est parti dans la VR. Le caque est agréable et pas trop lourd du coup il arrive à se faire oublier. Le seul défaut c'est le câble qui est certes long mais que j'aurai aimé plus long....J'espère qu'ils sortiront une rallonge un jour.. Sinon rien à dire
review_date: Reviewed in France on 19 June 2019

one_reviews_text: Ho ordinato il prodotto in preordine, appena arrivato l'ho provato ma dava schermo nero, passato il pomeriggio a cambiare impostazioni ma niente, ho anche provato con un altro PC ma niente. Sembra un buon prezzo ma il prodotto è immaturo, speriamo in miglioramenti futuri. per fortuna c'era Amazon - reso e soldi restituiti
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 5 June 2019

one_reviews_text: Ne ho acquistato uno ad aprile  e dopo tre mesi ha iniziato a dare problemi, i sensori non funzionavano più. Grazie alla disponibilità di Amazon hanno accettato il reso e ne ho ricomprato un altro. Anche il secondo dopo 40 giorni ha dato problemi con la porta USB. Onestamente penso che il produttore dovrebbe curare meglio la qualità di questo prodotto.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 15 October 2019

one_reviews_text: Es bessert sich: Erst gab es probleme mit der Vibration (sobald die Controller Vibriert haben, verlor der Tracker die Kontrolle). Die Akku probleme werden immer besser aber die Schaumstoffränder saugen sich mit dem Schweiß voll, weshalb es ziemlich unhygienisch ist wenn mehrere das Gerät nutzen.Ich empfehle daher zusätzlich ein Anti Schweiß aufsatz zu kaufen.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 6 July 2020

one_reviews_text: I've been using the Rift S for a couple weeks now, and it's definitely opened up a whole new world of entertainment, but I don't think the technology or the apps are quite good enough for VR to go mainstream.Pros:- Super easy to set up; barely an inconvenience; no lightboxes to set up- Fairly comfortable headset- Controllers are comfortable to hold and use- Price is reasonable- A wide selection of games and apps support the Rift S and the new controllers, including those developed or published by OculusCons:- Image quality isn't perfect, with noticeable screen door effect- Foam surfaces are not removable, so a protective cover at least for the face part is recommended- Sound quality of built-in speakers is mediocre with practically no bass responseOverall, I would recommend this set if you're budget is under a grand and want to get into VR for as little hassle as possible.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 6 September 2019
review_title: An Easy Way to Get VR for the PC

one_reviews_text: I dieci hertz in meno 80 contro i 90 del vecchio Rift,si fanno sentire tanto...ma tanto....come la differenza di audio....sono andati a risparmio,tutta via lo sto ancora testando
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 14 June 2019

one_reviews_text: Reçu dans sa boîte avec un sur emballage, et dans le délai annoncéDe plus avec le code de sécurité reçu par mail et à donner au livreur, pas de peur de perte pendant la livraisonConcernant le produit-Si vous avez la configuration nécessaire sur votre PC, c’est fantastiqueJ’hésitais avec le dernier modèle qui peut se jouer sur quasiment tous les supports de jeux, et surtout moins cherMais j’ai découvert qu’il fallait acheter un boîtier supplémentaire pour cela, et que cela revenait au même au final-le casque en lui même est agréable à porter, et on s adapte facilement aux touches de contrôle sur les manettes qui tiennent bien en mainPar contre le câble de connexion relié au PC finit par créer une tension au niveau du cou, si vous ne voulez pas finir en jouant avec la tête penché en avantIl faut le maintenir en hauteur pour ne pas générer cette gênePerso, je l’ai coincé dans mon fauteuil (voir photo)  donc le « problème » se règle rapidement et à moindre coûtA part ça, rien à dire c’est génial, et je ne regrette rien La qualité est au rendez vous
review_date: Reviewed in France on 24 January 2021

one_reviews_text: Delusione, il visore dopo qualche ora di utilizza è andato in blocco. Cerco una soluzione sul sito del produttore per poter resettare il dispositivo. C’è scritto che nel programma, tra le impostazioni, ci dovrebbe essere questa funzione ma invece c’è solo la possibilità di riavviare il dispositivo. Ho contattato Amazon per aver supporto essendo distributore ufficiale ma la soluzione migliore è scontata è stata la restituzione del prodotto come difettoso. Avrò avuto sfortunate ma è certo che in un programma di un visore, di un certo costo, non avere la possibilità di fare un reset del dispositivo è abbastanza imbarazzante. Per quel poco che sono riuscito ad usarlo va bene per chi accetta un compromesso tra la risoluzione e il costo. È abbastanza comodo anche per chi usa occhiali, ovviamente dipende dalla grandezza dell’occhiale, l’unico inconveniente fastidioso è che non c’è ricircolo di aria e quindi si appannano quasi subito sia gli occhiali che le lenti del visore.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 25 February 2021

one_reviews_text: Qualität der Verarbeitung: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐Qualität des Displays: ⭐⭐⭐⭐Tragekomort: ⭐⭐⭐⭐Sound: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐Mikrofon Qualität: ⭐⭐⭐⭐Tracking: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐Die VR Brille ist für viel Plastik wirklich sehr gut verarbeitet, wirkt sehr robust, trotzdem sollte man sie auf garkeinen Fall auf den Boden fallen lassen, da mit Sicherheit so große Schäden entstehen werden. Es wackelt und klappert nichts.Das Bild ist aufgrund der Pixel und "Sub Pixel" wirklich sehr gut, man merkt gar nicht das man so nah an einem Display mit den Augen ist, stellen Sie sich mal direkt vor ihren Fernseher, ganz nah ran mit den Augen, da sehen sie das Gittermuster des Displays, das sehen sie bei der Brille so gut wie gar nicht, aber wenn es nach meiner Meinung geht, sogar überhaupt nicht, dank der Sub Pixel.Es trägt sich wirklich sehr gut man muss es eben nur richtig an den Kopf schnallen (mittels Drehspanner am Hinderkopf und Kopfband vom Hinterkopf bis zur Stirn auf der Schädelplatte. Das Gesichtspolster was ab Werk eingebaut ist, kann man auch austauschen und von anderen Herstellern verwenden falls einem das nicht so angenehm ist. Jedoch ist das ab Werk wirklich angenehm und kratzt oder juckt nicht auf der Haut.dafür dass nur kleine Lautsprecher in dem Kopfträger drin sind klingen die erstaunlich gut, also ist über dem Ohr und nicht drauf oder direkt davor. Man kann natürlich ein eigenes Headset nehmen, ich habe das Logitech Artemis, trägt sich richtig gut damit.Ich habe mich offen gesagt nicht selber gehört, aber ich habe es einfach durch "VR Chat" probiert und man versicherte mir dass die Qualität wohl sehr gut sein soll. Ansonsten das Headset eigene verwenden oder ein Kondensator Mikrofon.Das Tracking ist tatsächlich wirklich sehr gut, solange sich die Controller innerhalb der Kameras an der VR Brille aufhalten, am Hinterkopf werden diese also nicht mehr getracked.Fazit: Eine wahnsinnig gute VR Brille, wobei ich keine Referenz habe zu anderen VR Brillen, aber für das erste Mal war es Atemberaubend! Eine absolute Kaufempfehlung!
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 3 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Por desgracia tuve que devolver el producto por un fallo en la lente izquierda. no era algo preocupante pero lo compre nuevo. El traking es genial, la visión cerca esta muy bien pero si quieres jugar pavlov le falta algo de detalle para ver bien las mirillas. es un producto excelente calidad precio y año de lanzamiento. me gustó mucho adentrarme en el vr con estas gafas. Si es para empezar y no estas seguro de que vas a jugar shooters este es tu headset calidad precio / traking al estar muy bien programado puedes mover el mando y equipar y desequipar cosas de tu espalda como flechas o armas. me parece una muy buena compra dado que los demás tienen peor traking y o requiere de estaciones de traking.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 21 October 2020

one_reviews_text: I simply love my Rift S. I haven't played a flat game since I purchased it. I really don't have any bad things to say about it at all. Was super easy to set up and the quality of the image is fantastic. The tracking feels almost perfect. This was my first VR experience and I liken it to my first microwave/VCR/CD-ROM player. Total game changer. The game titles are relatively cheap in comparison to non-VR titles. In most cases, about half the price. Buy a Rift S, you will not regret it.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 10 February 2020
review_title: Best VR Experience for the price.

one_reviews_text: Obligation d'avoir un compte Facebook pour s'en servir. Logiciel de l'appareil constamment en mémoire et qui envoie des informations sur vos activités. Impossible de desactiver le mouchard sans mettre hors service l'appareil. Si votre vie privée n'a aucune importance, alors ce casque est fait pour vous.  A part ça, l'appareil est tombé en panne au bout de 3 jours... Sans commentaire.
review_date: Reviewed in France on 17 October 2020

one_reviews_text: Beh ragazzi è il mio primo visore ma ci sono delle volte ,che perdo il contatto con la realtà. Oggi stavo per litigare con il tizio del tennis. È un bel giocattolino. Lavorare con una tecnologia così sarebbe fantasmagorico.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 25 November 2019

one_reviews_text: C'est une technologie tout simplement impressionnante !Attention la mise en place peut s'averer un peu capricieuse, il faudra vous armer de patience pour les capteurs soit reconnus.Une fois cette étape passé (recherche google qui aident a résoudre les problèmes), laissez-vous porter par le tutoriel qui en met plein les yeux !Petit bémol :Je trouve assez mesquin de la part d'oculus de ne pas être clair sur ses casques :  -> J'ai pris l'oculus rift s pour jouer sur PC OR le Quest 2 (100 euros moins cher) peut désormais le faire aussi et avec des meilleures specs en plus, résultat, retour du rift s pour moi et commande du Quest 2.A part ça, foncer sur cette technologie si vous en avez les moyen car c'est du très très lourd ! =)
review_date: Reviewed in France on 4 December 2020

one_reviews_text: Un prodotto veramente superlativo ad un prezzo alto ma comunque ragionevole. Zero motion sickness, semplicità di montaggio ed utilizzo e l'app oculus che funziona egregiamente. Per qualità prezzo assolutamente il miglior visore in commercio.Spedizione rapida, imballaggio efficace e sicuro che nasconde la scatola originale del prodotto
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 11 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Avevo già il primo Rift, e se è vero che questo non stravolge nulla è altrettanto vero che ne migliora tutti gli aspetti (refresh a parte che comunque non si nota) più comodo e miglior risoluzione che aiuta soprattutto nella lettura o nella visione in lontananza. Quello che non ho capito e stato cambiare le cuffie che sul primo Rift facevano il loro lavoro, ho ovviato comprando un paio di auricolari di ottima qualità che ne migliora l'esperienza. Personalmente l'unico problema riscontrato è la mancanza di tempo da dedicare a questo gioiello tecnologico! Assolutamente consigliato!
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 16 December 2019

one_reviews_text: This is a good little system, but one I had to work to enjoy.  VR for the older (46) person can be fraught with having to retrain your brain for some things.  I had to drink and eat bunches of ginger and mentally prepare myself for each journey but I am close to there now.  I can play without too many issues.That said, the Rift is a really good system.  The one issue I do have with it is the software is not very user friendly, or easy to navigate.  I had to spend a bit of time taking the headset off, looking at user manuals, getting back in trying out new things, hopping out etc... Following their bouncing ball tutorials is not the easiest way to learn the system.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 18 November 2020
review_title: Need to get your VR legs

one_reviews_text: la verdad me esperaba otra cosa,el producto tiene una calidad pesima se nota la mano de lenovo, el FOV es una verguenza y el sonido no digamos,despues el calor que dan es insoportable y te las tienes que pegar a la cara muchisimo para tener el punto dulce bien y por ultimo el ipd por software no vale para nada, si las recomiendo para nada tiene pocos pros y muchos contras
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 21 July 2020

one_reviews_text: Als erstes will ich sagen das ich von der Brille überhaus begeistert bin und alles funktioniert bis auf paar Kleinigkeiten und dazu komme ich jetzt:1. Die Bänder an den Controllern rutschen immer wieder zurück womit es nicht möglich ist den Controller dauerhaft fest zu halten (mit den band am handgelenk).2. Die Brille selbst. Besonders wenn ich ein Spiel Starte kann es passieren das die Brille die Controller nicht mehr erkennt und im Spiel wiederum kann ich diese zwar bewegen (links rechts hoch runter) aber die befinden sich auf einer Stelle & somit muss ich die Brille ausschalten und wieder einschalten was extrem nervig ist (war bei der alten oculus rift nie das problem) desweiteren muss ich jedes mal den Spielbereich neu einstellen sowie Bodenhöhe und den Guardian selbst wenn ich NICHTS verändere an den Raum (es befindet sich nur ein PC samt Eq drinne) einige Spiele wie Gorn oder Onward lassen sich somit nicht Problemlos Spielen was ich schade finde daher kann ich deswegen nur 2 Sterne geben und ich hoffe das ein zukünftiges UPDATE diese Probleme beheben !
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 15 September 2020

one_reviews_text: Been using this for more than a month, the controller tracking is absolutely unusable when there are even a little bit of sunlight.Controller tracking drops for like 3 times per minute, sometimes the tracking doesn't drop but shows that my hands are a few meters away from me.Totally a nightmare when playing beat saber. The only solution is to avoid any sunlight.Sometimes it won't even recognize the environment around, then I have to do the setting again...Plus, the left speaker doesn't work (seems like a popular issue), so I have to use an external one.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 20 October 2019
review_title: Tracking is absolutely rubbish. Left speaker doesn't work.

one_reviews_text: The Oculus Rift remains functional and immersive, if you have a computer that can handle it, unfortunately it wasn't my case, and also no HDMI (DisplayPort-only), still uses a physical cable to connect to a PC. The resolution is lower than the Oculus Quest, it can by messy with the cable on the floor. First hand with SteamVR requires tinkering to use. Can be a nightmare if you want to watch a movie in the dark room.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 25 August 2020
review_title: Mitigate - Let's wait the next gen !

one_reviews_text: Creo que proporcionan una buena introducción en el mundo VR a un precio razonable. Pero recientemente he recibido un mensaje, de que en un futuro será obligado de darme de alta en Facebook para poder usarla. Esto es un autentico timo, no quiero Facebook, ni que me obliguen a darme de alta. 2do fallo: durante este año de uso he tenido muchos problemas de conexión del equipo (normalmente relacionado con updates e USB) en dos ocasiones tardó mas que una semana hasta que se resolvió el problema. No me las compraría otra vez.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 22 December 2019
review_title: Buena introducción en el tema RV (VR) PERO

one_reviews_text: Als Einsteiger in Virtual Reality gaming habe ich mich für diese Brille entschieden, weil die alternativen viel zu teuer sind(Valve Index, HTC Vive Pro).Bisher nur positives zu berichten. Die Auflösung ist sehr gut und die geringeren Hz bemerkt man nicht.Im Oculus Store gibt es einige gute Demos, aber noch keine Titel, die unbedingt den Kauf von Oculus rechtfertigen.Die Rift S funktioniert problemlos mit SteamVR/OpenVR Titeln. Besonders Beat Saber ist zu empfehlen für Gelegenheitsspieler.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 23 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Visually, yes, the S is a nice step up from the CV1... and tracking is now on par. Rift CV1 and Rift S owner here. I'm quite pleased with how Oculus team has been handling this latest Rift offering.THE PROS:• **UPDATE 6/27/2019** - with Oculus’s latest software release, Beta Test Branch 1.39, inside-out tracking issues seem to have been resolved!! With few exceptions, those “hands too close to the headset” and “behind the back” dead-zones are no longer there. I can now use rifles, bows, climb, block hits, push off walls from behind, and sculpt without loss of tracking! Amazing! Way to put those accelerometers to use and tighten up your algorithms Oculus! I couldn’t be happier.• The slight bump in pixel density/clarity might not look like much on paper, but it’s a HUGE relief to my eyes compared to the Rift CV1! Hardly any SDE or god rays. (yes, LCD produces a cleaner, albeit less black-black, image over OLED in VR... who’d a thunk?) That alone prevented me from immediately returning my S, but now that tracking has been addressed, I’ve since shelved my CV1 in favor of the S.• Initial setup of the headset and laying the guardian barrier map is quick and easy. Remember, room scale tracking is accomplished by using the cameras from the headset. If you change your room layout (ie. ya pick up your large dirty clothes piles that were strewn about), you may have to recalibrate depending on the volume of stuff moved. Thankfully, recalibration doesn’t take any major effort or time.• Thank the maker for the passthrough feature! So, with the headset blocking your sense of the outside world… when you get close to a wall or some furniture, a grid fades begins to emerge depending on your proximity to said obstacles. Once you cross a threshold, the S’s Passthrough vision kicks in. This presents the headset wearer with a stitched together granny monochrome view of your environment of reality… from the tracking cameras. It’s not high enough resolution to read anything on a screen, but you can get an idea of what’s on your PC monitor, easily locate & pickup your hand controllers, or move the chair you about fell over.• I prefer the option of using my own quality headphones. Honestly, either one of the Rift’s offerings has gotten me by, but if we’re talking the “best audio” here, a good set of Sennheizer or Bose phones can’t be beat.  6/7/2019 - Oculus released a firmware update to enhance the missing low frequencies on the internal speakers. The sound has improved, but given the choice, I still prefer using my own headphones over either of the CV1’s or S’s built in audio.• The head strap is convenient to use and is quite comfortable. I loosen the tension, slide the headset over my glasses, pull the strap around the back of my head, and reset the tension so it fits nice snug.• I no longer need a 3rd party spacer to extend the lenses away from my glasses that I wear. There is a button on the headset that moves the lenses either closer or farther from my eyes.• The lenses don’t scratch NEARLY as easily as the CV1’s. You’d breath wrong on the original CV1’s and a scratch would about appear, haha. The S’s are not by any means “scratch proof”, but they resist them a lot better than the CV1 lenses.• the complete unit only costs $399! That’s a lotta’ bang for your buck!• Oculus seems to be working to continuously improve on their product. That’s arguably a nice reassurance.THE CONS:• The foam rubber padding around the face isn’t removable from the plastic insert, nor is it what I’d call easily washable. I’ve found saturating the foam with heavily diluted dish soap and blotting it dry with paper towels works best (after removing the plastic insert from the headset, that is). A quick, periodic wipe of isopropyl helps keep the bacteria from taking over further. We MAY someday be able replace the entire plastic insert with its cemented-on foam. Here’s to hope!• The halo head-strap tensioner… idk, I don’t have a tremendous amount of faith in it not wearing out over time. I say this because my welding helmet uses a similar method of tightening the band. Although these industrial straps hold up well, their mechanical tensioners are usually the first parts to fail. Time will tell I suppose.• It’s more convenient to use the poorer Rift audio than to put your own headphones over the headset. In their defense, I’m certain we’ll be seeing an offering that is like the CV1’s earphones. They put that stereo jack there for a reason. Regarding the stereo jack… I would suggest using a 90° connector/tether over one that sticks straight out. I could see it getting hit and cracking the solder joints that keep the jack in place. Once that breaks, you’ll get static or complete loss of the audio signal.THE MOOT (doesn’t affect me personally but may you):• Doesn’t work with HDMI. It says so right on the Oculus site and in the description that it requires a Display Port. No one should be upset about that. If that’s the reason for a poor product review, idk what to tell ya. Perhaps a little research or reading could've saved you the hassle of returning your spontaneous purchase. It comes with a DP>MiniDP adapter. There are reports of a couple DP>USB-C adapters successfully working.• Still gets just as hot under there as any other headset I’ve used. The nonexistent airflow makes my face get sweaty after prolonged use. So, periodic breaks are necessary. Again, make sure you clean the face padding regularly. I can only imagine how nasty it’ll get over time if you don’t... like unwashed undies after mowing the grass kinda’ gross. In any event, I would think twice about “borrowing your friend’s”, hahaha.• IPD adjusting is done via software settings ranging from 54mm to 72mm in fractional 0.5mm increments. My eyes reside about 62.5mm from one another, so I fall well within the allotted midrange. For those whose eyes are spaced differently, and therefore must get closer to the extreme ends of the spectrum, there are reports of problems. The CV1’s method of adjusting IPD was mechanical and moved two lenses to focus on different portions of the two independent screens behind them. The S’s lenses are fixed and has one single screen positioned behind them. Adjusting the IPD setting in software moves the frames on that screen – increasing/decreasing a gap that divides the right and left sides. Because the lenses themselves don’t move, I could see where obtaining a sharp focus on the action may theoretically be a problem for some. Maybe not though. Even if the software IPD settings work for you, swapping between players may have you leaving an app to adjust for Player 2 and returning again for Player 1. That could be annoying.• The controllers are fine. I didn’t break the tracking rings after punching my walls and furnishings like others have reported doing after merely dropping them on a hard floor. So, I’m not seeing where these new controllers differ in quality from the CV1. They feel different (and not in a “this is flimsy plastic” sort of way) and are a fraction smaller... but why wouldn’t that simply be by design? After a couple hours of use, I adapted to the ring location and had no problem reloading rifles,  drawing bows, or aiming pistols. In fact, I can hold a pistol more realistically than I could with the CV1. Weight distribution due to rings being on top vs. wrapping around the bottom? They’re lightweight plastic rings for Pete’s sake. If your wrists feel encumbered from the weight, then the change is a beneficial one for you… as this will only strengthen that area. It’s no PX90, but at least you won’t atrophy away.• Some people complain about the directional audio not living up to its claim. This doesn’t seem to be a hardware issue so much as a software developer thing. Some titles simply could do better with their spherical  360° sound mapping is all. I have no major complaints with the Rift hardware itself in this area. Most titles I use, I can easily tell where the sound is coming from, and I’m hopeful the one’s that aren’t up to speed will improve on that.• The mic? Everyone seems to be able to hear me just fine when I talk. Granted, it’s no RØDE or Sennheiser, but I didn’t expect it to be. It accepts all the sound waves I spew at it just fine. Really people, I know I’m not the only one sporting an S in the games I play. The only time I hear something weird is when someone doesn’t have their mic/headphone levels set correctly... giving us that robotic reverb, annoying feedback, or just cuts out. But that is the case with any headset. You weren’t planning on using it for voice-over work or laying down vocal tracks on your next single, right? Any of you who can tell a major difference in mics... idk what to say. If we’re completely honest, none of these headsets have “amazing audio” hardware, so... take it as you will and let’s get back to focusing on the meat and potatoes.• Direct sunlight can burn the screen and/or harm the cameras (is that any real surprise though?). The lenses are just magnifying glasses…. Think of how those ants felt when ya burnt them under the summer sun. For shame. Again, go to the Oculus site and read up on the product you purchased for details, but the gist of it is, “using it outside at noon is a bad idea”.• Doesn’t function in complete darkness or very well in dim light. Digital cameras require light for the VISUAL SENSORS to detect… light. Meh, so I turn a light on. Good to go. Tracking gets finicky in oversaturated rooms, or those with too many windows and/or mirrors. Some lighting emits a specific frequency (as with SOME fluorescent and lower-end LED lighting) if the pulses phase up to your devices, you may notice some “glitching”. We’ll likely see some improvements in this area as soon as they buckle down exposure parameters.• I let my 9y/o kid play, and the halo doesn’t quite get tight enough without putting a towel back there to take up some slack. Just an FYI for those of you with smaller heads.In conclusion, yeah, I believe the S is enough of a step up to consider it an upgrade, and one that I am happy I made. Will I go so far as to say it’s a 2.0? Well, Oculus has made it a point not to have marketed it as such. But man, after the latest firmware and software upgrades, I’m ALMOST willing to say it could be a Rift 2.0!Processor: Intel i7 4790, RAM: 16 Gig, Video: MSI RTX 2070 Duke, 8 Gig, OS: Windows 10A little prelude (ad the end of the review, haha):My first experience an actual VR headset was in the 90’s with the VFX1. With a resolution of somewhere around 240² per eye, 256 colors at a time, tracking/movement latency, and a frame rate that had us calling it the “tunnel-vision migraine machine”, ANY of today’s headsets are like a dream come true in comparison. These early devices were novel but limited to a handful of playable games like Descent, Quake, and some flight simulator whose title escapes me. Ok until you’d succumb to the headache or crashed your OS… whichever came first.So, although we may be able to pick these current products apart to find their flaws, I’m still thrilled to be able to use any of these devices. They are exponentially more capable and affordable than their pre-2015 predecessors... heck, even our lowest-end cell phone VR rigs have more processing power than the PCs we were tethered to back then.  Depending on one’s level of entitlement, expectation, and/or brand loyalty, you can draw your own conclusions. I’ve given you mine.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 May 2019
review_title: Visually, yes, the S is a nice step up from the CV1

one_reviews_text: CONFEZIONE PERFETTA, Prodotto ottimo, la cosa che mi ha stupido di più è che all'arrivo era dentro un cartone che aveva addirittura degli scomparti per evitare le botte dell'articolo laterali, cosa che non si vede sempre, complimenti, in più l'oculus funziona benissimo ed è ottimo 👍!
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 22 January 2021

one_reviews_text: Llevo usandolo un año y me parece un producto genial. A dia de hoy, en lo que se refiere a visores con cable, sigue siendo una opcion a tener en cuenta hasta que perfeccionen el del quest 2.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 8 December 2020

one_reviews_text: Context: I mainly play DiRT Rally 2.I owned the CV1 for 3.5 years. Bought Rift S mainly because I wanted a better image clarity / less of a screen door effect. Did I get what I was after? I sure did. Not without paying the price, though.My problems so far included:1) Windows doesn't recognise Rift if it's plugged in when I power on and boot the computer. Yes, I tried all USB ports, and no, it didn't help. Work-around - unplug the Rift before powering on; plug in once logged into Windows.2) Rift's audio when experienced through headphones plugged into the headset is a complete and utter garbage. There is loud high-pitched background noise, and to add an insult to injury it isn't even balanced between L and R. I resorted to plugging my headphones directly into my PC's sound output, which works marvellously.3) If you take the headset off in a middle of the game and then put it back on, it doesn't restore the position where you took it off (remember, I'm sitting in a cockpit chair, so no, I didn't move). This means I need to re-set the position from within the game, which could at times be problematic (e.g. if paused while barrelling down the narrow twisty dirt road in a forest at 100 mph).With inside-out tracking there's obviously the case of hand controllers not tracking if your headset can't see them (think shooting a bow); I tho don't play these types of games much so it's not much of an issue.On the positive side, the headband with a twisty lock is better than the Velcro on CV1; and the image quality is positively much, much better. And the experience with swapping from the CV1 was good as I didn't have to make any changes to the installed Oculus software.Where does that leave me? I will probably put up with it until I can get an Index, and then give it a slip. I guess it was fun while it lasted, as Facebook doesn't seem to care much about the desktop VR.Update 15 Sep (10 days later):More negatives to add, I'm afraid.4) It appears that Rift S wakes up its hand controllers whether you touch them or not (I don't, since I play with a wheel and don't need them). This leads to controllers unnecessarily eating up their batteries. I had to pull the batteries out, because I was getting messages about low battery.5) Oculus software was forgetting about the play area now and then, asking to set it up again. It did it a couple times before I pulled the batteries from the hand controllers (see above). With the controllers' batteries out, it now tells me that the play area hasn't been set up every time I power the PC on and start using the headset.6) Today the headset went dark (screen went off, Windows popped up message that the Oculus has malfunctioned) in the middle of playing a game. I disconnected Oculus' USB and reconnected, which brought it back to life, but seriously. Ugh.Very tempted to pull the rating to two stars at this point, to be frank.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 5 September 2020
review_title: Apart from image quality, a step back from CV1 in almost every way

one_reviews_text: In alcune situazioni e scomodo e dopo un ora o 2 di uso stanca la testa e gli occhi ma tutto sommatto super sodisfatto i giochi vr come onward o h3vr sono una favola da giocare e vedersi nel visore effetto zanzariera nulla e fov fantastico per il top amazon poi con la storia delle 5 rate a 90€ e consegna in 1 giorno the best GRAZIE AMAZON <3 SIETE I MIGLIORI.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 5 December 2020

one_reviews_text: Für den Einsteigern mit dem entsprechenden Rechner eine klare Empfehlung. Skyrim, Fallout4 sind dann nochmal auf einen anderen Level."ABER": WIe bei allen anderen VR Brillen ist das Angebot an Top Spielen/Erfahrungen die einem länger fesseln bescheiden. Fast alle Exclusiv VR Spiele/Angebote sind im Vergleich zu richtigen Vollpreis PC/XBOX etc. Titeln ehr kurz und mager in der Tiefe. Wer Ballerspiele, Sport/Fitness und Rennspiele mag, findet aber genug Stoff. RPG/Adventure oder Tactic Spieler haben derzeit wenig Freude. Es sei man geht auf "alte" Angebote (Skyrim/Fallout) zurück.Mein Fazit trozdem, einmal in VR gespielt und die Atmosphäre gespürt, macht es schwer dann zurück zum Flatscree zu gehen.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 21 July 2019

one_reviews_text: Awsome product.Came on time, had no issues with it. I will say i would of preferred a better face mask as it will leave your face sore if you play for more then 3 hours, i ended up ordering a better one that can be cleaned and has better comfort.Kinda wish i got the oculus quest for portability even though it has a less refresh rate and less visual quality when connected to pc. my pc has nvidea 1070 and i7 cpu 16gb ram so a very small handfull of games that are not optimized will not run, so just as a note to people thinking of buying this i think the 1060 would be the bare minimum. However 99% games run great with full 80fps on a 1070 with antialising set to minimum.Overall this is a much better choice then the htc as this has a bigger library support with much better controllers with actual thumb sticks at the cost of losing tracking sometimes with its insideout tracking method.I recommend this product.The Rift S and the Quest are both affordable and fully capable of the software and functionality of there competitors.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 2 January 2020

one_reviews_text: Overall, a decent quality system. Good price point. Good graphics. Amazing feeling when using it. However, the microphone died and now sounds like I'm megatron after 2 weeks of use. Easily remedied by having an external mic, but I'd rather the on-board on. The face gasket is way too big, and puts my eyes too far away from where they are more comfortable. And of course that lead to the ring on my face. But since I took it off I've had a much better overall experience in VR than I did with it. Definitely recommend it, but do be careful with which games you place because motion sickness is a thing that I didn't like dealing with while I got used to the system.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 18 April 2020

one_reviews_text: I love it!I bought this headset primarily for DCS World but have ended up using it for lots of other apps too.Overall it was pretty simple to install and setup and I had no issues with firmware or anything else that others had reported. I found the controllers sometimes are not detected initially when starting the Oculus software, but they do eventually come to life a minute or two later.The main Oculus software app is not the greatest, Ouculus software automatically starts when I launch a game that may have used the VR headset previously. A small problem but apparently no fix for it.As for the headset itself, I found it comfortable to use but the cable position is annoying and would be best positioned at the rear of the headset. The sound isnt the best, but passable and the use of alternative sound source is recommended. The resolution of the Rift could be better, and if you dont have it sitting on your head properly you will find the picture quality deteriorates. Ive also had condensation build up within the headset to when wearing it - kind like when you fog up with Ski goggles but it hasnt happened too much.Overall Im quite happy with the Rift S as my first VR headset. DCS world is such an amazing sim now that I have the Rift, and the experience has been totally worth the investment. Its certainly brought lots of joy for the family but I will be investing in a headset with better resolution in time to come. For a first time buy I would recommend it!
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 3 September 2020

one_reviews_text: I'm a pretty hard core gamer, been gaming for 35 years and I game close to 30 hours a week. VR is a new tasty treat, and I really love the immersion in skyrim etc and the workout of a good fight in Thrill of the fight.  The chord is my biggest niggle as it is always in my way. The other issue is the clarity of the games while in the headset is a step back from the high resolution glory of my 21:9 monitor....the 3d worlds make up for that though.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 17 July 2019
review_title: VR is cool, but the dangling cables not so much

one_reviews_text: First of all, I'm very happy with this purchase. It arrived well packaged in couple of boxes (great packaging). As of first VR set that I own, I can say that it is quite light and very comfortable which helps immersion extensively. The only thing that brakes it from time to time is cables, maybe I'll find some long term solution to make them less annoying, but knowing that I would use it near PC I didn't want to go with Quest simply cause I don't want to have extra weight on my head. As far as VR games are concern gtx 1070 is enough, but if you want to go with sim racing, you'll have a bad time, especially with something like ACC, so keep that in mind. After all, great purchase and my only regret is not buying this headset earlier.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 5 September 2020
review_title: Comfortable, cables might be a problem.

one_reviews_text: Je me suis beaucoup documenté sur les différentes solutions proposées et j'ai choisi cet Oculus Rift S parce qu’il correspondait à mon cahier des charges minimum.... et je ne suis pas déçu.Je dispose déjà d'une config Tour PC Gamer musclée et mon système doit:- Etre assez puissant pour faire tourner sans trop de perte de qualité les jeux les plus réalistes proposés en VR ( exit pour moi l'oculus Quest).- Confortable: Pouvoir être mis avec des lunettes de vue ( pas de buée, bonne résolution, ergonomie des manettes, le moins de fils possibles.- Déplaçable facilement: passer du bureau au salon ou dans le jardin pour un maximum de degré de liberté. C'est très appréciable quand il y a des amis qui veulent essayer... donc exit pour moi les casques avec 2 ou 4 caméras extérieures.L'Oculus Rift m'a semblé le meilleur compromis. Puissant, pas de caméras extérieures à monter, un seul fil à la patte donnant 3m de débattement effectifs, son intégré (de bonne qualité, plus besoin d'écouteur ou casque audio) et l'effet WHAOU dès le début.Bien sûr, il y a la définition à améliorer et le sans fil total qui représenterait une avancée décisive, mais dans cette gamme raisonnable de prix (moins de 450€) le plaisir est là, immédiatement, qui me fait balayer toutes les critiques des spécialistes qui doivent bien trouver quelque chose à dire.Donc : Bon choix et de plus impressionnant comme je le souhaitais
review_date: Reviewed in France on 23 January 2021

one_reviews_text: Does everything it says on the box and more!I've used this thing for a good number of hours at this point and don't have any major flaws to speak of, the quality of the materials is good and the unit has a good feel to it, the only drawback here is that the headset has (comparatively) quite a bit of weight and if you don't have decent cable management in place the weight of the unit plus the tug/drag of the cable itself can cause you some neck strain over time -- fixable with an overhead cable routing system.Admittedly I haven't used many other VR headsets to compare it against, my particular unit has at least 1 dead pixel which is noticeable however doesn't destroy the experience, and apparently is within tolerance of Oculus quality control, this being the second Rift S unit I've owned, the previous unit never had this issue however did turn itself into a paperweight fairly quickly due to some sort of driver/sensor issue - to which I never received a response from Oculus support.Overall - The after sale support is lacking, you may not get any help if it doesn't work out of the box, however when it works, its great, and it's definitely not a disappointing way to start out in VR without breaking the bank.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 27 August 2020
review_title: Decent Product for a Reasonable Price

one_reviews_text: PROS:-The presentation of this product in the box and ease of setup could rival that of apple products.- After taking it out of the box, I plugged it in and installed the drivers. It detected without issues, including the touch controllers. I was up and running in 15 minutes. Much better experience than expected.- The guardian system is great, if you never used VR before, have no worries of smashing something in your room. Much better than expected.- Tracking is superb according to my limited experince- highly intuitive. Both me and my girlfriend got the hang of the controls really quickCONS:- games: there is few good ones, and some can make you feel a bit motion sick, if their controls are setup badlyAll in all as a first time VR user I have no complaints. The software works great. The only complaints I have would be over specific games and their usage of controllers.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 9 January 2020
review_title: Product and presentation as it should be

one_reviews_text: Oculus Rift S è un prodotto interessante e, per molti aspetti, è migliore di Oculus Rift:- è più facile da configurare;- è più comodo da indossare;- libreria di giochi molto più ampia;- risoluzione superiore (2,560 x 1,440).- ecc..L'unica pecca che secondo me ha influito un po' in negativo è che i controller sono molto "plasticosi" e appena prendono una botta c'è il rischio che si spacchino, come è successo a me.Ora con il visore gioco su questo PC con queste determinate caratteristiche:- SCHEDA GRAFICA: GTX1060/AMD RADEON RX480 o superiore.- CPU Intel i5-4590/AMD Ryzen 1500X o superiore.- RAM 8GB.- USCITA VIDEO Display port 1.2.- Porte USB 2.0 x1.- Windows 10.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 8 March 2022

one_reviews_text: It will live up to your expectation if you do your research about what it does great and what it doesn't.Gave it 4 star because of the minor glitch of displaying 1 "static" noise frame every 20 minutes or so.Update: oculus updated their firmware and the noise frame is gone, it's very enjoyable now
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 26 May 2019

one_reviews_text: I sold my vive for this and I am a happy consumer. The visuals are just that much better than the vive. Way less screen door effect so things just look clearer and text is now readable. I have no issues with tracking, I actually was able to get higher scores than before in games like beat saber which require perfect tracking. Headset fits very well compared to vive. Only issue I have is the audio sucks but there is a fix in the works.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 24 May 2019

one_reviews_text: Its my first vr headset so im not sure if its a good review but im gonna said it anyway the lens feel cheap like everything is really blurry and when you're playing a game like minecraft or Pavlov on a minecraft map every line is checking so you get sick really quickly and that's not fun even after training my brain for vr by playing a lot of game that is just not possible. Sometimes the capter or just not working and its not the game, so you need to unplugged your vr and replugged it, but i think is a great first vr like for testing but not for a long time use so if you're a big gamer don't buy this one 😉
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 17 December 2019
review_title: Good but not for hardcore gamers

one_reviews_text: Premessa: è la mia prima esperienza con un visore per la realtà virtuale e non ho provato i precedenti Oculus o altri visori.L'Oculus rift s è stato un ottimo acquisto, l'immersione che propone è incredibile, nonostante abbia ricevuto critiche, a mio avvisto futili, riguardo la diminuzione da 90Hz a 80Hz.Il tracking degli Oculus touch è fenomenale, preciso e fluido; gli unici problemi sorgono se si posizionano le mani dietro il capo o dietro la schiena (cosa non frequente affatto).L'unica pecca è l'impossibilità di cambiare il rivestimento morbido interno, rendendo l'oculus igienicamente inadatto all'uso di più persone.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 9 August 2019

one_reviews_text: The product is fantastic when it works. Unfortunately, I had issues at the start with the tracking of the controllers. I thought this was due to the computer setup and after purchasing a new computer now, I can safely say that it was not the computer that was the issue. Playing games such as Beatsaber, where you have random intervals mid-game where one controller jumps out of the screen instead of tracking your movement puts a downer on the whole experience.Continuing on this, I woke up this morning to snow on the screen and two different brightness calibrations on the lenses, without being able to fix it following all the recommended steps in order to rectify the issue both on their website and the online forums.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 4 July 2019

one_reviews_text: The Rift S is a fantastic VR set. There is nothing uncomfortable about it. The only way it could be better is OLED and higher pixel density, but at this price and at this stage in the VR game, what Rift S comes with is perfect. Even the sound quality is much better than you would expect it to be. At full volume, I cannot really hear anything else around me but it's still not too disturbing to others around me. No issues with having no IPD adjustment, and my partner and myself have very different IPDs but can hop in and out of the same headset without issues. Having the graphical ability of a high-end PC makes the Rift S experience far superior to the Quest, though the cable can get a little annoying (hoping for an antenna some day). The real only issue is that it gets really hot and sweaty in the headset very quickly because the light sealing is so well-done. I haven't figured out how to remove the face mask yet, but there will be no Beat Saber until I figure that out because it will just get too sweaty.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 22 May 2019
review_title: For those who have been holding out.

one_reviews_text: After all the issues. Making watch the unskippable tutorial videos again because I had to change the batteries pissed me off enough to warn people just how useless the support is for oculus. Kept shutting it down and restarting but nope, it insisted I watch the tutorial video because apparently my time worthless. And that's the Oculus experience.Every time you go to use it there is an error. oculus requires a restart. It doesn't. The help is utterly useless.Luckily there is an internet community to help where the oculus support is non existent.You just have to unplug the USB and replug it again. Every time I start it.It's a mission to get things to work and the apparent contempt Facebook has for providing quality service ensures the user experience in oculus does everything it can to make you feel like you bought the cheapest thing.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 24 January 2020
review_title: There is a reason they are the cheapest.

one_reviews_text: I tried this headset on two different Windows 10 PC's. I was not able to make it work at any of the PC's. The problem seemed related to USB communication to built in sensors in the headset.After quite some correspondence with Oculus support I decided to return the headset.It may be possible for others to make this headset work but I did not manage this.I can't give less 1 star this is my rating, but for me it gives no meaning giving a star to a useless product.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 16 March 2020
review_title: Were not able to make it work

one_reviews_text: El tracking es muy malo y lo peor es que empeora con el uso por alguna razon. Encima el cable es extremadamente endeble, yo ya lo sabía y por eso lo he tratado con mimo exquisito sin pisarlo ni una sola vez (lo tengo suspendido con un sistema de poleas) y aun así se ha roto en menos de tres meses.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 9 April 2020

one_reviews_text: Salutations, venant d'acheter l'oculus rift s et ressu je fais un petit debrif pour l'avoir testé.Tout d'abord je l'ai ressu en parfait état pas de coup sur l'emballage 👌Installation et connexion très rapide avec le logiciel oculus aussi compatible avec steam VRJ'ai opté pour l'oculus rift s au lieu de l'oculus quest all in one/2 car j'ai un pc gamer parfait pour la vr et aussi car je voulais pas tomber en rade de batterie avec le quest qui d'après ce que l'on raconte il ne tient pas plus de 2.30h à 3h de charge 😑Pour le peut que la batterie lâche complètement au bout de 6 mois enfin bref.J'ai testé plusieurs jeux du (the walking dead, beat Saber, vr chat, ect... ) aucun problème la dessus il sont tous compatibles avec le rift👌Point positif:Poid plutôt correct, bonne prise en main des manette.Instalation sur pc très facile et rapide (compatible steam/VR).Cable de 3m.Adaptateur displayport vers mini displayport fournis.Aucune batterie fonctionne en permanence en alimentation de l'ordinateur ce qui permet de longue cession de jeux.Le tracking des manettes et des mouvements de la tête et parfaitePoints négatifs:Confort du casque désagréable avec une jointure en mousse en contact avec la peau du visage ce qui provoque des rougeurs à la longue et mauvaise adaptation au morphologie du visage de certaines personnes.Câble beaucoup trop rigide.Netteté et résolution pas ouf on voit l'image fortement pixelisé très flagrant chez les personnes qui possèdent une vue de 10/10.Le casque ce coupe en cas de chauffe (très très tiède) 🤦‍♂️Champ de vision pas ouf avec aucune possibilité de réglage des lentilles pour une meilleure netteté.Ma configuration:Processeur Intel core i5 9400hCarte graphique gtx 1660 ti 6go vramIl faut compter minimum un processeur i5 9eme gen et une gtx 970/1060 pour avoir une bonne jouabilité à la vr (sur un casque link)Avec ce ci obligatoirement une sortie USB uniquement pour l'alimentation du casqueEt une sortie displayport normale ou miniNe fonctionne absolument pas sur du hdmi.Voili voilou en espérant que mon avis a répondu à plusieurs questions.
review_date: Reviewed in France on 23 January 2021

one_reviews_text: Currently returning this product the worst thumbsticks I have ever used. Coming from the Rift CV1 I immediately noticed the quality was not anywhere close. Sure the resolution is better but at what cost having the cheapest controllers ever? The Original Rift is way better before they mass produced them to this extent. Sound is also a joke wow ..
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 24 February 2021

one_reviews_text: Man muss den heftigsten Prozessor und Grafikkarte haben nur damit man das anschließen kann was soll das? Ich kauf für 450€ eine Brille mit Controller aber muss mir noch für 1500€ oder so ein Gaming Pc kaufen der den Ansprüchen gerecht wird. Da kauf man sich lieber eine PS4 Pro und VR Brille und spart sogar locker 1000€
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 30 September 2020
review_title: Nicht für Leute die mal zocken wollen geeignet

one_reviews_text: Me llegó un día o dos antes de la fecha indicada (esto siempre es bueno). Una vez abierto, fue tan sencillo como conectar los dos cables (usb y el cable de video a la gpu), configurar la aplicación de oculus, marcar la zona guardián (de forma muy sencilla e intuitiva) y a disfrutar.Como pega podría decir que no incluye ningún juego/demo de acción (cosa que el anterior oculus si lo incluía) así que tienes que comprar algún juego decente para empezar a disfrutar.Para mi lo de que no tenga sensores externos es un acierto, ya que te permite jugar con menor espacio y de forma más rápida y sin tantas conexiones, el tracking con los mandos es muy bueno y rara vez hay problemas con el.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 18 August 2019

one_reviews_text: Sono rimasto davvero entusiasta di questo casco virtuale, per la sua incredibile profondità della visuale, faccio notare che vengo da un Oculus DK2, quindi la differenza è enorme, ho notato la semplicità per indossarli inoltre sono molto morbidi all'interno del viso, facilità di installazione molto semplice, adesso continuerò a usarli e se dovessi avere dei problemi non esiterò a descriverli, per ora tutto bene.Unico neo, per quanto riguarda l'ordinazione e la spedizione, direi che i tempi sono stati molto lunghi
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 10 August 2019

one_reviews_text: No se puede explicar con palabras esto de la Realidad Virtual, es acojonante, y lo bien que lo implementa Oculus en este casco ya es una maravilla, aparte el mismo casco tiene una toma de jack por si quieres ponerle tus propios auricualres, simplemente un 10.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 12 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Arrivato nei tempi previsti, il visore rappresenta un'esperienza visiva incredibile, senza contare che non necessita di telecamere esterne perchè ne ha 5 integrate. L'unico difetto è la messa a fuoco, che si limita all'impostazione sofware della distanza oculare.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 19 January 2021

one_reviews_text: Encantado con lo que da este dispositivo para el precio que tienes, los hay mejores pero no por este precio. Hasta que este mundo de la VR no termine de arrancar es el mejor visor para ir probando y jugando, al menos en la generación actual. Por otro lado sobre el envío tras alguna mala experiencia con Amazon esta vez a pesar de tardar más de una semana en ser enviado luego llego rápido y resolvió el envío en vez de anularlo, gracias!.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 18 November 2019
review_title: El mejor visor VR en relación calidad/precio
