one_reviews_text: This VR Headset is absolutely amazing. Previously I only had access to a Psvr which was fun, however the difference is huge. The Resolution is great and you feel immersed immediately. The tracking is also very precise and that without external sensors. The controllers feel ergonomic and intuitive and grabbing, throwing, shooting, etc. feels natural. If you want to get into VR  or want to upgrade from a PSVR this is an amazing choice!
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 2 July 2020

one_reviews_text: I researched this unit heavily prior to purchase and ignored the other negative reviews. I checked my system before buying this unit, had all my drivers up to date and software installed ready to go, plugged the unit in and it  detected and updated the headset then hung during a sensor set-up stage and the occulus software crashed.The unit is now a brick, doesn't illuminate the LED when plugged in let alone display anything on the screen, not detected by pc or oculus software, its merely a brick. I thought no big deal, Amazon should look after me! I started return and to my horror im expected to wear shipping back to the states! NOTE:Amazon have since said they will reimburse me any extra costs so at least thats ok,Thanks Amazon.Ive been a pc gamer for over 30 years and building my own systems for 20+.so i know my way around a pc. and my system maxed out all VR tests i ran prior to ordering., this is poor quality manufacturing. No way would I buy this again, look elsewhere.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 15 August 2020

one_reviews_text: After having this for almost a year I really enjoy using this headset, the lack of external cameras is fantastic, it's a reasonable price, and it's quite portable for when I have people over and need a larger area... however, the constant trouble-shooting of random tracking issues, black screens with no explanation and straight-up game/software crashes, has made the Rift S near unbearable to use. The worst part about the device is the lack of care by the support team when it comes to online help, with most forum discussions usually ending in the users sending back the Rift and getting a competitors headset due to constant issues with temporary fixes.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 26 July 2020
review_title: A great headset, but with terrible support and software.

one_reviews_text: Ich hätte es nicht gedacht aber die Qualität ist um einiges besser als bei der Vorgänger Rift.Auch der Tragekomfort ist um einiges gestiegen. Jetzt lässt sie sich viel angenehmer auf Sätzen und einstellen.Das System ohne Sensoren ist auch klasse und funktioniert sehr gut. Nur zu dunkel darf es nicht sein.Mit diesem System muss man auch nicht mal die Brille abnehmen, wenn man sich im eigenem Raum kurz orientieren will da man das Sensor Bild sehen kann, wenn man möchte.Klare Empfehlung
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 12 July 2019

one_reviews_text: Just like everyone warned, you get what you pay for. For 550 CAD you're getting cheap plastic which wiggles under pressure. The VR itself is awesome, display is fine, the pixels are visible but not as bad as the Quest or old rift. Tracking works but I had a few connection issues at first.I dropped 2 stars because my right controller trigger was squeeky right out of the box. It's so loud I can hear it when my headphones are on and I'm playing a game. Completely unacceptable because it's super distracting. Day 1 and the controller is having build quality issues. It works fine though.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 21 January 2020

one_reviews_text: Die Hardware ist für diesen Preis (~450-500€) wirklich hervorragend. Besonders die Bequemlichkeit des HMD und die hohe Qualität der Linsen (imho sogar besser als die der doppelt so teuren Index) sind exzellent.Leider ist die Oculus-Software ein dauernder Quell der Enttäuschung und des Ärgernisses. Ohne diese geht aber gar nichts, daher läuft sie ständig im Hintergrund und verursacht (zumindest bei mir) jede Menge Ärger und Probleme.Vor jedem (Zwangs-)Update bange ich ob ich mein Headset nun bitte (weiter) nutzen kann oder ob ein neues Problem meinem Spielspass im Wege steht...
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 22 April 2020

one_reviews_text: الجهاز جدا ممتاز وسهل الأستخدام وبطل لاااكن جودت البلاستك المصنوع منه سيئه بحيث انه السماعه من ثاني لبس صار فيها كسر من صوب الجبهه مع اني اتعامل معها بلطف شدييد لاكن جودتها سيئه للأسف
review_date: Reviewed in Saudi Arabia on 29 November 2021
review_title: المواد المصنوع منه الجهاز سيئ لاكن الجهاز بطل

one_reviews_text: Very passionate about VR after this purchase! No regrets, settings let you use your PCs power and it looks pretty good! Disappointed in Oculus Stores limited support for the S version where 'Star Wars Tales at Galaxy's Edge' is not yet available and may not become. The VR gaming catalogue is still fresh and over the coming years it will surely become more accessible, although right now, the rift s is brilliant for becoming acquainted with VR! I use an RTX 2080 and squadrons in this thing is a blast! Will need some well researched configurations through ini files and in game settings to make it work a dream!
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 10 March 2021
review_title: Great value, entry into the VR world and the most gaming fun I've ever had!

one_reviews_text: Mettendo da parte il fatto che ci ha messo oltre una settimana per arrivare nonostante sia utente Prime, i giudizi su questo visore sono qualcosa di fuori dal normale.Nessun problema nella configurazione, nessun problema nell'uso. Non ci sono parole per descrivere l'esperienza di realtà virtuale.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 18 September 2019

one_reviews_text: Do not fall into the trap of buying one of these. The support for them is useless, the hardware is unreliable, and the software from Oculus does not help you.From day two, i would regularly have issues with the USB connection not working, requiring me to crawl under my desk and replug the cable in to get a connection working again, every single time i wanted to use it.4 months into my purchase i began having issues with the left controller tracking correctly. Two MONTHS of back and forth with customer support, and i was sent a warranty replacement controller and a replacement headset. By the time they arrived, the right controller had the same issue. Another month fighting with customer support for it to get replaced.Now, a bit over a year after my purchase, I am getting USB dropout and Displayport dropout issues consistently after 5 minutes of use, and my right controller has the EXACT SAME TRACKING ISSUE that it had before with the old one. Now it's out of warranty, so i'm out of luck. Dont fall for the trap. Dont buy one of these.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 14 February 2021

one_reviews_text: Premetto che non ho mai usato visori e nemmeno sapevo cosa fosse la VR. In italia è veramente poco usata e conosciuta ma dopo alcune informazioni ho deciso di provare questa "nuova realtà".Avete le caratteristiche per scegliere oculus rift s?1)hardware adeguato (rx580/gtx1060 o superiore) sono i requisiti minimi ma consiglio una rx590 o una 1070 almeno.2) lo spazio è un problema anche per me ma con grande stupore ho scoperto che un'area di 2x2 metri lo rende già perfettamente funzionante.3) dovete essere pazienti e capire il meccanismo perché molto spesso alla prima volta che lo indosserete noterete una visuale sfocata o appanata, è tutta questione di regolazione lacci e angolazione del visore ai propri occhi. Posso assicurare che indossandolo bene la qualità è molto alta e nitida.4) questo visore (unico sul mercato se non sbaglio) ha i sensori di tracking incorportati, ciò significa che i movimenti verrano registrati senza supporto di basi/telecamere esterne. Può sembrare roba da poco ma è una feature spettacolare.5) i controller rispondono sempre bene al 95% ma funzionano solo con fonte di luci. In pratica al buio non potrete utilizzarli in alcun modo. È il prezzo da pagare per avere i sensori incorporati.L'unica nota negativa è il filo penzolante come tutti i visori che spesso si potrebbe attorcigliare durante i movimenti, avvolgendovi. E il refresh rate a 80hz.Dopo 1 mese di utilizzo posso dire che offre le stesse esperienze di gioco anche di visori più costosi. Provare per credere, il vr è forse il futuro del gaming?
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 4 February 2020

one_reviews_text: The software takes up a strangely large amount of disk space.  Possibly because of the large variety of furniture.  On top of this, virtual desktop windows opened in 'Oculus' also often crash and get replaced with an orange exclamation mark, with no indication as to why it is no longer working.  There are also times when the headset strait up stops working with a black screen displayed on the headset.  This is sometimes remedied by removing the HDMI and USB cords, or changing the port they are plugged in. Restarting the software or windows can sometimes help as well.  I suggest that you create a strain relief for the cords by fixing them to your desk or something sturdy so they don’t pull on the connectors connected to your PC.Software aside, the hardware is alright to wear for a few hours of gaming before it becomes uncomfortable.  Tracking for the controllers fails completely when they are vibrating, as it messes with the accelerometers inside and is not compensated for by the software.  This causes your virtual hands to often fly off into the distance or flop around when they vibrate strongly.  The lenses can be difficult to clean completely with microfiber cloths as well.  While the center of the lens provides good visibility, the edges are blurry.  This makes about 25%-35% of the screen blurry, often making it a necessity to turn your head towards objects you can see to make out what they are clearly.  Text at the very edge of the screen, consisting of about 15% of the screen space is unreadable.As a VR experience in game, however, it is a great experience.  Few of these issues cause a noticeable impact while in game, other than the game being killed by windows if you don’t have enough ram (ordered some more), or having your virtual hands embarking on a trip to the north pole without you (you can turn haptic feedback off in ‘SteamVR’, but not ‘Oculus’).Oh, and one last thing.  The controllers eat batteries (AA) every 2-3 days of use, so get 4 rechargeable batteries and be sure to factor that into the cost of the unit.  They are always on with no physical off switch, other than removing the batteries.  I’ve been using Eneloop with good results (Panasonic KKJ17MCA4BF).
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 6 April 2020
review_title: Software sucks, but the headset is good so far.

one_reviews_text: This is such a huge disappointment product as is Oculus as a whole. We had a Rift headset (prior model) and it was very stable & reliable.Eventually the wire to the PC broke and Oculus couldnt sell the wire on its own. So we were forced to get a new headset. We took the splurge with the Rift S hoping it was better. Initial impressions were great except, we began to notice the play experience was unreliable. The handsets were getting stuck moving in directions, the audio was cutting in & out and the entire device would stop working requiring a physical unplug/replug to the PC, sometimes rebooting as well.As of now, the unit is so buggy (its just gotten worse), its virtually unusable. Dont get an Oculus product, whatever happened with the Facebook buyout likely results in $$ over quality plays and the Rift S is the "result" of that.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 10 August 2020

one_reviews_text: Really quick and speedy delivery and a great headset.BUTfor EVERY single Rift s, you Must be careful on how you power your headset and if it can provide enough Current for the headset. If you experience any of these at random times with no real patterneg: Black screen, black & white static, loud audio static, Complete loss of positional trackingFIX:Use a USB3.0 (IT MUST BE 3.0!) With a port for external power than tap in power supply at 5v AT LEAST 2.5A or more,plug your USB hub into your 3.0 USB port and then plug your headset into the hub after you have plugged in both the power supply and the USB hub main cableonce done you should no longer experience any of the problems you had before if you still experience them then change the USB hub driver in windows to the default windows driver by going into device manager and then finding the hub there and changing the driver.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 31 August 2020

one_reviews_text: Investigando bien lo que se esta adquiriendo, por las prestaciones que tiene en comparación a otros visores, la falta de ajuste de IDP mecanica,etc , es un excelente producto.El tracking funciona muy bien para una experiencia satisfactoria, si bien algo casual en VR, sobretodo si no tienes espacio para montar sensores. Yo lo utlilizo en un espacio reducido y no tengo problemas, el sistema de guardian funciona muy bienEn momentos es dificil encontrar el punto exacto de como colocar y ajustar el visor y por alguna razon los controles no se apagan cuando deberian, pero en general es una excelente opcion en mi opinion si ya se cuenta con un equipo que lo soporte, yo con i5 8600k y una rtx2060 no he tenido problema alguno
review_date: Reviewed in Mexico on 28 August 2020
review_title: Buena idea para primer headset de VR en forma

one_reviews_text: For me personally, I got motion sickness using this headset.It also sometimes (but rarely) lost tracking on my head so I would start leaning or even fall over in game (not in real life).The controller tracking is superb, impressive considering there aren’t any bay stations.Text is readable, not crisp but not super blurry.Also Facebook is evil so it’s your call if you’re comfortable using this.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 15 March 2021
review_title: Hit or miss depending on the person.

one_reviews_text: che dire, esperienza completamente diversa da qualsiasi altra, ero scettico al punto da rimandare l'acquisto del visore per anni, mi ha convinto lo sconto nelle feste natalizie infatti ho deciso di comprarlo quando costava 349€, soddisfattissimo. In questo momento storico in cui i movimenti sono limitati, si può almeno viaggiare virtualmente
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 13 January 2021

one_reviews_text: Purtroppo ho restituito il Rift S e l'ho sostituito con il Quest in quanto ho avuto dei problemi a connetterlo al pc tramite DisplayPort. Non hanno funzionato nemmeno gli adattatori comperati in un secondo momento.Comunque Amazon fantastico, nessun problema nella restituzione e molto felice del Quest.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 24 October 2019

one_reviews_text: He tenido unas Rift CV1 y esto es un cambio adelante, mucha mejor resolución, nitidez, punto dulce. Ausencia casi total de SDE y de glare. Solo un pequeño punto en contra, el FOV, es un poco más rediucido, pero como yo las uso fundamentalmente para simuladores de conducción no hay problema porque con el casco de competición real ves menos a los lados aun que con estas gafas
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 21 November 2019
review_title: Gran avance en la realidad virtual

one_reviews_text: Cosa scrivere su questo prodotto...hanno già scritto tutto… L'unico consiglio che posso darvi è che dovete provarlo assolutamente. I giochi, le applicazioni e tutto quello che circonda questo mondo VR sembra VIVO. Se non ci pensi ti sembra realmente di essere in altro mondo.. Molte app sono fatte bene, altre un pò meno bene. Il tutto cmq è ancora ampiamente migliorabile ma per ora lo consiglio 100%
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 22 January 2020

one_reviews_text: Die Rifts S is besser als gedacht. Ich war am anfang sehr skeptisch mit dem Inside Out Tracking aber das funktioniert erstaunlich gut. Auch bei Beat Saber wo es sehr schnell werden kann funktioniert es sehr gut. Das setup ist auch sehr einfach, Oculus Software (und SteamVR) herunterladen und los gehts. Einziges manko ist das Problem mit den Kopfhörern. Das sind leider nur diese lausigen in der Kopfhalterung und sind nicht so gut. Da es bis jetzt noch keine andere offizielle Lösung gibt hab ich mir Kopfhörerhalter 3D-gedruckt und so verbaut dass sie fast so ähnlich wie bei der Valve Index sind. 3D-Drucker hat halt nicht jeder aber vielleicht kommt noch was offizielles von Oculus.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 12 July 2019

one_reviews_text: Llegaron abiertas. Le dieron el cambiazo en la tienda.Sobre el producto: es divertido aunque tener el 5g pegado durante horas y los ojos y la cabeza acaban muy calentitas.Muy sano no es ésta tecnología.Además no se ve del todo definido.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 16 April 2022

one_reviews_text: A friend brought over their Oculus Rift S and it played flawlessly on my pc and I was very impressed with the game play and graphics that I decided to buy one for myself. However the Oculus Rift S was out of stock and no ETA was available so I bought the Oculus Quest 2 (next model up) after reading very endorsing reviews by IT Magazine reviewers IT PcMag from Aus and the UK.Obviously the reviewers were extremely biased as the Oculus Quest 2 was nothing but problematic, unplayable and frustrating with constant pc disconnections and a very cheap and uncomfortable headset strap. Tried all the recommended fixes but without success so the Quest 2 was returned after 7 days and have purchased the Rift S with no problems, excellent game play, graphics and enjoyment. Oculus Quest 2 is crap and Rift S is superb.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 13 July 2021
review_title: Oculus Rift S much better game play than Oculus Quest 2

one_reviews_text: So much fun! Games are a little limited, but I have taken so long to review due to enjoying it so much!A bit fidgety with daily startup (USB, wait for orange light, then display port). Not following this exact process leaves me unplugging and replacing until oculus program is satisfied.Tracking is unbelievable, slight issue when your hands are behind your back, but moments where you are doing this are few and far between.Guardian wall without needing any additional boxes works a treat! Changes to the room, (box, chair pulled out etc) can confuse it, but setting it up only takes 15seconds.Wife has a little problem motion sickness, there are setting we can lower but this has not been tested yet. I experienced a bit at first, but after around 5 minutes of moving around I find it very comfortable.Would recommend picking up some silicone face attachments. The padding with the rift is comfy, but can get sweaty very quickly.Wonderful product, worth every dollar I spent.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 3 November 2020

one_reviews_text: When I first received my headset I was so excited. I upgraded everything I could, back up what I could even updated to window 10 (something I wasn’t keen on doing for years). Got to play for 10 mins then suddenly, black screen.I searched the whole internet, YouTube, forums, for in contact with the oculus support staff to get an answer or fix. I changed many settings in my computer and got 2 hours before black screening again.I tried unplugging/replugging in the cables, closing and restarting both my computer and software. Nothing made it go past the 10 minute or even 2 hour mark. So as a second last resort to solve the issue, I requested a replacement.It took me about a week of almost non-stop fighting to come to that point. Sent back the first one and got my replacement.It worked like a charm! Not a single black screen besides for once but that was a loading moment.My last alternative was going to be get a refund and take my business elsewhere. So I’m relieved a solution was found.Now I enjoy the games I have and the experiences I can go through. Though the trouble really made me question...
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 8 March 2020
review_title: Replacement works... was it worth it?

one_reviews_text: Super Gerät, leider aber Pech gehabt. Trotz Firmware Update vom 30.07 sollte das Problem mit dem Namen "White static flash" behoben sein. Mein neues Gerät (vom 20.08) ließ sich ohne Probleme anschließen und starten. Trotz Firmware Update, Grafik Treiber Update keine Besserung. Auch das Oculus Beta Programm mit einem weiteren Update fürs Gerät konnte das Problem nicht lösen. Also habe ich die Rift beim Kumpel angeschlossen, der ohne Probleme mit der Rift CV1 spielen konnte. Bei ihm gab es kurzzeitig Probleme mit dem Displayport Anschluss (Problem hatte ich nicht), dann gings aber. Nach 5 Minuten Superhot VR gabs drei weiße Flashs bei ihm und uns beiden war klar, die Rift S muss weg. Er hatte auch Interesse am Gerät und wollte aktualisieren, ginge das Gerät bei ihm ohne Probleme, hätte er es behalten können und ich hätte die Ursache bei mir gesucht, nun ist klar das Gerät war wohl defekt. Schade, das Erlebnis war deutlich besser als die Rift CV1 trotz LCD Display, die Schärfe und Helligkeit war dem der CV1 deutlich überlegen und sie war auch als Produkt an sich ausgereifter (Tragekomfort!).Allen anderen glücklichen Rift S Nutzern wünsche ich viel Spaß mit dem Gerät. Ich hätte es sehr gerne behalten. :(Bis Black Friday werde ich mir nochmals Gedanken zu VR machen und sollte die Valve Index bis dahin die Probleme nicht in den Griff gekriegt haben, werde ich vielleicht erneut der Rift S einen Versuch geben. Möglicherweise habe ich ja dann etwas mehr Glück. :)Zwei Sterne, weil das Gerät trotz des Problems super ist. Ein Spiel zum Kauf der Rift S wäre trotzdem wünschenswert gewesen.Bildquelle: Oculus Rift Forum
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 24 August 2019

one_reviews_text: Having only tried the Samsung gear vr and the htc vive before purchasing this, was hoping it would be a step up. And by god I’m not disappointed. Fantastic headset, fits comfortably on myself and my wife. Easy to set up and use.And the games are getting better every month.If it is your first foray into VR like myself start of with the beat savers and VR chats. And games where you can teleport. Ease into it because I found myself getting a bit sick with fluid motion controls. But give it time and you will get used to it. Now I’m running around boneworks, Pavlov and blade and sorcery with no problems at all.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 2 January 2020

one_reviews_text: Era da tempo che volevo comprare Oculus RIFT e ho atteso la versione S. Non sono state deluse le aspettative. Dopo un po' di pratica ho imparato a usarlo e a settarlo a dovere, anche per quelle applicazioni/giochi che sono native per la Realtà Virtuale (VR). Guardare poi lo schermo del PC come se fosse uno schermo da 150 pollici non ha prezzo. Un'esperienza che tutti dovrebbero provare e godere appieno. Spedizione arrivata anche in anticipo sul previsto, in ottime condizioni. Vivamente consigliato!
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 12 October 2019
review_title: Il visore VR migliore sul mercato

one_reviews_text: The screen resolution isn't great. You can definitely still see the pixels. But, for the convenience of not having to set up external sensors and being able to easily bring this over to a friend's house, this is WELL worth it.The pixel density doesn't bother me and it delivers a great VR experience. I didn't notice any issues with the tracking from the sensors mounted on the headset or the controllers.The headset and controllers feel premium. Sure, you could find a better headset in the Vive pro, but that's more than double the price and requires external sensors.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 5 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Fallos de hardware o software repetidos.Pierde la conexión USB3. Pierde la ubicación espacial de las gafas y no se mueve la imagen al moverme yo. El soporte técnico después de varias pruebas no sabe qué les pasa. Me ofrecen cambio, pero no me fio por si vuelven a fallar. Las devuelvo y compro otras.A veces funcionan perfectas. Cuando sucede son geniales.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 15 December 2020

one_reviews_text: Schlechte Auflösung und Schwächen beim Tracking wenn es schneller wird oder nah am Helm vorbeigeht.Verbindung mit externen Sensoren um das auszugleichen ist nicht möglich und wird auch nicht kommen.Seit dem Facebook dahinter steht gibt es hier allgemein gar keine Weiterentwicklung mehr und wird nur noch gemolken.Die Software ist ein einziger Graus, optisch und leistungstechnisch.Als Bonus kommt jetzt sogar noch der Facebook Accountzwang dazu.Meine Wandert somit nur noch auf dem Flohmarkt und ich werde mir etwas professionelleres von einem Konkurrenzanbieter kaufen.Den kauf dieses Gerätes kann ich keinem empfehlen.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 24 August 2020
review_title: Billiges Einsteigermodell mit mehr Schwächen als Stärken.

one_reviews_text: The headset is great for people that have a powerful enough computer. It's very comfortable, the screen is great. Unfortunately there is no manual IPD adjustment system - this is done throught software. The cable should exit more in the back. Otherwise for the beginner a perfect introductory experience to VR. Great tracking all around, had no problems.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 1 October 2020

one_reviews_text: #VRvirgin till i purchased this - I've been playing a solid two days straight and trying out just about ever genre available.My feet are sore from standing so long haha.Basically plug n play which no need for sensors draped around the room. Menu is easy to navigate and i have not had one instance of motion sickness yet. Perhaps because this newer device had made some ground in the background tech.Very happy with Amazons delivery times and how it was packed.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 4 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Disappointed that this wont connect with my sons PC. His PC meets the minimum specs but keeps complaining about USB3. I plug it into my PC and it works fine. We even went as far as resetting Win10 back to default to rule out any app issues and still the same issue. We tried all the suggestions in the support forums and this seems like a very common problem they should fix. And yes he has 4 USB 3 ports on his PC and we tried them all.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 29 January 2020

one_reviews_text: This is a fantastic headset. If you have a PC with at least a 1070, it should work just fine.Honestly, this is so good I can’t play games without VR support anymore.Everyone says the 80 hz refresh rate is bad, but it has made no negative impact on any games I’ve played.I have tried a couple of other headsets, and really rate this one as being fantastic. 9/10 for quality, 7/10 for sound (but you can plug headphones in), 10/10 for value, 10/10 for setup time.Would I buy this again after a months worth of use.... 100% Yes, without any hesitation...
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 29 August 2020
review_title: Excellent product delivered ahead of time. Quality VR made affordable.

one_reviews_text: Well I've given it six months, and can safely say that Oculus Rift S is buggy, unreliable and not worth the money paid.Any time I'm in the mood for VR, there's a 50/50 chance it'll actually work for me. I used to try it daily. Then weekly. Now I barely even pick the thing up because realistically, it probably won't work. My enthusiasm for VR has waned to the point that I just don't bother now.When it works, it's great. But half the time it doesn't.Tracking issues.Buggy software.Headset not detecting sometimes.Randomly losing a controller in tracking.Having previously used Vive, I had high hopes. Oculus are clearly out of their depth.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 10 October 2020

one_reviews_text: Ottimo prodotto  acquistato su Amazon ad un prezzo molto buono (-100 Euro dal prezzo di listino) consegna e imballaggio ineccepibili. Il visore funziona che é una meraviglia. Consiglio a tutti l'esperienza in VR. Effettivamente, come da altre recensioni, la qualità della definizione non è eccelsa, però vi assicuro che non è un problema . Lo uso su assetto corsa e dico solo questo... PROVATELO!!!
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 13 January 2021

one_reviews_text: Rift S is a great headset. No halo effect, very little screen door and the resulution is good.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 24 May 2019
review_title: Just as good as I thought it will be.

one_reviews_text: Ich muss gleich direkt sagen, die Oculus Rift S ist meine erste VR Brille. Ich kann somit keinen Vergleich ziehen zur Vive oder der alten Rift.Aber Overall kann ich sagen, ich verbringe sehr viel Zeit mit der Rift S. Entweder in meinem Twitch Stream oder auch außerhalb des Streams. Die Installation und Einrichtung war mega easy gewesen. Der Sound der Oculus ist komplett fine, trotzdem greife ich auf meine Kopfhörer zurück. Muss ja nicht jeder Nachbar hören der im Treppenhaus vorbei läuft was ich so treibe X)Ich ziehe 1 Stern ab weil das Mikrofon der Rift nach einer gewissen Zeit immer einfach aus geht und ich die Rift S komplett neu anschließen muss. Verschiedene Display und USB Ports schon getestet keine Veränderung. Der Support hat sich bisher dazu auch nicht geäußert, deshalb 1 Stern Abzug von mir.Das Tracking funktioniert soweit super, selbst abends bei schwachem Licht. Ansonsten kann ich jetzt nach ca 4 Wochen nichts weiter groß drüber sagen. Die Spiele machen Spaß, selbst das einfache abhängen in der Homezone am Kamin zu sitzen und im Internet zu surfen ist sehr entspannend.Für mich wurde ein Traum wahr und ich bereue keinen Cent den ich für die Rift S ausgegeben habe, vor allem auch wegen den Exklusivtiteln die noch kommen werden!
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 4 July 2019

one_reviews_text: As my first experience with VR I was amazed... Easy to install, fit's comfortable and works fine with my notebook i7-8th, GTX 1070. I decided to get this instead of Quest even with Link about to be released and I don't regret. It feels more sturdy than Quest for me. In Oculus store the games are much more expensive than Steam, so I'm having so much fun playing the games it's hard to go back to a control and a flat screen.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 24 October 2019

one_reviews_text: My living room is literally 3 feet father than the cable. I bought a longer adapter for usb3 and display port. Spent 2h troubleshooting it. Drivers keep failing.Who's idea at facebook was it to make such a short cable.Is the system any good? No idea, I'm not rich enough to have an empty room behind my pc desk so I can't test how good the VR system is.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 26 December 2020
review_title: Cable too small ruins the experience.

one_reviews_text: super fun, good headset. bit buggy and the settings reset sometimes, requiring a restart or just to redo themdoes fit my glasses in it comfortably, just need to loosen the strap on the top and unwind it so its very loose. sounds is good. just taking a star off because of the amount of bugs im getting from a headset i bought 3 days ago.just as a disclaimer, they arent dealbreakers and only require a few minutes to fix. just frustrating when its repeatedly happening// edit; few days later -okay, this thing is buggy as hell. i cannot even have it connected without it causing some sort of other issue that my computer has absolutely never had. this is so disappointing. 600+ on a product that breaks every five minutes.dunno what to say. it's such a nice thing to have without these issues
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 1 November 2020

one_reviews_text: Funciona correctamente. Se ajusta muy bien a la cabeza y puedes jugarlo con o sin lentes, eso depende que tan cómodo te sientas. La detección de los sensores es buena y el audio a pesar de que no viene en forma de audífonos es muy bueno. El producto venía bien empaquetado y en perfecto estado. Me la he estado pasando jugando y no ha habido ningún problema. Lo que recomiendo es comprar una extensión para el cable para tener un poco más de movilidad. Es un producto recomendado.
review_date: Reviewed in Mexico on 11 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Materiali di qualità, visore comodo, ottima la qualità video.I controller sono ergonomici e pratici.Molto dipende dal computer a cui si collega, bisogna avere un buon hardware come da requisiti di sistema.Richiede porte USB veloci, altrimenti rischia di disconnettersi.Lo ricomprerei subito...anzi...lo avrei fatto prima col senno di poi :D
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 6 January 2021
review_title: E' uno strumento che fa la differenza nello svago

one_reviews_text: I bought this item "New" but Amazon shipped me a "Used" one.The reason I know that this is a used one because I have a friend who also bought a brand new Oculus Rift S recently and we opened the box together. This list the list of how my order different from his:- The lens of the new Oculus should have a protective film that you need to peel off. My "brand new" Oculus has them already peel off, and whoever did it has the audacity to throw the two crumbled up film back into the box.- The wire should come neatly rolled and have cardboard sleeves that you need to take off. Mine comes tangled, no cardboard sleeve.- There is a small black box that contains the instruction, the warranty, a pack of 2 batteries for the controllers and a DisplayPort-to-mini-DisplayPort converter. Mine comes with no black box. The instruction, warranty, and converter were tossed in with the Oculus with nothing holding them down. There is only one battery which was already in one of the controllers.- There was hair stuck on the Oculus.I love the Oculus Rift S. The one-star review is intended for Amazon, who sells this, not the product.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 1 February 2020

one_reviews_text: Loving VR.  I'm running a 2070super, performance is spot on.  Resolution is pretty good, if you've been disappointed with cheap VR(phones) in the past then make the leap.  There is some great software for these sets and it's fun for the whole family.  Really good starter kit.  That being said now that I'm into it I'm starting to look at some of the higher end VR setups.  They have slightly better resolutions for almost 4 times the price, so this is a great place to start.  No regrets.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 5 October 2020

one_reviews_text: Thankfully, I had a capable enough PC. However, beware if you are using this with a laptop - even a gaming laptop, especially those with "discrete" graphics cards.I've tried using multiple Thunderbolt 3 passthrough adapters for the display port, but it doesn't work. This is REALLY frustrating since I originally planned to use this with my laptop to make it easier to take around to friends houses, etc.All In all the RIFT S is pretty damn impressive for the price. Having tried a Valve Index, I can say that the $3000+ isn't worthwhile when you can get a very similar experience with the RIFT S.I would rate the compatibility with Laptops as very, very poor. The compatibility with a PC with a GPU that supports Display port output is excellent.Easy to set up - get a big enough play space, I've almost broken a finger, but not the controllers using mine - Just a real shame and a bit of a severe let down that I couldn't use it with my laptop.Steam VR compatible games are all playable, too. You can buy games cheaply online, too. So you don't have to fork over hundreds for games as well as the VR hardware.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 8 April 2021

one_reviews_text: To preface this review, I would give it a solid 4 stars if it continued to work, but the second day I had my headset and booted up my PC, the headset would just not connect.I tried every single thing I could find after searching the web, and I couldn't even narrow it down to a software, driver, or hardware problem. Basically, the Oculus software wouldn't recogize that the headset was plugged in, no matter what USB or DP ports I had plugged it in to.After giving it my all, I couldn't get the headset to work with my PC again. Had to return for a refund.Do I recommend it? I would, if it continued to work, and with Amazon's great return/replacement policy, if you've got time to wait for a replacement unit if necessary then yes. But Oculus is discontinuing support for this headset, so if you experience problems like I did, there's a limited amount of time left to have these issues fixed.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 4 June 2021

one_reviews_text: I was contemplating getting a different VR headset but the Oculus Rift S went on sale so I bought it immediately. It is amazing in every way. The tracking is great, easy installation, great quality screens and lots of variety for games on the Oculus store. A lot of people don't like it because you need to use Facebook to log in (if you don't already have an Oculus account) and that is fair, but if you look past that its honestly a great headset at a great price.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 21 October 2020

one_reviews_text: il visore e comodo e funziona benissimo pacco imballato benissimo triplo cartone fino qui tutto bene ma o dato 3 stelle carenza giochi e app in italiano ottiche ancora migliorabili qualita video ancora migliorabile per questo poco sfruttabile in italia
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 13 June 2019

one_reviews_text: Excelentes gafas de RV, casi casi no puedes creer el realismo y el detalle con el que se ven las cosas, así como la sorprendente sensación visual de inmersión en la escena 3D del juego o video. Será más sorprendente aun si las películas del cine se empiezan a producir también en formato 3D para VR, supera por mucho cualquier experiencia en salas de cine 2D o 3D. Una película 3D se puede ver con estas gafas en una pantalla virtual que al usuario se le hace tan gigante como la del cine pero con más inmersión, y estoy hablando de películas de 3D normales, no de RV, no se si ya hayan películas 3D para RV pero videos si hay muchos y en ellos la sensación de inmersión es total.
review_date: Reviewed in Mexico on 21 January 2020

one_reviews_text: Pour l'avoir testé pas mal de temps, je peux vous dire que le casque est très bon pour cette gamme de prix. L'immersion est là, le casque est fluide, les capteurs sont très réactifs. Au déballage, on se retrouve avec un très beau packaging avec tout ce dont on a besoin. Les manettes sont agréables au touché, pas trop lourdes avec les piles et s'agrippent bien aux mains. Le casque est aussi très simple à utiliser, vous installez le logiciel qui va avec (disponible sur leur site), vous le branchez en usb 3.0 et en displayport (n'achetez pas ce casque si votre carte graphique ne possède pas de displayport) et vous suivez les instructions. Il requiert aussi une assez bonne machine (Ryzen 5 1500X + GTX 1060 minimum pour faire tourner les jeux convenablement). Si vous avez en dessous d'une GTX 1050 Ti, je vous déconseille d'acheter le casque.Même si le casque reste très bon globalement, il possède bien des défauts :- Le système de Guardian n'est pas tout à fait au point. Personnellement, je suis obligé de redessiner une zone de jeu à presque chaque démarrage du casque au moindre petits changements au niveau de ma pièce. (éclairage, meubles etc.)- Je ne sais pas si cela provient seulement de mon casque mais quelques fois les capteurs cessent de fonctionner et la zone de jeu de met à bouger en même temps que le casque. Je suis donc obligé de débrancher et rebrancher mon casque et avoir ce genre de problème en pleine partie de Beat Saber, c'est très énervant.- Plus d'écouteur sur cette version de casque mais des haut-parleurs miniatures montés dans son serre-tête. Ces haut-parleurs ne sont pas très puissants mais la qualité sonore reste correcte. En revanche, vous avez une prise jack sur le côté gauche du casque.- Le câble sur le côté gauche du casque est très gênant.- Pas de réglage physique de l'écart pupillaire. (IPD)- Plus d'écran Oled- J'aurais préféré avoir un système de clips sur les dragonnes comme sur les manettes Wii.Ses plus grandes qualités selon moi :- La compatibilité avec les jeux- Le système de serre-tête est vraiment top- Plus besoin de placer des capteurs partout dans notre pièce, ils sont inclus dans le casque. Très pratique sauf dans les jeux de tir où il faut rapprocher les manettes du casque.- Prise jack de qualité- Le casque est très confortable et tient moins chaud comparé aux autres casquesMalgré tous ses défauts, le casque reste tout de même très appréciable. Il reste tout de même un peu cher à mon goût (449€) mais difficile de trouver mieux sur le marché avec la même gamme de prix. Faites tout de même attention, achetez des piles rechargeables car les manettes sont assez énergivores. Prenez des piles eneloop de préférence.
review_date: Reviewed in France on 25 August 2019
review_title: Bon casque dans cette gamme de prix

one_reviews_text: I am very glad I bought the rift s a over the quest. The quest will not allow you to play most of the game on steam and the be store, especially the games that reqiure a good computer. The graphics on the quest are not as good as the rift. Just to help,, the lowest graphics card you can use is the 970. With the 970 graphics card you will be very limited with games and steam. Get the rift over the quest if you are into gaming
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 27 July 2020
review_title: The rift s is for gaming

one_reviews_text: Possesseur d'un oculus rift et d'une paire de lunettes, je me suis dirigé vers l'oculus rift s. Et il est vrai que cela résout grandement  les problèmes lors de la pose du casque. En revanche si j'avais quelques soucis avec l'ancien modèle (son qui disparait), c'est un gros problème avec ce casque. Ecran noir dès que j'utilise un bouton du touch, impossible d'avoir le son et l'image simultanément...et pourtant j'ai fait tout ce qui était indiqué sur les forums. Je pense que c'est lié avant tout à mon portable (Gigabyte P35X) que j'avais acheté uniquement pour la VR. Bref incompatibilité ou appareil qui ne marche pas, a l'instar d'un écran PC cela devrait fonctionner sur toutes les machines. Pour moi ce sera retour Amazon, et peut être un Quest lorsqu'on pourra jouer aux jeux du rift avec.
review_date: Reviewed in France on 6 November 2019

one_reviews_text: Love this headset!  I've played VR before, but it blew my mind how immersive it is on this thing.  I'm a big gamer so I was afraid there would just be a lot of gimmicky games, but by now the catalogue of games available is pretty big and diverse.  Even the free games and apps (and there are a lot of them) offered on Oculus store and Steam store are super entertaining.  Easy to hook up whenever you want to play.  The setup just took a bit long because I had not downloaded the software or games beforehand (I recommend you do so).UPDATE:  IT IS AWESOME SO WE GOT A SECOND SET SO WE CAN VR TOGETHER AS A COUPLE =)I would also recommend getting those ceiling hooks so you don't trip on your cables.Super, super cool VR and at a reasonable price =)
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 23 May 2019

one_reviews_text: This thing is amazing. The quality difference between this and my PlayStation VR is very noticeable. The Rift is so much better and I love that they used a similar design for the headset as the PSVR one so it’s very comfortable. Well worth the price. Plugged it in and it just worked. Use it with Oculus Home and Steam VR with no issues.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 14 August 2020

one_reviews_text: You would think this item has a display port but NO, it is noted in some documentation but you have to look at the details in-depth, who would have thought it has no such connection other than a display port option, advise to look at another product as the tech support sux also.Now I have a headset that is useless!
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 30 December 2020
review_title: No display port making this a wasted buy

one_reviews_text: inutilizzabile, appena arrivato il visore funzionava perfettamente su beat saber, veChat, pavlov vr, payday 2, ma il vano batteria del controller si muoveva un po', il visore aveva anche un led bruciato quindi ho preferito sostituire il visore e controller, ne ne è arrivato un altro, all'inizio funzionava perfettamente, ma il giorno dopo, nell'app oculus era arrivata una notifica che diceva che il cavo usb non funzionava e avrei dovuto staccarlo e riattaccarlo, l'ho fatto e ha dato lo stesso problema con il display port, dopo averlo staccato e ricollegato mi è arrivata un'altra notifica dicendo che i sensori non riescono a monitorare il visore, ho provato di tutto, cercando sul sito e sui vari forum, ho scoperto che è un problema molto comune e ha diverse soluzioni, ho provato a fare tutto ma continua a darmi problemi, per questo farò il reso.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 6 January 2021

one_reviews_text: Excellent produit, immersion garantie.Mais malheureusement des problèmes de "jeunesse" de la technologie de tracking avec les caméras présentes sur le casque.Le suivi des manettes se bloquent parfois, elles sont comme "posées au sol" alors qu'on les tient bien en mains, un redémarrage du logiciel Oculus avec plug-off/plug-on de l'USB et du DP est obligatoire (et dans de très rares cas du pc au complet).Parfois il arrive également que le tracking visuel ne suive plus.Sur le modèle reçu, la gâchette arrière du contrôleur droit commence également à grincer après à peine 1 semaine d'utilisation.Ces défauts de tracking sont annoncés comme "bientôt résolus" par Facebook dans une future mise à jour (sans date précise) mais le problème est bien trop handicapant selon mois au niveau du tarif du Rift S.Je retourne donc le casque.Je me relaisserai tenter après correction de ces bugs/petite baisse de prix (399$ aux USA).Pour les personnes intéressées, je vous conseille de tester Beat Saber, Audica, (Le magnifique) Moss, Lone Echo entre autres.
review_date: Reviewed in France on 17 August 2019
review_title: Belle technologie immersive mais avec défauts de jeunesse

one_reviews_text: Amazon has a very speedy package service. no complaints about that. However....From day one the headset worked 50% of the time. There was a specific knack to get it to work which I lived with it for about 2 months. clearly wasn't working the way it was intended. One day around Christmas it all of a sudden didn't work at all. i have since found out it was a "head tracking sensor" error. I have spent probably close to about 10hrs of going to different forums and video and trying to get this thing to work until I finally caved and went to Oculus support. There raised a whole bunch of issues. They gave me a list of steps of about 50 steps to fix the oculus (which non worked) but instead of giving me all the steps in one email, they spread them out over 10 emails which each email takes a day to get to me. After about 10 days of going back and forth with support, they said they will get back to me in 3-5 days with further assistance. its been almost 2 weeks since I have last heard from them even through I have reached out multiple times to see how things are going.I am a fair guy and never written a bad review about anything but since I paid almost $700 with no sight of getting my money back or replacement, I felt like this was warranted.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 1 February 2021
review_title: Head sensor does not work and Oculus support is difficult

one_reviews_text: Compré estas gafas VR por su calidad - precio es obvio que hay gafas mejores pero si nunca has tenido unas gafas VR estas son las que sin duda deberías probar primero. Lo único que no me han gustado de estas gafas es que cada vez que las conecto al PC el programa de oculus me dicen que no funciona el puerto displayport y cuando lo quito y lo vuelvo a conectar me dice que el USB no funciona... me paso como 10 y 15 minutos cambiándolos hasta que consigo que el programa de oculus lo capte bien.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 21 January 2021

one_reviews_text: Feels great, snug fit when adjusted properly.The cord hanging down the left side can be very annoying.No glitches in the game thanks to the 5 cameras on the headset.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 21 October 2020
review_title: Great product but highly recommend getting the cordless version of this product.

one_reviews_text: Many users experience the same problem. The unit will work perfectly fine for some time and then fail, giving only static from the cameras and motion tracking fails.This issue has been completely ignored by Oculus and is not being addressed beyond a possible return of the product.Save yourself the money and time and look elsewhere for a VR headset.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 8 April 2020

one_reviews_text: I've previously used Vive & HP WMR headsets, I was torn between getting this or a Odyssey+.  I chose the Rift S for better tracking and market share for game compatibility.  Would have liked a manual IPD adjuster and 90hz but still happy with the rift at 80hz and my IPD at 69 seems to be fine with Software IPD adjustment.First time i put on the Rift S I was blown away, the clarity and sweet spot was a massive upgrade.  Really happy with the quality of lenses and screens.  I do agree that the built in audio isnt great but it still does the job.Pros : 5m Cable, huge sweet spot, clear image, comfortable, easy to setup, good compatibility (SteamVR), inside out tracking is spot on.Cons : No manual IPD adjuster, no washable face gasket, built in audio isnt great (can use 3.5mm jack)If you're sitting on the fence, buy a Rift S. The quality is great and i havent regretted my purchase at all.  Really didnt notice any change from 90hz down to 80hz. It's actually IMO much smoother than the WMR i was using.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 7 February 2020
review_title: Upgraded from WMR VR headset.  HUGE IMPROVEMENT!  IPD 69

one_reviews_text: Belle qualité d'image superieur au Rift StandardFacilité de branchementTracking excellentPrevoyez-vous des petits ecouteurs intra-oriculaire si vous voulez plus de volume et d'immersion.Je ne regrette pas d'avoir changé mon rift pour un rift s
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 8 June 2019

one_reviews_text: Come da titolo è stato un ottimo acquisto. Mio figlio è entusiasta di questo dispositivo. Deve essere installato sul PC il programma dedicato dopodiché con i giochi disponibili su Internet il dispositivo si dimostra all'altezza. Realtà virtuale veramente al top!.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 10 January 2021

one_reviews_text: This was bought for my son as an incentive to keep doing school work in troubling times. Having a go myself I was very impressed on the clarity and fun that games like Beat Sabre, Acron & Takelings are as great party games when friends are over. Tons of fun and one of the best value vs functionality headsets available.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 17 August 2020
review_title: For a first VR headset (bought for my son) it is very impressive

one_reviews_text: Mejora la nitidez respecto su versión anterior Oculus Rift CV1.Son bastante cómodas y más fáciles de instalar ya que no requieren de sensores externos. Oculus tiene un catálogo de juegos que está muy bién, a parte de los de Steam.  Actualmente me atrevería a decir que es la mejor opción de Realidad Virtual para PC, en relación calidad / precio. El único pero es el audio, que podrían haber incorporado auriculares de serie. No se porqué no lo hicieron.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 23 December 2019
review_title: Mejor que las CV1 i las HTC VIVE

one_reviews_text: Fantastic product! Set up is super easy and is compatible with 99.9% of games on steam! Controllers feel fantastic to use!If you're wondering how its connected; the Rift S uses a display port connector and usb3 connector. As long as you got a spare port on your motherboard and gpu it works brilliantly!Suprising easy to run, by no means do i have a top tier gaming pc but I've never had any lag issues! Steam has a system check too that'll see if your rig is vr compatible!Pc specs for comparisonI5 7400Gtx 10708 gb ram256 Gb ssd2 TB Hdd
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 4 March 2020

one_reviews_text: Gafas geniales para jugar a vr, tanto juegos de Oculus como de Steam vrNecesitas conectarlas a un PC y que esté sea bastante potenteMuy buen traking y calidad visualSon muy cómodas de llevar
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 11 August 2021

one_reviews_text: Only problem is needing to unplug and re-plug the USB cable often in order for the computer to register the headset.Apparently a common bug.  Hopefully they will fix in the firmware.I'm a newbie VR person and this was a great piece of hardware for my VR introduction.Very happy
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 18 September 2020

one_reviews_text: The Rift S is fairly comfortable, has a clear and sharp display, and get's the job done.Compared to Quest it's way more comfortable.Compared to Valve Index, it's not a great VR headset, but The Index is more than twice the prize, and here the Rift S is great.Anyone looking for a PC VR headset, should find lits to like eith the Rift S.My biggest dissapointment is the Audio. It's simply not nearly good enough, and a wierd choice by Oculus to choose such a poor audio solution, especially concedering the Rift CV1, which actually had pretty amazing audio build in.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 2 February 2020
review_title: Great VR on a budget but with poor audio quality.

one_reviews_text: Buon visore comodo e leggero.  Solo 2 cose negative , l'imbottitura per la fronte scadente( sottile e di scarsa qualità) e l'impossibilità di spegnere i controller ,che  si accendono appena il PC viene avviato indipendentemente se si usano o no , così da dover cambiate spesso le batterie.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 6 November 2020
review_title: Buono ma da migliorare in qualche Piccolo aspetto

one_reviews_text: These things can be great and even better if you know how to use 3rd party apps to run with games that may not be compatible but there are enthusiasts out there that have done all the hard work for you. Is it worth getting one? I dont see anyone using this as their daily driver of course and it can be a bit of a hassle with the cables but compared to other brands - price is quite good for when purchased this.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 2 March 2022

one_reviews_text: Provengo dal CV1 ed il balzo avanti nella qualità visiva e nel fatto che non si devono più avere degli scomodi sensori esterni per il tracciamento, è decisamente notevole. Migliore anche il sistema per indossarlo, davvero rapido e stabile.Per farla breve, è tutto migliorato rispetto al Rift tranne l'audio. Gli speakers presenti nell'halo che si posiziona sulla testa sono, ovviamente, di qualità nettamente inferiore rispetto alle ottime cuffie del CV1. L'audio è cristallino ma manca di bassi (ovviamente) e non isola l'utente dall'esterno.Nel visore è presente un'uscita audio con minijack a cui è possibile attaccare delle cuffie esterne, per ovviare al problema.Il tracciamento non funziona con una stanza al buio completo.Il sistema per impostare la distanza delle pupille non è più meccanico ma software, ma non è un problema se non avete gli occhi come uno squalo martello. Al momento non c'è un test visivo per verificarlo, dovete misurare "a occhio" e impostare il valore nel software Oculus.Effetto zanzariera praticamente assente, un ricordo del passato.In generale un'esperienza migliore rispetto al Rift, peccato per questa soluzione da pezzenti per l'audio.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 25 June 2019
review_title: Ottima qualità visiva ma audio da migliorare

one_reviews_text: Sinceramente uno de los mejores producto técnicos que he comprado. Llevo unos años con este visor y no puedo estar más contento. Cómodas, fácil de usar, compatibilidad con la mayoría de juegos VR. Un gran entretenimiento durante el confinamiento.10/10
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 26 March 2021

one_reviews_text: La calidad de imagen y el rastreo de movimiento son fantásticas, la instalación es fácil de seguir (solo tarda un poco ya que tiene que descargar 6 Gigas) la compatibilidad con los juegos es perfecta y la inmersión es totalmente fantástica. Lo único es que para configurar el micrófono que le conectas podrás tardar un poco ya no hay tutoriales de como hacerlo y tienes que revisar todos los settings de audio.Update: El headset dejo de funcionar en menos de un mes, Oculus Support no me puede ayudar y dicen que necesitan remplazarlo, pero solo lo pueden mandar a una direccion en EU ya que ellos ahi lo mandaron, sin direccion de EU basicamente no tiene garantia.Amazon ofrece devolucion pero es solo durante el primer mes y solo te regresan el dinero que marca que costo el articulo, sin devolucion de envio o impuestos de importacion, eso es mas de $2,000 pesos, estoy trabajando con Oculus para llegar a un arreglo.
review_date: Reviewed in Mexico on 13 March 2020
review_title: El mejor VR set del mercado, pero sin garantia en México

one_reviews_text: I don't understand reviewers who say they've "got it running with an hour", every step of the setup has been hell, once I fix an issue after 1h of googling and threads where the answer is usually just "open a ticket", I am hit with another oneMy computer is a regular build with a good enough graphics card and all the required specs, yet every time I attempt anything something seems to break and I have to go on another hour and a half of troubleshootingAs it stands right now after 5 or 6 hours I've seen the inside of the home screen (but anytime I try to open anything in steam the whole rift crashes) and that's pretty much itIf I can't get it to work in the next few days I'll return it. I usually consider myself good at troubleshooting and tech things but this is just opaque and broken
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 22 July 2019
review_title: Setup is hell, I haven't been able to make it work yet

one_reviews_text: Es macht echt viel Spaß jedes mal in die Virtuelle Welt einzutauchen! Die Controller sind auch echt stabil, hab sie öfters mal gegen die Wand gehauen oder auch mal fallen lassen und funktionieren immer noch perfekt, es sind nur kleine Kratzer zu sehen. Die VR-Brille hat ansonsten auch eine gute Auflösung, also die einzelnen Pixel sind kaum zu sehen, wenn man sich darauf konzentriert. Das Gewicht ist auch angemessen, sprich man bekommt keine Nacken- oder Rückenschmerzen.Kann die Oculus Rift S echt einfach nur weiterempfehlen!
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 18 May 2020

one_reviews_text: Unit is not setup to work with gaming laptops as it does not allow you to connect to HDMI port.  It only has Display Port or mini-Display port capabilities.  It required hours of research on Google and YouTube to find the right adaptor from Display Port to USB3 thunderbolt to make unit work.  My son had to wait one week and try 3 cables before he could finally play with this VR tool. He loves the unit but I hated to have the shell out another $100 in adaptors to make it work.  Unit is expensive enough and should be provided with several adaptor options for Gaming laptops and desktops.  Do your research before to make this VR unit will work on your computer and video card!!!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 5 January 2021
review_title: Unit needs to be supplied with proper adaptors!!!

one_reviews_text: Exclente visor para VR, lo uso para DCS e IL2 y la experiencia de juego es excelente.  Para una buena experiencia requiere una tarjeta de buen desempeño con puerto DP, rtx 2060 o superior.  Para enfocar se requieren ajustes frecuentes y en ocasiones es necesario configurarlo de nuevo despues de reiniciar la PC.  Las baterías de los mandos se consumen muy rapido, aunque acepta baterías recargables NiMh.  Cuenta aun con actualizaciones y videos para configuración y uso.
review_date: Reviewed in Mexico on 3 March 2021

one_reviews_text: Non voglio fare la recensione del visore, ne troverete numerose in rete. Vi restituisco la mia esperienza...è una cosa da provare assolutamente e finalmente ad un prezzo accessibile. Se hai un pc adeguato prendi il rift s se non lo hai prendi il quest 2. Come detto un'esperienza da provare.ps. I giochi ormai sono sempre più belli....e non parlo solo di HL Alyx
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 27 December 2020

one_reviews_text: Originally I had bought this product for the sake of gaming (as did many of us). When I first got my product everything ran perfect, BUT, I needed to tweak a few things relating to my pc by buying a better and faster GPU (1050 ti) in order to run vr in a smooth medium to high quality graphic content. Before purchasing my new gpu I had a much older gpu (745 oem) which came with my pre-built pc. The older gpu made my experience very..... sickening. This was because I would connect and put on my headset but while using the guardian feature the real time camera would basically be a slide show, if you were constantly pressing the mouse button every 0.5 seconds in a powerpoint slideshow, and that was the case with almost all the games I have played unless I customized the graphics of those games to low in order to get atleast 30 frames. With the new gpu replacement, I am able to play almost every game (when I say almost I say that because I cannot play asgard's wrath with good quality graphics but still decent performance but every other game is perfect with medium to high settings). When it comes to purchasing games for vr, you might want to wait a while before diving into vr so that more flashed out or exciting games can come out because currently alot of the games range from 0 to 60 (0 being the very cheap free stuff and 60 being the most recent and sometimes exciting stuff). I personally am not one of those people that HAVE to get 120 fps in every single game with ultra graphics, I am content with whichever balance between fps and quality but when it comes to vr, quality seems to over rule performance as some games are quality heavy (which can add to the experience) while others are very performance heavy (which takes into account your specs). The negatives I have had with this product is the multiple issues ranging from gaming to the product itself. When it comes  to the product, the tracking is decent because at times my oculus wouldn't track my controllers and they would just be at the bottom (on the ground) but only be able to rotate even though they are actually in my hands, other times would be when my controllers sometimes don't track when they go slightly out of my field of view (strange because the headset is littered with sensors). Another issue relating to the controllers is their ability to drain batteries faster than the amount of times a PS4 controller runs out of charge (atleast 3 drained batteries to 1 out of charge ratio). Building on from there, the controllers themselves end up having the spring inside them squeak slightly from multiple uses (not sure if this is built in obsolescence or not) but they stop after either pressing the trigger down and blowing into the open crack or continued use. A positive about the headset and controllers is their 0.5 millisecond tracking which just makes playing games more fun. The headset also allows you to use your desktop in vr which I found to be a very useful feature when switching between games, quickly looking up youtube videos to watch or guides to help you through tough game puzzles. Building on to the games topic, there are some issues when it comes to playing games. These issues can range from black screens to the irritating "Vr device not found" or to the games not appearing in vr or other issues relating to missing files. At first I looked all over the internet for fixes to those issues but they would only fix the problem for a short while before the issue came back, however, I found that creating a shortcut to your desktop and then changing it's properties to running as admin would fix every issue (except the missing files, thats on you buddy). Now some positives when it comes to the overall idea of this product, playing games is a blast but I would prefer it if more were released because there is the constant need to play something else after having to finish a game. The headset is very adjustable and comfortable to wear (for those concerned about the soft pads getting sweaty, there is no need to worry, I have used the rift s for ages and they haven't been ruined). The built in sound is really good because it saves you from having to wear both your vr headset and a pair of headphones which will really make your head hot (trust me, learned from experience). Overall, the product is decent but some tweaks could be done to finish it all off.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 25 November 2020
review_title: A battle between positives and negatives

one_reviews_text: Great product for PC! BUT not easy to setup and install. Get professional help for this product as all on line assistance is just the old runaround for one page to the next and back again! Oculus needs to provide online assistance with this product, or the owner is left with more cupboard filler and a dislike for Facebook developed products. I would not recommend this product to the average game player! stick to 2D and buy a good large monitor
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 31 December 2019

one_reviews_text: El producto que llegó no parece nuevo, presente señales de uso y le falta el adaptador a mini displayport. Pero funciona correctamente y la experiencia es excelente.Es un gran visor, no le pongo las 5 estrellas porque el producto parece usado aunque está es muy buen estado
review_date: Reviewed in Mexico on 25 February 2021
review_title: Producto funcional aunque no parece nuevo

one_reviews_text: I bought this for my 10 year old after having fun with it at a friend’s house.  On oculus’ website, you can download a compatibility software that my PC passed no problem.  When I received the Oculus headset, I tried going through the setup l, but got stuck where it says to connect it to a display port.  My pc does not have it.  After 2-3 hours of research, found some conflicting information on a certain type of adapter MIGHT work.... And it didn’t because my USB-C thunderbolt 3 is not wired directly to my video card, but to the processor.Oculus, this is 2019... Please fix this, or at least notify buyers that they need an extra adapter that MIGHT work, or not... IN BIG PRINT.Future buyers, you will need some technical knowledge to trouble shoot as this product does not feel finished.  It looks good, but it feels like oculus worked out 95% of the issues, and your left with the other 5% to figure out.  As gamers, we are impulsive, and love plug and play.  This is not plug and play.  It’s plug, troubleshoot, oh I need an adapter, wait, try again, still doesn’t work, buy a 5000$ rig to make it simple... And Then it’s an amazing experience.I have 3000$ invested, but now need a new rig with a display port.So owning an oculus rift S, having fun comfortable, glitch free experience will cost about 3000-4000$, plus a potential of 10-15 hours of online research how to make it work.1 star rating because of the frustration making it workOnce everything works, it’s a 5 star experience.Just fix it!Update Jan 2nd 2022:Upgraded my son's computer with another 3000$+ rig.  It has the latest Windows 11. Oculus will not install games on Windows 11 (not yet compatible).  I should've bought 3000$ worth of XRP instead.Update March 9th 2022One of the controllers started drifting.  There's no solution and NO REPLACEMENT AVAILABLE.  THEY'RE DISCONTINUED.  IF YOU MESSAGE OCULUS/META, THEY ARE TELLING YOU TO BUY A NEW COMPLETE UNIT!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 6 July 2019
review_title: Compatibility issues / difficult to make it work

one_reviews_text: Disclaimer: This is not a review about the Facebook login stuff, this is about the headset and the experience using it.I originally owned a Lenovo Explorer and it was GREAT. Sure, the clarity wasn't perfect, the hand tracking was lackluster but over all, I was playing games like HL:Alyx, Skyrim, Beat Saber, Minecraft and it was incredible.I was ready for an upgrade. The Index isn't available in Australia and with a bunch of headsets around the corner, I figured I would upgrade to a "real" VR headset to tie myself over.The Lenovo Explorer is a Windows Mixed Reality headset, meaning it uses all the Microsoft supplied VR tools. I plugged it in, set up my play space and everything else worked great. Steam VR booted out of the box without any configuration, Minecraft came from the Microsoft Store, I even used a (dedicated VR) web browser.Microsoft's vision for VR headsets are that they function as desktop monitors that also play games. The integration between VR applications was seamless, it was honestly a dream.With that in mind, I thought Oculus would be a better, more integrated version of this great experience, BOY was I wrong.In contrast to Microsoft, Oculus see their headsets as stand alone platforms. Oculus *is* the operating system, not Windows - you only need Windows as a consequence of the headset needing to be powered by something.So my initial experience with the Rift S: I plugged it in but had to download some 10gb software I couldn't install on my non main drive - fine whatever. From there my very first look into the headset was amazing. The clarity was about 10 - 20% better than the explorer. The hand tracking extended behind my back and below my head. The head tracking was actually a little worse but the headset felt more comfortable with less light leakage. The introductory sample app was beautiful and I got to zap little 70s lazer guns around the demo room.Once I got through the intro, I ended up in the Oculus home. Great, let's turn off all the Oculus bloat and use the Windows stuff. Oh, turns out you can't. Alright then, I guess I will just learn to use the Oculus home. Let's play some HL: Alyx. Turns out that's not allowed without setting your headset to developer mode which allows the installation of "Non Oculus App Store Apps". Hmmm, that sounds awfully Apple-y.HL: Alyx has performance issues? What? So I need to set the priority of the Oculus tasks in the task manager, install some Oculus settings manager and tweak the headset settings? What is going on?HL: Alyx doesn't have good controller bindings for the Oculus and I need to go to the steam workshop to find a user created controller mapping. What is going on?The menu button on my left controller opens up Steam VR's menu, the menu button on my right controller opens up the Oculus menu. Everything is so janky, how is this so bad when my Lenovo Explorer just worked out of the box with none of this drama?Fine, at least I can play Minecraft. What? I can't get the official WMR Minecraft and instead I have to use an Oculus port that isn't even as good?On top of all that, Facebook are trying to force people to buy their headsets by offering incentives to starving game studios to release platform exclusives. Honestly, it's downright dog of them.Long story short - the hardware is technically great, you will tend to ignore Oculus stuff and jump into SteamVR as quickly as possible. The games are still fun but the experience of getting to them is janky.I love it but I will not buy another Oculus/Facebook headset again.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 10 September 2020
review_title: Great all round headset, dreadful software, will avoid Oculus in future

one_reviews_text: This thing is amazing! There's no base stations or lighthouses to be setup as everything is self-tracking and it works great! For this price and this quality, I couldn't recommend any other headset. I have a small issue which apparently a lot of people get, where the audio randomly cuts out, but is supposedly due to the USB port being used and can be fixed by using a powered USB hub or even just a different USB port.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 27 November 2019

one_reviews_text: Ich bin von der Rift CV1 auf die Rift S gewechselt und habe den Schritt nicht bereut. Das Bild ist deutlich schärfer und der Fliegengitter-Effekt kaum noch zu sehen. Sie ist sehr bequem auf dem Kopf und deutlich leichter als die CV1. Das Tracking der beiden Controller funktioniert mittlerweile perfekt. Ein weiterer Vorteil - durch das Inside-Out Tracking benötigt man keine externen Sensoren mehr und 360 Grad Bewegungen sind einfach zu realisieren.Ein negativer Punkt ist für mich die Oculus-Software. Sie lastet die CPU viel zu stark aus, selbst wenn keine Anwendung läuft. Da ist man bei Steam deutlich ressourcenschonender unterwegs.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 14 November 2019
review_title: Oculus Rift S - der Preis-Leistungs-Sieger unter den VR-Brillen

one_reviews_text: Ho avuto l' Oculus Rift CV1 per circa sei mesi e ne ero molto soddisfatto. L' S costituisce un grande passo avanti rispetto al suo predecessore, il naso ora e' isolato dall'interno del visore evitando cosi' fastidiosi appannamenti, indossare l'S con occhiali da vista e' decisamente più facile e confortevole. L'assenza dei satelliti per tracciare la posizione del visore inoltre rende il tutto molto meno ingombrante e macchinoso e si liberano due USB. Ogni tanto (15/20 minuti) l'immagine viene distorta per una frazione di secondo. Un problema decisamente non fastidioso.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 4 July 2019
review_title: Un passo avanti rispetto al Rift.. comodo, meno cavi USB, risoluzione migliore

one_reviews_text: This headset has incredible tracking for what it is and provides a good stepping stone for getting into VR. I take multiple issues with it, involving both software and hardware:-Firstly this headset has one of the worst microphones in any VR headset and at the price point it's to be expected, what isn't expected however is how bad it truly gets when it makes you sounds like a robot.-Secondly, from the very beginning the software has had trouble picking up the the Display port and USB signal from my PC. Apparently this is a really common issue and just like the first issue, it's not an issue of "Will it happen to me?" Because it definitely will.-This headset is bound to break. I don't see this hardware surviving more than a year. I take really good care of my stuff and I'm even going to say this hardware is sturdy. I had lots of fun with it but alas mine lasted four months tops.-This headset forces you to log into Facebook and they will collect your information. Any breaches in the facebook agreement or if you're using a false identity and you will lose all your purchases in the Oculus store.-Atrocious customer support. Up until now I'm still trying to get a replacement for my headset. Had I not had issues with this headset, I would give it 3.5 stars but due to the issues I'm going to have to reduce that by a large margin. I think this is unforgivable.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 11 November 2020
review_title: Please don't buy this. Oculus has abandoned ship and so will you

one_reviews_text: Es un alucine, estas gafas de realidad virtual.!!!Hay que tener un ordenador, portatil medio bueno.Fijaros bien en las características que necesita. Solo necesita conexión a usb 3.0 y a un DisplayPort. Windows  10Para los que utilizan gafas para ver como yo, fijaros las medidas que deben de tener a lo ancho.Espero que las siguientes tengan mayor resolución, y sonido con mas volúmen (regulable)Aconsejo la compra de estas gafas RV
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 23 January 2020

one_reviews_text: I've owned the original HTC vive, and as amazing as it was, the setup process was laborious and the headset rather heavy. The Oculus Rift S simplifies the setup while managing to increase the quality of the graphics and tracking abilities of the headset.The inbuilt speakers, whilst small, are impressively loud and clear and do the job well with most games (music games like beat saber or Audio Shield benefit from headphones or a larger speaker setup. My only gripes with the speakers are that the sound bleed is quite noticeable to other people in the room compared to similar products (The Microsoft Hololens has similar speaker design, but sound is isolated to the wearer and does not emit sound to the surrounding room.)The controllers are a great update on the existing design and the finger track does take some getting use to compared to other headsets, but it ads an extra sense of immersion once you're use to it.The headset is comfortable, but I'm concerned that the foam lining around the visor will wear out over time with sweat. I've purchased a third party sweat proof cover to hopefully avoid this.Overall, an amazing price for an amazing piece of hardware and highly recommended.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 22 February 2020

one_reviews_text: very good VR headset, Better than the previous one no longer have these famous sensors on the stand and now have them directly on the headset a pure happiness, On the other hand the strap without clips is not the best thing I highly recommend you to change them if you plan to play hectic games. Regarding the consumption of batteries I advise you to buy rechargeable batteries because it drains quickly(I know the photo is the old helmet, But I found the photo funny so I put it on)
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 10 April 2021

one_reviews_text: I love the headset but it's a chore to set up. First week was a nightmare because it did not detect my headset and since then it says to reset oculus sofware every time. Resetting software doesn't help so i reboot every time. I did everything to fix the issues and this is the best i got. The headset itself is awesome but don't buy if you are impatient and/or you don't have much time on your hands.You will rage with a cable stuck to your head 100% guaranteed.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 16 February 2020

one_reviews_text: Strumento ottimo e magnifico per viaggiare virtualmente. Purtroppo il mio pc ha qualche problema (tempo fa gli fu sostituita la scheda madre) ed il visore  il più delle volte non rileva la porta usb. Potreste consigliare un mini pc (fra quelli in vendita su Amazon), sicuramente adatto all'Oculos  Rift S ?  Grazie.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 21 January 2021
review_title: Cerco mini pc adatto all'Oculos Rift S

one_reviews_text: So I've been excited to get a VR for ages now and when I finally got it, I had many issues with it such as software not updated and connection issues. After hours and 1 sleepless night of non-stop troubleshooting, I was finally able to get it to run and yes, it works very well and smooth. I still have to plug it in and out every time I want to play but it's only a minor 30 seconds of inconvenience for at least 3 hours of non-stop fun.So yes, it would be fun if it worked right off the bat. Depending on your computer system, do be prepared for lots of troubleshooting.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 5 July 2020
review_title: A good product! When it works.

one_reviews_text: I was really enjoying my headset when suddenly one day it stopped working completely. I tried to get help from customer support and had tons of trouble getting them to understand what my problem was i just gave up. Really would've loved to keep using my headset but without any help from customer support the most i can do is warn others. This product is probably fazed out at this point so it doesn't really matter but i highly recommend if you're considering an occulus you should probably keep your money and support a better company. At this point i'd be happy with a refund.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 1 October 2021
