one_reviews_text: I've been hesitating on buying a V.R for a long time.I am glad that I landed on the Rift S. The screen and clarity is brilliant. The audio more then satisfies my needs. The ease of Set Up and use. It's been a joy to use.Definitely recommend if you are just getting into the V.R world.Happy Hunting!
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 14 August 2020

one_reviews_text: It worked fine and well for a couple months now i have nothing but problems with it, problem with it connecting to my computer, problems tracking the controllers, its become more of a pain than a joy.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 13 January 2021
review_title: Enjoyed it for a couple months

one_reviews_text: la gafas increibles mejores que cv1 y vive pero de lanzamiento estan teniendo problemas de drivers con constantes actualizaciones
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 21 June 2019

one_reviews_text: Hoy al abrir mi equipo encontré que están rotos. Y no se me golpearon ni se me han caído. Parece que se despegaron.Quisiera reportarlo con Oculus ya que este defecto lo he revisado y es un problema de diseño en los oculus rift. Y quiero que me lo cambien.
review_date: Reviewed in Mexico on 6 April 2021
review_title: Desperfecto Oculus Rift S - Cambio de Joystick

one_reviews_text: Thing barely works after less than a year. picture constantly goes haywire, see nothing but snow, and let's sweat leak into the headset. Last gen was much better. I urge people to steer clear of this, and go buy a vive, wmr, or index.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 22 January 2020

one_reviews_text: I ordered this for my 17 yr old son. He loves it!  It is a different way to play games. He feels like he is part of the game using this devise. He plays it for a little while every day.  I like it because it gets him on his feet and moving.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 31 December 2020

one_reviews_text: Horrorosas. Si no tienes el ipd que marca por defecto oculus lo ves todo borroso. No las recomendaria nunca.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 1 August 2019
review_title: Segun vinieron se metieron en la caja de devoluciones

one_reviews_text: We love it at home. We have not expected so much fun. Just the beat sabers game is already worth buying it. We grew addicted to it. For the price, it is a great experience and tons of fun. Beware though, you need a contemporary gaming rig. We have GTX 2060 super.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 20 February 2020

one_reviews_text: It need a proper set up the first time and then don't overuse or you'll get a headache and strain your eyes. It's really cool I love it. The case is really nice too and full of airbags so don't worry it won't be damaged during shipping.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 12 January 2021

one_reviews_text: There is a known issue with the Oculus Rift S which causes it to fail to connect to some systems. After extensive troubleshooting and run around from Oculus Technical support, I still could not get it to connect. Before you buy google "Rift s fails to connect to display port".
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 5 January 2021

one_reviews_text: Great vr headset, sde is almost non-existent and unnoticeable when playing. simple setup, no need for beacons. Even on a lower spec machine the performance is good. Just be careful if you wear glasses with them - they can scratch the rift lenses!
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 5 January 2020
review_title: Great headset at a reasonable price to make it worth taking the dive into VR

one_reviews_text: Quelli che mi aspettavo. Risoluzione e prestazioni al top. Rimango in attesa dell'aggiornamento per il riconoscimento delle mani. Non vale l'upgrade dalla prima versione.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 10 January 2020

one_reviews_text: Que diferencia hay? Las Quest, aparte de poder conectarlas al PC como estas, puedes llevartelas por ahí, lo cual es mucho mejor y las S no, fin de la argumentación...
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 26 September 2019

one_reviews_text: Best VR headset I have used. Minimal screen door effect, I don't even notice it unless I really focuse. Not having to set up tracking devices is amazing. Controllers are much better than I expected.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 9 November 2019
review_title: Best vr investment I could have made.

one_reviews_text: constant technical issues. won't even connect to my display port after latest firmware update. just started return process. I'm so disappointed I love VR but this is just no good. guess I'll buy something else. I literally have hundreds of dollars of software and nothing to play it on
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 25 November 2019

one_reviews_text: J'ai pu tester le gear vr qui est un casque de réalité virtuel mais pour téléphone plus précisément le galaxy s7, eh bah sa tous changé quand j'ai acheté ce casque (Qualité: Audio,Vidéo,Son,Capteurs) tous est parfait j'ai essayé de mettre la manette en dessous du casque pour voir le tracking est c'est magnifique ^^ malheureusement il faut jouer avec la lumière allumé s'il fait nuit car sinon ça traque plus rien ! Mais bon sinon ont peut changer la résolution d'image a plus de 3000x par 2000 pixels pourquoi pas mais faut aussi avoir un bon pc, autre de ce la le casque convient a tous les amateurs de vr incompris moi si vous voulez achetez un casque pour pas cher et que vous voulez jouer a vos jeux sur Steam je vous le conseille en plus petit bonus quand vous êtes dans la réalité virtuelle vous pouvez activé les cameras pour voir où vous marchez sa évite de ce casser un bras par exemple :) Je vous le conseille très bon achat je ne le regrette pas par contre acheter une mousse pour transpiration car la mousse d'origine ne sert presque a rien et elle est plutôt inconfortable :)
review_date: Reviewed in France on 9 August 2020
review_title: Meilleur Casque de Réalité virtuelle à petit budget ! je trouve qu'il ne coûte même pas son prix :)

one_reviews_text: incomparable a tout ce que j'ai essayer en ce qui consterne le virtuelc'est de toute beauté
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 4 May 2021
review_title: vraiment un  plaisir ce monde virtuel

one_reviews_text: Mucho mejor de lo que me esperaba, pensando que los sensores internos no iban a ser igual o mejor que los externos pero son mucho mejor, solo que con steam vr me da unos problemas pero son facilmente resuelto
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 19 January 2020

one_reviews_text: This purchas was one of the worst we have ever made. Ive had this for 3 weeks almost and still no way to hook to my computer. Ive ordered adaptors from this location and others. Why make a cord that cant plugInto a computer or needs 2 different adaptors to work.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 6 May 2021

one_reviews_text: J'ai longtemps hésité entre prendre ce casque ou le valve index. Les temps de livraisons du valve index ont fait que j'ai choisi celui d'oculus, et je ne regrette rien. Le casque est littéralement plug and play, il suffit de le brancher et ça marche. Visuellement je ne vois pas les pixels, quand je joue à HL:Alyx je suis capable d'oublier que je ne vis pas dans Cité 17 lol.Le point qui m'inquiétait le plus était le tracking des manettes, mais ça marche juste super bien.Bref, je recommande ce casque les yeux fermés
review_date: Reviewed in France on 5 July 2020

one_reviews_text: la instalacion no fue facil. Se conectaba para jugar y al dia siguiente estaba desconectado. desesperante. ni el support de oculus me dio una solucion. asi que aburrido decidi devolverlo.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 16 October 2020
review_title: no me dio opcion de probarlo.

one_reviews_text: Coming from a Windows Mixed Reality headset this is certainly a step up in tracking capability and in clarity of the display. No real issues with the headset other than the tracking occasionally cutting out for less than half a second once every blue moon but that rarely happens and isn't really that big of an issue for the most part but is stopping me from giving it 5 stars.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 15 November 2019
review_title: Great product but occasional mishap with tracking that resolves itself quickly.

one_reviews_text: Tenía la curiosidad de conocer esta tecnología,  y fue fantástico el visor,  hay mucha variedad de juegos y la pernera vez es alucinante la sensación. Muy recomendable.  Equipo de primera calidad.
review_date: Reviewed in Mexico on 15 August 2021

one_reviews_text: Everything is a step up on the CV1 except sound quality. The screen door effect is still there but is a lot better then before. Fov is mayb just a little bit better vertical but the same horizontally. Tracking is the same imo but has the added bonus of not needing sensors.Overall it’s a good upgrade imo except for sound quality which is just crap. If you have CV1 should you upgrade. Imo yes.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 14 July 2019

one_reviews_text: Ottimo prodotto incredibile realistico
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 12 February 2021

one_reviews_text: The headset itself is brilliant. As are the controllers. Works with Steam VR, and the oculus software is great.My only issue is being forced to create a Facebook account to use the thing. If the next best headset wasn't nearly double the price I'd be sending it back.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 30 December 2020
review_title: Good headset, but requires a Facebook account.

one_reviews_text: Rien à redire sur la qualité du produit et l'expérience VR proposée,toutefois attention à ceux qui possèdent un ordinateur portable : assurez vous avant de commander de posséder un port Display ou bien mini display, dans le cas contraire, comme moi, afin de ne pas avoir de surprise à l'installation, il vous faudra vous munir d'un adaptateur USB-C male vers Display femelle. Attention, les adaptateur HDMI / DISPLAY ne vous permettrons pas de faire fonctionner votre casque, seulement USB-C !
review_date: Reviewed in France on 20 October 2020
review_title: Attention à la compatibilité avec votre ordinateur

one_reviews_text: Purtroppo ho comprato diversi giochi ma pavlov (fps) non è compatibile con questo visore...E altri giochi spesso sembra che non vengono letti i comandi forse è l’assenza stessa delle telecamere che non rende preciso il tutto
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 12 June 2019

one_reviews_text: El headset es muy bueno y fácil de configurar, además de que está a buen precio y tiene buena calidad comparado con la competencia.LLego antes de la fecha estimada lo cual fue bueno ya que lo pude probar con antelación.
review_date: Reviewed in Mexico on 29 September 2020
review_title: Excelente headset y tiempo de entrega

one_reviews_text: DO NOT BUY!! Disconnects constantly in the middle of games.  Worked with tech support, no luck. They said they would replace it.  It’s been 3 weeks and they keep saying that they are “working on a replacement”.  Total crap and now I’m out $500+.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 15 April 2020

one_reviews_text: Contentissimo per il servizio di Amazon.L'apparecchio è eccellente. Tre stelle per la mancanza di un adattatore del display Port che ne consenta l'utilizzo con notebook con USBc

one_reviews_text: very bad experience i bought three units one of them was badly used , there is so much wear and tear all over it

one_reviews_text: Cumple con lo que pone en las especificaciones.si no tuviese cable seria genial.

one_reviews_text: I love this product so much. Its so fun to play beat saber, picture quality is great, and hand tracking is extremely good. Only complaint i have is the "halo headband" is below par. If you're moving fast then the headset does tend to shake slightly. If it werent for that, I'd give this product a 5/5.

one_reviews_text: Eine sehr gute und günstige VR Brille bin begeistert von der Qualität.

one_reviews_text: Wish I could give less than one star. Image quality is trash. You get what you pay for: cheap headset equals cheap experience. I returned mine within 48 hours and bought a Valve Index, light years better.Plus now you’re required to have a Facebook account just to use it.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 23 August 2020
review_title: Sucks, with some more cons. Don’t buy.

one_reviews_text: Mi Oculus Rift s está defectuoso, desde mayo 2020 estoy en contacto con soporte y aún no me resuelve, me piden factura de la compra y Amazon no la emite por ser producto de importación, decepcion total!!!

one_reviews_text: Per utilizzarlo ci vuole un pc di livello altissimo

one_reviews_text: Cables disconnect, sometimes can be fixed by unplugging and replugging, sometimes not. Sucks that it can happens midgame. Controller tracking is 10/10 tho, miles better than PSVR.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 17 August 2020

one_reviews_text: Difficultés à connecter avec Windows qui ne le reconnaît pas quand on allume le PC. Doit débrancher et changer de port USB à chaque fois. Problème pas encore résolu. Par contre une fois branché c’est super
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 16 December 2020

one_reviews_text: Une honte sans nom pour un article de ce prix ...Soi disant neuf à l'achat, je me retrouve avec un produit usagé ainsi que son emballage endommagé. Malgré cela, je n'y prête guère attention, désireux d'essayer la VR.Cependant, ma surprise fut complète en installant le logiciel car les capteurs du casques sont défectueux ! (voir photo) Cela pourrait être un problème venant du fabricant ou bien une incompatibilité avec mon ordinateur, mais non. J'ai fait mille et une manipulation sans aucun succès. J'ai même contacté le service client aux US et le verdict fut le même ... Il faut le renvoyer.Soyez vigilant avec la high-tech avec Amazon ! En espérant un remboursement rapide ou l'envoi d'un produit équivalent neuf et en bon état.
review_date: Reviewed in France on 19 November 2021

one_reviews_text: Il rift s è stata la mia prima esperienza in VR. Appena l'ho provato la prima frase detta è stata: Wooooow. Tutto molto bello e divertentissimo consiglio vivamente chi vuole provare VR.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 29 June 2019

one_reviews_text: Es una maravilla de producto
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 19 July 2019

one_reviews_text: Arrivato in condizioni perfette.

one_reviews_text: Insgesamt 10/10Display( Auflösung, Hz, Latenz) 10/10Controller und erfassung 9/10Mobilität 10/10Komplett zufrieden, perfektes Headset zum einsteigen in VR, oder erfahrene VR-nutzer
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 22 August 2019

one_reviews_text: C'est mon premier casque et j'en est été très content pendant 2 semaines,  mais depuis des  mises à jour j'ai une perte de connexion avec un écran noir dans le casque au bout de quelques minutes, si on rebranche ou relance le logiciel cela remarche et puis il y a encore une déconnection etc.Donc attendez quelques mois que tout cela soit au point  !

review_title: Trés bien mais des problémes de drivers

one_reviews_text: Ottima qualità e venditore

one_reviews_text: Funcionan genial, puede que no tengan la función de detectar el dedo corazón, angular y meñique pero es algo innecesario, se ven espectaculares y son una bacanería, a mi familia les encanta.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on 13 January 2020

one_reviews_text: It's amazingly easy to setup only needing one usb 3.0 port and a DP port.Graphics are decent but not the best.overall just an amazing headset for the price.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 27 August 2019

one_reviews_text: Juste 4 étoiles car pour y jouer il fait avoir des actions dans l'industrie des piles. Les manettes drainent les batteries à une vitesse impressionnante. Le reste en soit est parfait.

one_reviews_text: We have recently upgraded to the Oculus Rift S. Our staff need to regularly move the device to different locations and they were finding it cumbersome to re-configure the sensors each time. As the Oculus Rift S has sensors built into the headset we now do not have to worry about this.We use the Oculus VR headsets with clients with Autism Spectrum Disorder.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 29 July 2019

one_reviews_text: Nach Kauf und Instalation der Oculus VR Brille , kann und möchte ich nicht mehr auf die 2D Ansicht eines normalen Bildschirm wechseln. Das Gefühl eine 737 oder ähnliches in die Luft zu bringen ist der Wahnsinn !
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on 15 August 2019

one_reviews_text: Ottimo prodotto, con qualche problema sull'adattamento visivo, può provocare sensi di nausea.

one_reviews_text: The Oculus Rift S arrived quicker than stated.  I love it, I love motor racing sims and I can't imagine driving without it now. It fits my head, my big nose and my glasses comfortably.  The sound is great and I have had no issues with it and find it encapsulates me.  Brilliant
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 10 August 2019

one_reviews_text: Pros: * inside out tracking works beautifully in 99% of usage scenarios, and hassle-free setup * amazing visuals, much better than original Rift or HTC Vive * great priceCons * Audio could be better, but easily fixed with a set of headphones * Demanding on USB ports - consider a powered external USB3.0 hub or dedicated PCIe USB adapter
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 6 June 2019
review_title: Brilliant device, but not without its flaws

one_reviews_text: Non compatibile con alcune schede madri asus
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on 4 December 2019

one_reviews_text: This will not work with a laptop and will only work with a display port that directly connects to a video card. Don't know why it won't connect to hdmi like the previous generation.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 25 July 2019

one_reviews_text: Très déçu de ce casque acheté il y a 3 mois je n’ai toujours pas su l’utiliser sur mon PC malgré les tests de compatibilités qui se sont avérés concluant.J’ai un écran noir après 30 secondes d’utilisation! Je n’ai pas d’autre choix que de le revendre. Je me tournerai vers HTC pour mon prochain achat.
review_date: Reviewed in France on 21 August 2019

one_reviews_text: Even with extensive research and being told it would be compatible with our pc. It did not work, we have spent over 4k on our pc set up and even with purchasing multiple adapters ... the oculus rift S would not work.Im sure it would be great if we could have used it. Unfortunately in our case we couldn't and we returned it.

one_reviews_text: Well worth the money. Hours of family fun. Perhaps too immersive.....my wife kicked a coffee table fighting VR bad guys.  :)

one_reviews_text: As far as for my use, this is the best bang for cuk be experience..not everyone has the ability to spend thousands on a be setup and room. This does great tracking and image for a fraction of the cost. Facebook money has gone a long way. A must for anyone wanting to jump into VR
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 19 October 2019
review_title: Best investment at this time for VR

one_reviews_text: brought this product to play some light vr gaming with a few friends but right out of the box, i noticed one of the controllers triggers was making a squeaking noise whenever it is pressed. kinda want this fixed but i doubt the support team will get back to me as usual
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 6 September 2020

one_reviews_text: Very good vr headset, just a little problem is when I move a lot in some games, the headset starts to wobble and it is pretty hard to see when this happens... I just hope that there will be like a premium strap that will be holding the headset better than this one...
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 25 August 2019

one_reviews_text: après l'avoir reçu j'ai mis plus de 2h avant de le faire fonctionner (écran noir). suite à une séance de jeu impossible de le refaire fonctionner (son dans le casque mais image sur l'écran de pc) . J'ai alors contacté le support en français, 2 min après j'avais une réponse et il m'a suivis pendant tout le process, il y a plein de manip à faire si le casque ne fonctionne pas direct mais après ça plus aucun souci et l'aventure à pu commencer....La VR est vraiment très immersive je tombe de haut XD je pense lâcher les jeux PC pour ne faire plus que ça maintenant.
review_date: Reviewed in France on 17 June 2019
review_title: plein de galère !! mais un bon support très reactif

one_reviews_text: I'm simply amazed by VR gaming. The controls are brilliant, the headset is very responsive and makes for an awe-inspiring gaming experience.

one_reviews_text: Achete pour m'entrainer sur Condor2, c'est une immersion geniale. Je peux pas imaginer revenir sur un ecran plat.

review_title: un autre monde c'est un truc de dingue!

one_reviews_text: Muy contenta con el producto

one_reviews_text: I hope wireless accessories come but i prefer it over the vive pro

one_reviews_text: It shipped faster than expected, and it was packaged very well, the only thing that i don't really like about it, is that if you look down it kindof gets farther away from your face and it gets a bit blurry, and also headphones such as hyperx, don't fit it very well because of the thicc headband. Otherwise, Very good quality.

one_reviews_text: Great, occasionally fogs up but there is far less of a screen door effect then the previous model which adds to the immersion. Controllers are hard to turn off and I find myself running through tons of batteries but that’s just little things. Anyways if you want to buy a VR headset I strongly recommend the rift s.

one_reviews_text: Force to create a Facebook account

one_reviews_text: Hardware is great, really love the design, no flaws that i can currently think of, set up was easy. The oculus store and menus are easy to navigate. The exclusives are cool and so is the Oculus Home. Played VR Chat and Vader Immortal and they run great.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 26 November 2019
review_title: Just an overall good VR headset.

one_reviews_text: I had quite a lot of pleasant experiences with the Oculus Rift S. The problem is that the technical problems far outclass the positives. When the headset was working it was a blast. The experience is fantastic but since I got it. I could not play for more than 2 hours at a time without being interrupted by a technical problem. Got my item refunded.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 26 August 2019

one_reviews_text: It was a great unit, until Oculus updated their software - causing tons of Rift S's, to become paperweights. Oculus support is slow and the device hasn't been working for almost 6 months. Struggle to even get a warranty or refund reply from them. It was the best of times, then the worst.

one_reviews_text: the only recommendation is get a good graphics card. i started with a 1050ti and went to a 2060 gtx.  amazing difference

one_reviews_text: Très bon Casque pour débutent RV, très simple à installer hors le logiciel oculus qui fait quand même 10 go mais une fois dans le logiciel il vous suffit de brancher le casque une petite mise à jour et c'est partie vous voilà plonger en Réalité virtuel !  Je ne peu pas comparer à d'autres casque car je n'en ai pas eu mais j'ai trouver l'affichage très net donc pas trop de problème d'effet de grille je trouve personnellementvoilà pour finir je recommande se produit pour se qui on le PC pour l'utiliser je n'ai aucun problème avec une GTX 1060 6GB, I5-8500 et 8GB de ram

one_reviews_text: The oculust rift S is damn awesome! 3 days so far, nothing to say except wow! Single player is smooth multiplayer like zero caliber with my specs are king of glitchy but this is not the fault of the oculus, 5 stars for it GG!

review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 22 September 2020
review_title: Arrived incredibly quickly! Only downside is controllers.

one_reviews_text: Technologie intéressante. Par contre le logiciel Oculus plante souvent sur mon ordinateur pourtant très performant et la compatibilité avec les jeux sur Steam rest plutôt mauvaise.

one_reviews_text: Amazon was amazing but Oculus Customer Support should be avoided like the plague.Oculus will brick your AU$600 device for no apparent reason and will do everything they can to avoid a refund/exchange.

one_reviews_text: My first experience with VR and this headsetIt performs well above my expectationTo be totally immersed into Fallout 4,Doom vr and Warthunder is truly amazingThe only down side is the sound but you can still use your own headset so its not much of an issue

one_reviews_text: Took about a half hour of driver updates to get this working, but once it was up and running it's been a hit.  A month in and still need to argue it off the head of my kids.

one_reviews_text: Era la prima volta che provavo un visore della realtà virtuale, è stata un'esperienza assurda e inspiegabile con le parole, poi a 450€ è un affarone. Consiglio l'acquisto.

one_reviews_text: Neither the original or replacement set connected properly. Oculus / FB wasn't exactly helpful in remedying the issue. I will look to another company for my VR .Amazon is really great to deal with in regards to returns.

one_reviews_text: I liked this headset but I  have an IPD (interpupiliary distance) of around 76mm. The Rift S was almost unusable for fine details like text. If you fall neatly into the +-5 range of 63.5mm then this is perfect for PC stuff, if not then you're better getting the Quest like I did.

review_title: Good if you have a small IPD

one_reviews_text: Initially device worked fine, then stopped working with visual display, I sent oculus my diagnostic file and they said its the head set unit so I re-ordered a new one and same problem, no visual display, I suspect its software related, but it shouldn't be this buggy.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 21 August 2020
review_title: Buggy as hell on PC, display stopped working, still awaiting refund

one_reviews_text: Works as a mediocre VR headset. Tracking is sub-par even after the "fix", the definition in the display is good for a headset at this price point but the controllers are far too small even someone with medium-small hands. Overall I would recommend saving for a Valve Index or buying an HTC Vive instead of buying a Rift S.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on 2 November 2019

one_reviews_text: انة لايركب في مدخل لاب توب وحتى تحويلة اللي معاه بدون اي فايدة تذكر حتى لو يكونلاب توبك مخصص للالعاب

one_reviews_text: My mate loves it, no motion sickness, fits great.  Adjusts easily for when I wish to use it, although I get motion sickness and can't use it with some game mechanisms.  Overall it has been a great experience.  It arrived promptly after ordering and so far hasn't let either of us down

one_reviews_text: got this for christmas and absolutly loved it sure it has issues now and again with tracking but reset in settings under beta tab NOT via unplugging also make sure lights in room are on as its using cameras on the headset not like ps4 vr or earlier rift's and its good as gold

one_reviews_text: Do not regret buying this at all, vr games are great and this is a great first timer headset. Only problem I've had is the IPD adjustment, which seems to make no difference for me no matter where I put it, but the image is still clear enough for me to feel comfortable.

one_reviews_text: This is a very nice vr headset. What i like most is you dont need base stations like the old one and can move fairly easy from one computer to another.

one_reviews_text: Ca fait longtemps que je voulais acheter un casque VR, j'avais regardé du côté du HTC vive,  mais le prix et les temoignages sur le SAV HTC, inexistant en cas de problème,  m'avait refroidit.Alors quans Oculus a sorti le Rift S a moins de 500 Euros j'ai franchi le pas. Et l'expérience est au dela de mes attente, la qualité et la réactivité sont bluffantes. En plus il est totalement compatible avec Steam ce qui edt un gros plus.Je pensais que le système de son intégré dans la bande du casque, donc sans ecouteurs serait moyen, et c'est en fait très bon, donc pas d'ecouteurs a racheter. Le fait qu'il n'y ai pas de capteurs a installé dans la pièce finit d'achever la concurrence et rend le système facile a installé.Fonctionne parfaitement sur un Pc avec 8Go de Ram, gtx 1060, intel core i5.
review_date: Reviewed in France on 23 June 2019

one_reviews_text: Do not buy this headset unless you want nothing but problems. When it works it works well. But 3/4 of the time you will have tracking and jittering issues. one_reviews_text: I "upgraded" from the regular rift and can definetely say it is not worth the upgrade for a few reasons, not just the bugs.1st- The non adjustable ipd makes this thing almost not worth it alone.  It seems like it is made for some kind of horse face.  You have to have a long narrow face.  I actually have a small medium (or ipd 65) head and the lenses are close together making it feel like you are cross eyed even with correct program ipd.  You absolutely feel you got a loss in field of view.  I warn you now.  Unless you are 12 years old this is going to tick you off.  What a failure.2nd-  The inside out tracking works good if you never experienced the tower version.  I can see now that the towers are worth their weight.  If I hold still in a game I can notice that this thing is constantly trying to calculate tracking and there is an ever slight "wobble" in the vision.  Don't focus on it too much cuz it will make you feel weird.3rd - Audio is terrible even with headphones.  The speakers built on the sides are useless.  I put in some expensive headphones to find out that the audio quality the oculus was processing was just flat out bad.  It is still tinny and lacks bass.  I tried to find a way to equalize the audio from my pc and have run into road blocks because what seems to be that the because the headphones are in the oculus itself, it is bypassing any fixing I do from the pc. I have been searching for a work around for hours.  What a failure.4th - The pass through vision sucks.  It is black and white and blurry.  No way to stay in that mode and work on stuff.  I was really excited for this feature.  What a failure.5th - The cotrollers are ok but I find myself flip flopping and juggling them all over the place to find the right grip.  I think the old ones were superior as they just fell into your hands the right way.  Might take some time to get used to but feels like a downgradeFinal thoughts :  I have spent 2 days playing with it hoping it would just get better and I would get used to it.  It did not.  It just kept getting worse as new problems would just keep popping up and hopefully I have gone through all of  them.  But that is enough problems to not recommend this to anyone as long as their are other options out there. I will say the screen is a lot sharper but then even that comes with a downside.  With the lcd screen and not oled you immediately notice your blacks are washed out and faded.  From pass through videos I saw of the screen it looked fine and I could be ok with it but it is a lot worse than those videos represented.  I forgot where I read it but I thought I saw that one of the original engineers just up and quit on facebook for this product.  Now I can see why.  I really wanted to like the rift s and tried to make that happen but sadly it did not.  What a failure.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 May 2019

one_reviews_text: I am so pissed and disappointed. I have waited so long for the headset. I was scared that my IPD would be a problem (I'm 59/60) but I didn't even get to check that. The headset does not work with my new Dell G7 VR ready laptop because it doesnt have a displayport. Most gaming laptops don't have one. I'm not buying any of their product anymore (they already got me on the Oculus Go, which doesnt serve my IPD but mentioned it nowhere and definitely not during my many interactions with customer service).

one_reviews_text: VR headsets like this one are normally un returnable due to hygienic reasons (like headphones) be for warned.  It's also a high barrier for entry due to the price.That being said this is hands down the single most flag ship vr experience available to date.  Beating out vive, oculus 1, psvr by a technical landslide.  It's incredible and I wish I could live in this world forever!Your computer needs to have a dedicated video card with Display Port, mini display port, or unsupported (but works) usb type c (thunderbolt 3 compatible) adapter.  Included in the box is usb 3.0, DP and a DP to mini DP optional adapter.Setup is 8 gb install from the Web, sets up quick if you have the required specs and connections.I wanted to use this vr for programing and gaming.  The idea of fully immersed and focused computer development environment instead of a monitor was kinda cool and worked quite well.The cord is long enough to not notice nor get in the way.  The 2 Battery powered controllers are extremely ergonomically designed and the overall gaming experience is stellar.The headset fits and adjusts to meet any head size with straps and knobs.  The overall built quality is too notch and the included front facing cameras turn on if you're getting too close to a physical object to advise before collision.I'm really excited for were the future is "headed" (hehe) and you should be too.  Best vr experience for graphics and over all to date and this is definitely for me.  Finally a great vr solution for gamers and non gamers alike!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 25 May 2019
review_title: Be Sure Your Computer is Good Enough

one_reviews_text: This thing is amazing, other than it seems like everytime i turn off and back on my PC i have to recalibrate the whole thing. But other than that no complaints!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 21 May 2019

one_reviews_text: This headset has exceeded my expectations. The tracking works very well, display is crisp, and its by far the best bang for your VR buck at the moment.  My only minor gripe is the speakers but there's still other options to remedy that. What cracks me up are the 1 star reviews as if they did a bait and switch telling you it has HDMI. Lol. It's advertised as DisplayPort and USB 3.0.  It's your own fault if you bought it not realizing your PC isn't compatible.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 31 May 2019
review_title: Whiners who didn't read about the DisplayPort, just stop

one_reviews_text: Up until now the entry price point for VR has been pretty high, but the Rift S is a move in the right direction. Here are my thoughts on my Rift so far:- Price -At $550, the Rift is more expensive than a gaming console but vastly cheaper than some of it's competitors like the HTC Vive. It has fairly low system requirements as well which will mean you'll need a less expensive PC to drive this unit as well.- System Requirements -Minimum specs:Graphics Card - NVIDIA GTX 1050Ti / AMD Radeon RX 470 or greaterAlternative Graphics Card - NVIDIA GTX 960 / AMD Radeon R9 290 or greaterCPU - Intel i3-6100 / AMD Ryzen 3 1200, FX4350 or greaterMemory - 8GB+ RAMVideo Output - DisplayPortTM 1.2 / Mini DisplayPort (with adapter included in the box)USB Ports - 1x USB 3.0 portOS - Windows 10Recommended specs:Graphics Card - NVIDIA GTX 1060 / AMD Radeon RX 480 or greaterAlternative Graphics Card - NVIDIA GTX 970 / AMD Radeon R9 290 or greaterCPU - Intel i5-4590 / AMD Ryzen 5 1500X or greaterMemory - 8GB+ RAMVideo Output - DisplayPortTM 1.2 / Mini DisplayPort (with adapter included in the box)USB Ports - 1x USB 3.0 portOS - Windows 10I've been running somewhere in between those two specs. I was able to pick up a Lenovo Legion Y530 last year on Black Friday for a good price (i5-8300H, GTX 1050ti, 16GB ram), and that seems to be working fine so far. You could build a PC, but then you'd be losing out on one of the major pros of the Rift S, it's portability.- Portability -All of the cameras and sensors are built into the headset and wands, no wires to run to cameras or sensors around the room. There's nothing stopping you from taking this from the living room to your bedroom, or to a friends house (why I suggest a laptop). The only real restriction is the amount of free space in whatever room you're in.- Comfort -The headset is easily adjustable to various sizes of head. I was just barely able to size it small enough to fit my 6 year old. It's not overly heavy, and although most of the weight is on the front, I didn't find it bothered my neck during play sessions. I did find the side mounted tether slightly distracting however. It didn't get in the way, but I did notice it's presence. I would have preferred something coming off the back instead. I also had one of the battery covers on one of the wands come loose during some vigorous movements. It didn't fall off, but it was disruptive.- Performance -The lenses are only have an 80hz refresh rate. In games where you're mostly sight-seeing that's fine, but you will likely notice slight distortions during high action sequences. With that being said, the picture is still quite good and for a fraction of the price. I'm not particularly impressed by the built in speakers either, but there is a 3.5mm headphone jack to allow you to use your own headset.Overall I'm very impressed with the Rift S for the price point it's come in at. It's portability makes it  easy to travel with and install, and it's relatively low system requirements make this system enticing to casual gamers with lower end gaming systems.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 8 November 2019
review_title: Good performance and flexibility with an enticing price point

one_reviews_text: First of all, I absolutely love the oculus rift s and have been constantly blown away from the moment I opened the box. Unlike most of the negative reviews on here I actually did my research first (if doing research is reading the description) and realized I need a display port instead of hdmi. For me this is fine, I have a couple DP and HDMI ports on my computer. Great. I ran into an issue where the oculus would crash playing level 1-2 of robot recall but looking online it seems that this has been on ongoing problem with that specific game since oculus rift was out. In any case, the introductory demo blew me away completely. Maybe it's because I'm looking at this product through nostalgia glasses of what I was hoping the future would be like but I am so happy that VR technology is here and my personal experience was that it was absolutely incredible looking at things in VR and just playing around. I just want to stress again that most "issues" with this product that people seem to be complaining about seem more like issues with their own laptops or they just didn't read the fine print. After I finish writing this I'm heading right back in to Gun Club VR for some target practice. All in all BUY THIS PRODUCT, it will blow your mind, but DO YOUR RESEARCH, or you might have a sore behind.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 May 2019

one_reviews_text: Compared to the DK1 that I had tried many years ago, I am glad to see that the Oculus has significantly progressed.One of the most appealing features of the Oculus Rift S was that I did not have to run the lighthouses to the different corners of my room. The sensors are built into the headset, and play a part in making this setup more “portable” as long as you bring your computer with you.Setting up the guardian is luckily a simple process because I have had to configure that for the third time now. I am not sure what is causing it to lose its configuration, but in the span of 5 days, I have had to reconfigure my guardian 3 times now. The guardian is a cool feature when it works, preventing you from running into things. What I did find is putting the guardian slightly inside the physical boundaries allowed me some wiggle room should I accidentally reach outside of the play area.Setup was very straightforward; however, I was somewhat shocked at the 8GB minimum download to get this working. A small portion of this is the actual Rift software, the rest of it is two demo titles that help explain the features of the Rift. While this is cool initially, it feels like wasted space after you are familiar with the machine. You are unable to delete these titles from within the Rift application. You do also get two bonus titles with your purchase, however both of them are drawing applications that did not interest me at all.Overall, I think this is a nice product that is having some launch issues. I am hoping that these issues will be addressed in future firmware updates.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 30 May 2019

one_reviews_text: This was really cool to test out. Having tried out other VR systems, I had the ability to compare.I didn't find the headset very comfortable to wear; there's not enough options to fit properly. I guess it depends on your head shape. I found that it was just way too big.Setup is really simple, and only takes a few minutes. If you have a fast computer, you'll be good to go. There are lots of free games to download online, and lots of choices that are $$. I tested a couple free games first.So far, no problems with the tracking, and minimal screen door issues. I'm going to watch the tracking, as I see a number of people having issues with it. Fingers crossed it'll continue to work! :/I don't like the hand sensors; they're kind of awkward to hold, and are difficult for precision.My biggest complaint is that I didn't find the audio impressive; flat, bass is kinda crappy. I had much higher expectations considering the price.VR has definitely come a long way, and the but this sort of went backwards with a few of the options.Would I recommend this?... ehhhh At the pricetag, and with the reported tracking issues, I'm going to say wait for another system by Oculus, or check out the Rift.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 3 July 2019

one_reviews_text: I was super excited to try this headset out. I powered on my laptop and booted up the website to download the software. I don't know if my laptop is just slow but it took hours to download it and so I had to leave it overnight to finish downloading and installing the software. I came back the next day and was told my driver's needed updating so I started downloading that. After another couple hours I was told my software was not compatible because my graphics card was not one of their recommended ones being the NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti or AMD Radeon RX 470 or better. I was super dissapointed. I was really hoping to try this system out.I will have to make time to meet with a friend who has a gaming laptop with those qualifications or greater to try this.What I loved was I had never tried a headset in VR before. It appeared to be well built, it was comfortable on my head and didn't feel heavy, the controllers were neat and intuitive, the fact that you don't need extra cameras to move around the room is super cool, and it is also all in one package. I really would have loved a hard case to come with it to protect the sensitive pieces but I just keep them in the box it came in for now. Keep the wire tucked in and draped over the back of the headset to keep it our of your way and not hanging off your left shoulder or grab some velcro straps and strap it back over your back.I will have to budget and wait until I can afford a graphics card good enough to be compatible here for home use. I'm kind of dissapointed but it at least leaves me hungry to try it soon. I have read from others that the screen door effect is minimal and this system is really an all in one package. I would recommend it for anyone who is looking for a compact be experience who has a gaming laptop or extra funds to invest in that.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 29 May 2019
review_title: Be prepared to invest in a gaming laptop

one_reviews_text: As a very Underwelmed owner of a Dell VRP 100 Windows “Mixed reality” headset, I was all but convinced that the future of VR was bleak, clumsy, Clunky, Frustrating and overall just not good general.After my experience with “mixed reality” I had no desire to purchase another VR headset – So Full Disclosure – as the green text says: Amazon sent this to me for review purposes.I am so very glad they did.Over the past few months I’ve had friends and family over, I’ve travelled with this, and just had overwhelmingly positive experience after experience with this.Compared to the Dell “Microsoft” headset the optics are WORLDS better. No distortion and nearly crystal clear text. The tracking is much better to.Like some wizardary, I had a “we live in the future” moment where I drew a virtual fence – This headset will warn you when you’re about to reach out of your “Safe” zone.The first opening “wizard” in the oculous app ends you up in a camper trailer chocked full of gizmos and an adorable “wall-e” type robot – It very easily and wonderously exposes you to just the surface of what is possible.On steam, theres a BBC app that’s free – You can fly along in a Lancaster Bomber during WWII  - I sat my dad down in a swivel chair for this and he was in complete wonder the entire time.Archery games are on the menu – My old Dell headset would lose track of the controllers, but this headset has fish-eye lenses everywhere – Top, bottom, sides – If you put your hands behind your back, it even guesses!The controllers are clearly next level too – Touch sensitive in almost every way you can imagine – Even knowing when you’re ABOUT to touch a button -  Full grip control. Open your hand, it knows it. Squeeze your thumb? It knows. Point your finger! It knows! And it gets it perfect, every single time, with all hand sizes.They only take a single AA battery, but after about 15 hours of use I’ve not run through a set yet.Its not ALL sunshine and 3D Rainbows, however.There’s some Drama going on between Oculus and Steam – You used to be able to  use your computer completely through VR – This is no longer the case. You have to close the oculus app and open steam VR to launch Steam VR games. This didn’t used to be the case.Also, The very soft foam pads seem to absorb sweat – and because of how thick it is (yet comfortable in terms of pressure points) You do sweat a LOT. As a result – Unless you’re doing an “experience” type game – A lot of “gross” and “nasty” remarks will occur when you switch turns with someone – Sweat seems to stay in the soft foam for quite a while.  I don’t see a way around this, as the headset is somewhat heavy, so a large contact area and stretchy bands do a great job at holding it to your face – But also hold the moisture as well.Really the only major hurdle that VR needs to jump through now is Wireless – There’s a thick cord that handles Video, Data and sound. It’s a great length, However it requires a USB3.0 port, and if you have much else running on the same USB Hub (adjacent ports etc) you’re liable to get buggy tracking – Apparently this is pretty well using USB 3.0 to its maximum potential (Both in power draw and data transfer)This is the latest generation of VR – No External Sensors required. No clunky, semi permanent installation. Even the speakers are more streamlined - They're kind of like a aimed "duct" from the side of the band - They're not AMAZING sounding, but are more than adequate for casual use. For a fully immersive experience I recommend sound isolating earbuds that can plug into the included 3.5mm jack on the headset - They've really thought of everything!Requirements:I am running games on my Laptop, with a GTX 980M and it works well enough (Not for Max details etc) but fluid for more social games/experiences.On my Desktop, with a GTX 1080 and a i7 6700k everything is butter smooth no matter the game I play.So if you have the hardware to run this – It’s a fantastic setup, easy to use, and everything you need is in the box.Highly recommended
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 11 September 2019
review_title: No setup required - Easy to use and fantastic tracking from an all-in-one unit!

one_reviews_text: Have been using this on and off for about 2 months now and here are the impressions.USING THE RIFT S: Could not get the games running immediately for the first few days because I had to install and update some drivers in my PC. Then, ran the system compatibility checks and what not. So, took me about 2-3 days to do these slowly (don't have a lot of free time). But, once the systems were all in place and drivers all installed/updated and ready to go, downloaded some games to get started.EASE OF USE: I had never used an Oculus before, so for someone who is new to this device, it does take a few days to properly sort out the system, requirements, get the PC ready, and then learn the Oculus device, its controls and limitations. So, it takes at least a week (since I only had about an hour of free time each day for this) to master the controls and the interface. A friend who already owned an original Rift had absolutely no issues. So, some prior experience with the brand helps learn this faster.WHAT I LIKE:- Excellent tracking. No issues seen so far. Works without problem during the day and under bright ceiling lights at night.- Excellent resolution and graphics. Very impressed with the overall quality, and as my friend attests, you can see the improvements over the original Rift.- Love the fact that one USB connection is all it takes to connect the unit. So simple and effective design.- No issues installing and running the app on PC.WHAT I DON'T LIKE:- Not the most comfortable thing to wear on your head for hours. It starts getting uncomfortable after about 20-30 minutes. My friend thinks it is comfortable; but I start getting uncomfortable after about 20-30 minutes. Maybe it is just me.- Every now and then, the controllers stop tracking. So, there is definitely some sensor issues that Oculus needs to sort out and fix.- Not impressed with the audio out of the unit. Had to connect my headphones to get a full, vibrant audio experience.FINAL VERDICT: Clearly an improvement over the original Rift when it comes to graphics and resolution. However, a step back when it comes to audio because this one has no built-in headphones, so the sound out of the unit is meh. Everyone ends up using their own headphones to get a better audio experience. Those who expected the Rift S to have sorted out the bugs and issues will be disappointed because there are clearly some issues re: tracking and sensors. Those need to be sorted out if you want people to buy the Rift S. Otherwise, they will stick to their original Rift or move on to some other brand. Customer retention must be the Oculus' priority here.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 19 August 2019
review_title: Better graphics but poorer audio compared to the original Rift. Several issues need sorting.

one_reviews_text: This an other world of gaming.This concept is not for everyone tho. First of all, the installation wasn't so easy. You need to know or better you need to have the sufficient requirements for it to work on your PC or laptop.So beware before you buy it or install it.Minimum PC Spec Requirements: Graphics Card: NVIDIA GTX 1050Ti / AMD Radeon RX 470 or greaterNow once the settings is done it's take time for the app to download an approximate an 1 hour max.Now you need to set it up in a wide environment so you will be able to  play with no restrictions of space.After the set up it's done you can enjoy an other side of VR gaming.The head set is very comfy and adjustable it fit well and it doesn't move while playing or jumping. The sound is pretty good. The graphics are amazing but it all depends on your motherboard and power of your PC.The controllers are pretty responsive and lightweight. Batteries for the controllers comes with the package.Of course you need to create an account to be able to play and have some basic features.Overalls this VR headset Rift S is pretty impressive and this is an other ball game. The only 2 cons I have is the cable that as today the technology should be cordless and the other thing the price.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 26 June 2019

one_reviews_text: Hands down, one of the best VR experiences I played to date, and the external camera’s on the head unit provide excellent tracking, and the pass through feature is a nice touch.  Superb experience overall.  Installation went smoothly, but I’ve heard others having issues with the USB power. You need to have a full power USB 3 port, and don’t plug any additional accessories into the hub otherwise you may not have sufficient power. Shouldn’t be an issue if you’ve got a decent computer.  Suggest you check online and run their compatibility check.By far the most satisfying foray into VR, and this is my fourth VR headset.

one_reviews_text: I would love to give this product full stars based on my experience.Everything is fairly easy to set up, graphics and gameplay and the whole experience is awesome. Due to this being so new, I feel like it needs a lot of bug fixes and updates.At times, things are buggy and it recieves errors and crashes. review_date: Reviewed in Canada on 25 May 2019

one_reviews_text: Controllers;different but are the same. They are lighter than the cv1 but are thinner so if playing a fast moving game you will have to grip a little tighter. The straps on the controller feel lower quality but at the same time more comfortable to have on.  The controllers also vibrate at the top instead of the whole controller as well.Resolution/VisualSignificant resolution increase from Oculus Rift Cv1 (you WILL notice you can READ things much EASIER) but LCD instead of OLED, so blacks are a dim grey.Passthrough is a gift from heaven being able to see your room easily without ripping off the headset every time you want to do something!Tracking;Better but also different. Since it is inside-out-tracking there are blindspots. (Mostly behind you) Sticking your controller on the headset or really close around the headset will end up in loss in tracking. When you do lose tracking though it wont move until it finds the controller again.I do find the tracking is more solid than cv1 and wont lose tracking as easy as cv1 did. I can move my hands faster in front of me and they wont fly all over the place. Batteries are tighter inside the controller so they wont move as easy. (Which prevents disconnecting when playing high speed games such as beat saber)Ring is on top instead of bottom. I find this to be a different feeling but just something to get used to.IPD adjustment is 58-72mm. It is software based and not mechanically moving the lens left and right.Setup is super easy and It takes around 5 minutes in total. Plug it in. Then it does some installation and its done! Controllers are already linked to the headset! You will use a laser pointer to map out your play area using the passthrough lens (its like 2mp I swear) And your done!The halo design is sooo comfortable compared to the cv1! Its softer on the head too! Apparently it is also detachable (I haven't been able to yet) because on the Oculus store in the accessories panel you can buy the halo part. (Cool huh?)Audio;Its a disappointment. The audio has no bass to it like cv1 did and theres no headphones from Oculus to fix this. Sticking headphones over the headset was difficult but after I was able to do it, it was just fine I use Void Pros. Around $100 for those.Audio is like having two small phones playing music above your ears.Cables.Cable is 5Meters long and its thicker than cv1. Its display port and USB 3.0. Which means your graphics card needs a display-port or you need an adapter from hdmi to display-port. I do believe this is an improvement!Hopefully this Review helps!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 May 2019

review_title: Too many problems. Reddit is artificially boosting reviews.

one_reviews_text: I am a huge fan of Oculus Rift. Been following them since their Kickstarter. I owned the original Oculus Rift for about 2 years and decided to switch to the S to free up space on my desk.My complaints:The nose piece: I cannot stress enough how uncomfortable the rubber nose piece is. I don’t know what they were thinking with changing the nose design, because in its default place, there leaves a giant immersion breaking gap of light pouring in. When trying to adjust it, it pops right out and is a struggle to insert back in, due to weird insert shapes on both the device and the rubber (square shaped versus square with notch shape). When I was finally able to get the nose piece back in, I shifted it up (which means that it’s semi loose because there’s a tab in the center as well). It blocked out the light at the cost of making uncomfortable contact with my tear ducts. It’s also worth mentioning that the nose piece generates an uncomfortable amount of heat, to the point where I was sweating just from there in a casual game like vr chat. It’ll be a germ paradise in no time!The controllers: For anyone switching from the early Oculus Rift CV1 bundle like myself, you’ll notice an immediate downgrade in quality. The oculus rift S controllers that you HAVE to use for this device feel much more plastic-y and rough. Also, the inverted ring, which no one ever explained why they flipped it in the first place, shifts the weight balance a bit and is also a bit of a hazard in fast paced shooters. Now you have to worry about hitting the rings with your opposite controller. It happens a lot too. And because it’s a cheaper build quality, I can see these breaking a lot more frequently than I would’ve with my CV1 versions.The halo design: be ready to mess with the round nob on the back every time you take off your headset and put it on again. The weird design doesn’t give much way to slide back on. You’re always going to have to readjust for comfort, you’ll never have your Rift in a perfect sweet spot setting for longer than one session. The old oculus was Velcro strapped on all sides, so as long as you weren’t trying to show off to a guest, you had no need to adjust after finding that sweet spot. Those days are no more.Passthrough: I thought this would be a revolutionary breakthrough for VR, but my actual experience with it is disappointing as well. There’s a choppiness between all the video feeds that are trying to display a single frame. This is most evident around the borders of the lenses. The best way I can describe this disorienting experience is that things in motion, like your arms, are going to visually scatter in a dozen kaleidoscope like pieces. The slower you move and the more stationary things are around you, the more it generally looks like your room. In general, it’s hard to navigate my room. Oh and I wouldn’t have a problem with the black and white, but the way that it captures even low light is weird. The black and white has ridiculous brightness levels, so much so, that no, you cannot mess with your desktop when Steam bugs out (like it always has). A turned on monitor is a giant white light rectangle. Because of the design of this headset, you can’t lift it up like the original, you’ll have to completely take it off and you already know my qualms about that!IPD adjustment: This isn’t the normal complaint that’s been circulating around the Internet. I’ve got an average pair of eyes. My problem is that the darn software doesn’t work! The lenses remained stationary no matter what IPD number I adjusted into the settings. My entire experience on the Rift S was like peering into a porthole. Oh and you’re not going to see everything in a game. For VR Chat, I couldn’t see the microphone icon, I would have to push down on my headset just to see the icon. The software is bugged and I’m not keeping this headset long enough to wait for that fix.The only benefits: Simple and much quicker set up because of less cables. Sort of sharper resolution (I couldn’t really tell on account of rubber piercing my eyeballs).Final verdict: I’m probably never going to buy another Oculus product. I’m really upset at the lack of quality control that was put into this headset and the controllers. I fiercely defended them on all the social games and the forums, but I can’t stand by this product. For a first time VR user, it can very much give a bad presentation of what VR can do. For an experienced VR user, know that this is the very bottom line of VR gaming. Everything that comes out will be an upgrade... sadly, even the original CV1 from 3 years ago. If it’s not clear from everything I described, the comfort issues completely hinder my experience in the actual games. Most of these problems cannot be fixed with the product. I remain hopeful that Oculus will go back to the drawing board with the design. Either way, I’m not getting fooled one more time by this company.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 May 2019
review_title: A Total Downgrade from the Oculus Rift.

one_reviews_text: It was waiting patiently for a VR headset worth owning and Rift S was the first one that checked all the boxes for me:- Easy setup without base stations.- Higher res than first generation VR.- Reduced screen-door effect.- Reasonable price.I've played it only for a couple of hours and I can report it delivers exactly as promised. Tracking is great, comfort is good, everything just works. I was even surprised that it works well for me with my 71.5 IPD. I was able to fit my wide glasses in it too and the image quality was great. Using glasses reduces the field of view a bit, that's why I'm ordering prescription lenses for it.Overall it's a great product - if you are in the same place as myself waiting for the perfect time to get into the VR stuff, the time is now and this is your perfect first VR headset.

one_reviews_text: The Rift S now requires you to use a Facebook account.  If you have a legacy Oculus account, you have until 2023 to link it to a Facebook account.Facebook does not allow you to create a fake profile, so you will need to use a Facebook account with your real name.  I do not want my Oculus headset linked to my real identity in any way aside from payment information.  The risk of a Facebook "mistake" (Cambridge Analytica style) where my private VR gaming information is accessible to the public is simply too great.  Facebook claims you can continue to keep your gaming identity separate after linking your Oculus account to a Facebook account, but history says we should not take their word at face value.

one_reviews_text: Not a total upgrade, more of a scaled down simple version with a slightly better display?...- I couldn't get adjusted to the device as the manual adjustment options that the original had were missing from this version. So I suffered from issues due to IPD and the "visual sweet spot".  Unfortunately for those two reasons everything had a slight blur.  Youre forced with basically several options.  Tightening the headset and/or wearing it higher or lower which is not very comfortable at all. Everyone said it wouldn't be a big deal so I believed them and tried it... Not for me.- The SDE (Screen door effect).  It is still there but definitely not as noticeable as the previous version. Its OK, not great but noticeable. This results in slightly better clarity as well. But nothing to really be impressed with. If it was bothersome to you in the original then it'll bug you in this headset as well.Im picky about graphics. I built a nice gaming rig for those reasons so I was expecting to be really impressed but for $429 w/tax included I couldnt justify keeping it.  This isnt a complete upgrade, its a replacement for the discontinued original product.So if youre picky like me I would suggest waiting for more info on the Valve Index or just sticking to Track IR.

one_reviews_text: To preface this, I built a new computer specifically with VR in mind.When the headset arrived, the initial setup was simple and went off without a hitch. It worked for approximately 30 minutes and then would lose connectivity (cameras on headset would stop working which prevented any tracking from working). After spending several hours troubleshooting it, I opened a ticket on the same day the item was received.I then spent the next several days trying to troubleshoot the issues with members of the Oculus community while still waiting to hear back on my ticket. I tried every suggested fix with no luck. By the third day, a Friday, I had not heard back from Customer Support so I complained on Twitter and my issue was responded to immediately.I was given a generic list of steps to troubleshoot the device, and after confirming I had done them, was asked for my shipping information and then told that they would "get back to me".It's now been a week since I've purchased this item and still no solution, replacement, compensation has been offered. I am sending it back.It's unfortunate that the customer service and quality control from Oculus is so poor as I had really had my heart set on finally owning a VR headset.

review_title: Faulty hardware, no support from company

one_reviews_text: I LOVE, love, love my new VR system! I fell in love with the idea of VR with Google Cardboard and recently went to a local VR bar where they had the Oculus system. That sealed the deal for me. I was set on buying it after leaving, only to find out it required external tracking sensors, which I guess I didn't notice was setup in the play space at the bar :( But, I was all set on making it work somehow in my apartment  and was in the process of researching the best setup. Then I stumbled on the Rift S, and decided to hold out for it to avoid the hassle. Boy, am I glad I did!Being a VR newbie, my standards might be lower than others, but my mind was BLOWN straight out of the box! It was a breeze to setup, and I've been playing nearly non-stop since. Beat Saber is by far my favorite game so far.Cons so far:It gets really hot and sweat management is a problem in the headset. I rigged up a makeshift sweatband using sweater tights, and that's helping, but I do worry how it'll affect the headset in the long term. I make sure to take breaks and air it out every hour or so, but it would be nice to have some sort of ventilation system built in.The controllers are kind of wonky and I'm still getting used to them. This is probably a consequence of being new to the Oculus system...Pros: EVERYTHING ELSE. So much fun, I wake up sore everyday and I'm not mad at that AT ALL!I made sure to do my due diligence and research my system compatibility beforehand, and I had to upgrade a few things in my PC build, which I did before the system arrived. Everything worked as expected out of the box. Here are my system specs:AMD Ryzen 5 260016GB RAMWindows 10Nvidia GeForce GTX 1660MSI B450m mobo

review_title: In love with my new VR system!!!
